story:
Sans Soucie + Zero Waste Fashion + 35 days = New York Fashion Week.

Sans Soucie (S/S W) Womenswear Collection for Fall/Winter 2013 has been invited to show at the upcoming New York Fashion Week!!!  In our excitement, we have accepted their invitation but need help to raise funding to help produce, promote and allow for us to travel to and from Vancouver to New York in the next 35 days.  

Our invitation to showcase with Sugar Productions at the Bryant Park Hotel on September 13th during New York Fashion Week arrived within the past 24 hrs.   Our inaugural runway debut in New York City will be held alongside 9 other emerging international designers that have been hand picked for this event. This is an opportunity and dream of a lifetime and we need your help to make this dream happen! Will you help us? 

The purpose of this KICKSTARTER project is to acquire funds needed to help produce the Sans Soucie (S/S W) Womenswear Collection for Fall/Winter 2013, create promo materials and invitation for media and buyers, document work/photoshoot/website update as well as cover travels expenses to and from Vancouver to New York. 

We have alot of ground to cover over the next 35 days and hope your will allow us to create a one of a kind custom garment or accessory for you.  We are also offering our unique mending process to your existing garments.  For more information on customization or regarding your pledge please email us at info@sanssoucie.ca

To view current work ready for sale in our online studio sale please visit 

http://www.etsy.com/shop/sanssoucie

To view past work please visit www.sanssoucie.ca

story:
STRETCH GOAL: $3,500

We busted through our $1K goal.

Destroyed $2k in a few more days, then $2,500 a few days later. Let it be known that LNF fans are not only the most brazenly stylish, but the most generous. Who do you people think you are?!

And we still have two weeks left.

Your contributions have already made upgrades to shopladnamedfelix.com possible, we’ve received offers to carry LNF in boutiques in three separate cities, and when we reveal the final design for the Limited Edition Golden Globes pieces – yes, THOSE pieces – the power of crowdfunding will be made clear. Lad Named Felix has already begun a small renaissance, and we have big plans for the future.

So we want to make it to $3,500. And when we do, all contributors on every Tier will receive an exclusive LNF Paper Doll, drawn by A Sound of Thunder power frontwoman Nina Osegueda! Two pages of celebrilicious decadence, printed on heavy cardstock and just waiting for you to put clothes on his bare little body.

 

 

So share this campaign. Wear your LNF and when people ask about it, send them here. Throw in a little more for another Perk. You won’t regret it.

Love and metal,

~LNF


 

What is Lad Named Felix?

Lad Named Felix is inspired by glam rock, vintage quirk, and timeless style. Industrial and precious metals, gemstones, crystal, and glass play alongside unique found components, and the whole thing is peppered with sarcasm, sharp wit, and a modern edge. Described by fans as "retro-future glam", LNF's goal is create bold and versatile handmade statement pieces that move seamlessly from day to night and inspire their wearers to try a little transformation.

LNF is a Chicago-based small business run completely from the designer's loft, and has been a direct hit at dozens of art shows, gallery openings, and street festivals since 2009. LNF is proud to have styled the likes of such bands as A Sound of Thunder and Chicago's own GIRLBAND, and is currently available in select boutiques in the US.

During a half year's hiatus battling throat cancer, Lad Named Felix's owner and designer Jason P. Pike was unable to work, so the steady growth and evolution the line had enjoyed prior to his diagnosis halted. But he's back just in time for awards season!

Well, HE'S not going. The necklaces are. Don't get confused. Anyway. We'll get to that.

 

So What's the Story?

While spending a quiet afternoon stirring a pot of chili and wearing nothing but black underwear, LNF's owner and designer Jason P. Pike heard the jingle on his phone signalling a new email. He rolled his eyes at the interruption, but set the spoon down and swiped the screen open.

[Lad Named Felix] Golden Globe Awards Gift Bag Sponsorship Offer

So he opened it. Wouldn't you? Well, even if you wouldn't, he did. Which brings us to why we are gathered here today.

Lad Named Felix was scouted at it's website for this AMAZING opportunity and received a personal invitation: Include LNF's retro-future, glam rock radio pieces in the extremely exclusive VVIP gift bags that will be given to the Top 25 nominees at the 2013 Golden Globes.

Oh yeah, baby. V-VIP. Very VERY Important Persons. Extra adverb. That's HOT.

Twenty-five Limited Edition pieces, created specifically for the 2013 Golden Globes, will be designed and created 100% by hand, and have the chance to be photographed, seen by celebrity stylists, and receive national press. Tier Nine sponsors will also be on the exclusive list of owners of this gorgeous piece, which will be revealed soon!

Every small business needs it's Big Break, a golden moment,...and there is no gold more shiny than the Golden Globes. The exposure, the press, and the sheer glamour are more than enough reason to aim for the stars. At the end of the day, this campaign isn't just about going to the movies. It's about propelling a small business forward.
 
But we need your help to make it happen.
 

What Will My Contributions Make Possible?

  • Sponsorship Fee! LNF's mad negotiation skills ended in a stellar offer and a reduced fee for our sponsorship of the the 2013 Golden Globes VVIP gift bags. $600 of the goal will be used to pay that fee. Sponsorships are an industry-standard method of marketing, and for the Golden Globes, go as high as $20K. Who needs spa packages and free trips to Tahiti if you don't have your LNF, anyway?
  • Materials! Used to create twenty five custom designed, limited edition Lad Named Felix necklaces, this will include all chain, gemstones, crystal, clasps, custom-stamped LNF signature tags, and the tiny little trappings of jewelry design required to build each limited edition LNF piece. With your help, LNF will make the other items in those nominee gift bags look paltry, plain, positively plebeian.
  • Packaging! Imagine opening a sleek leather box and finding a LNF necklace dripping with glamour worthy not just of the Golden Globes and it's esteemed nominees, but in keeping with LNF's established history of quality, high style and unexpected glamour.
  • Marketing collateral! Pieces of art themselves, these sexy, limited edition postcards will tell the Who's Who, the What's What, and the Huh, What's That? of Lad Named Felix. Those of you who have purchased the appropriate Perks will not only see your name as official sponsors of LNF,  but wlll receive copies signed by LNF's designer, Jason P. Pike, perfect for making your friend wither in jealousy.
  • Shipping! LNF has yet to invent a way for necklaces to fly to their new owners around the globe, so it's FedEx with insurance, delivery confirmation, and required signature.

 

And, should your generosity and dedication to all things uncommon, eccentric, and sparkly exceed the $1,000 goal, the extra funding will go toward:

 

  • A Lad Named Felix Lookbook. Lookbooks are essential tools for marketing anything in the weird world of fashion. Many press outlets, boutiques, and even galleries will not give an company a second chance without one...so...a small portion of extra funding will be partially spent to create one from LNF's existing editorial, studio, and candid photography, as well as hire a photographer to shoot new collections.
  • Get a Bit of Help! Think "The Devil Wears Prada", but with less psychological torment. Contributions that put us over the mark will allow LNF to compensate friends and colleagues to help make this small business' dream come true. These superstars will assist in ensuring each parcel is perfect, and will pop a bottle of cheap champagne when the pieces are officially shipped. When the hangover is gone the next day, they will assist in ensuring perks go out on time.
  • A cheap bottle of champagne! See above.
  • Website Development. Jason is not a techie. We need help. Big help.
  • Adding extras to your Perks! Could be a piece created exclusively for LNF's Indiegogo backers. Could be exclusive discount codes or secret sales. Could be a signed cheesecake photo of Jason. Guess you'll just wait and see...

 

Should your altruism truly go beyond any reasonable expectation, pushing us past the $2000 mark and beyond, LNF will post new "Stretch Goals", each with their own amazing Perks that will be rewarded to contributors once the stretch goals have been met! More news as it develops...

 

Damn You and Your Sparkles! I'm in. What do I do?

Awesome. You'll find the funding denominations to the right of this amazing copy, each with their own perks! All you need to do is determine your contribution, and BLAMMO. Get to contributin'.

Perks get more exclusive by Tiers. The date all Perks will be shipped will be sent at campaign's end to all contributors. Any and all questions can be directed at ladnamedfelix(at)gmail(dot)com.

  • Sponsors: All contributors $50 and up will be listed as official LNF Sponsors on the postcards included in the VVIP Golden Globes gift bags and at shopladnamedfelix.com. Bronze, Silver, and Gold Sponsors will be listed as such and be displayed more prominently. Sponsor names can be personal or business names.

Wardrobe Malfunction and J'Adore Couture can be seen below:

  

 

Cool. But I'm Broke and Still Want to Help!

No worries! We get it. Money is tight. Here at LNF, we trade with fellow Chicago artists and designers all the time, exchanging jewelry for photo shoots, or baubles for drinks or cookies at gallery shows. In 2011, LNF donated fourteen one of a kind pieces to various charity auctions and benefits. We love that there is always a way to help someone with something. Can't contribute to our goal with your wallet? Here are some great free ways to help make LNF's dream come true"
  • Signal Boost! Share this campaign in your social media circles. Tweet it. Share it. Like it. Indiegogo has tools embedded right in this campaign that make it a one-click thing, which means you can go right back to putting on that finishing coat of mascara without any trouble. at all.
  • "Like" Lad Named Felix on Facebook. It's a bit of a party there, you'll get to see new pieces as they are posted, and is the only place to interact personally with LNF's designer, Jason P. Pike, who likes to curse and give things away.
  • Email This Campaign to Your Rich Friends.
  • Volunteer! If you're in Chicago and want to help fill those sexy little VVIP bags, contact Lad Named Felix at shopladnamedfelix.com and let us know what you'd like to do!

 

WAIT! Before You Go Contribute..

Thank you, from the very bottom of our little Swarovski-encrusted heart, for helping the dream of a small business explode into reality. This is the biggest opportunity LNF has ever received, and has already begun changing the game for us. Your contributions and sharing make EVERY. SINGLE. BIT. Of difference.

story:
ANNOUNCEMENT:

The campaign has taken a fabulous new direction! As we enter the final days we are proud to announce that any further funds recieved through this campaign will be utilized in the production of a fantastic fundraiser fashion show and auction on June 28th in Seattle! The show, entitled BeDecked! will bring together Artists and Designers from around the Northwest and help springboard us to our final goal both in recognition and finances. Your support is greatly appreciated, especially if you are unable to make it to the show on the 28th! Thanks again for supporting Lime Light Fashion!

 

 

The Story/The Vision

Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign!

Lime Light Fashion is currently a teeny tiny one-woman web based business providing hard to find stage jewelry, one of a kind super-glam clothing items, specialized costume accessories and custom costuming services to the stage performer, pageant community and women of all ages for special occasions. The goal of my project is to raise money to open a costume, gown and accessories warehouse superstore/fashion show & music venue in Seattle. Let me share a little bit about the overall vision:

Lime Light Fashion Playland will be a true destination shopping experience. We'll carry Angelique Ashton Designs of course, as well as the cutting edge designs of a couple fellow designers I already have lined up, pageant and stage jewelry, specialized performance needs such as belly dance accessories, rodeo/western wear, burlesque and ballroom costumes, corsets, hats, tu-tus, feather boas, heels and evening gowns . . . but the main attraction will be that the store has a runway and a full stage for live shows. It will be a boutique by day where ladies can pick up anything their heart desires for a costume or performance, and will be encouraged to step out of the dressing room onto the runway to work it – then by night the place will transform into the city's premier fashion venue, hosting fashion shows, bachelorette parties, and musical acts. On a regular basis, the store will host Lime Light events to showcase local talent and provide fashion students and new designers opportunities to have their work seen.

It will be a world unto itself, a parallel universe where a girl can still play dress up, no matter her age. It will be a safe place, where people are free to express who they are and have fun with it. Our multifaceted mission will be to spread glitter all over the community, promote self-esteem in teens and young women, promote safe and natural cosmetics and support the local Artist and fashion community. It will be the shimmery ethereal magical princess wonderland from inside my head, on the outside of my head. We will have champagne and cupcakes and live unicorns. I thought about cotton candy, but honestly, I'm not sure I want people with sticky fingers handling everything and petting my unicorns. I mean, they aren't self-bathing like cats . . .

What We Need & What You Get

You get the general idea. It seems that to have a snowball's chance at getting a traditional small business loan these days (or even interest from many Angel Investors) that I need to plan to have about 20% of what I ultimately need to borrow of my own “skin in the game.” In setting the final goal amount for this campaign I thought about setting the goal at $75,000, which is what my estimates project I'll need to actually get doors open, but I decided to keep it realistic and shoot for just enough to get me to the next step – the bank loan. After the bank loan is obtained, funds raised through this campaign can then go towards initial space build out (such as construction of the runway) and equipment, inventory, décor and advertising.

If by chance the unthinkable should happen and I meet my funding goal here but then fail to secure a loan to be able to actually get the store open, or I don't come anywhere near my goal, the journey will not end there. Plan B is to use whatever is raised here to bolster Lime Light Fashion's internet business by investing in a professional re-design, additional inventory and some advertising including producing lines for a couple more fashion shows in the coming year. After another year of running a successful web business and showing my work in larger and more professional arenas, I would then try again to get the loan to open the physical store. So, it may be a long road ahead, but I have faith that it eventually ends up at the same place no matter how far or arduous the journey.

The Impact

 Any contribution no matter how big or small helps and will be forever appreciated! The rewards offered for supporters will also be honored regardless of how long it takes me to get the store open. The last thing on earth I want to do is disappoint anyone who supported me along the way in this. Please consider contributing to my campaign if you would like to one day come and walk the runway and party with us at Lime Light Fashion Playland! Thank you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help my campaign go viral and share share share! Tell everyone you know, especially people interested in Fashion, Seattle, Performance Arts, and sparkly things!

story:
My Story

One day my girlfriend's phone was stolen from her backpack in urban place (not sure why she put the phone in the backpack). She was very upset(mainly is because the photo inside) and ask me if I can find some way to prevent it happen again (first come to my mind is don't put it in the backpack again, but it seem not good for her).  Then she come up with few rules I should include in the solution that I need to come up.

  1. Do not want to have lock. because she will lost the key or forget the 
  2. She want to open the backpack as easy and as fast as before.(I think is the hardest part)
  3. Give her a bonus feature, since she add one stuff to her backpack so she want it useful. (How about two rules)

Searching, Thinking and Searching

Finally I find the solution, ZipperGuard. ZipperGuard is simple to setup, just tie the rope to the zipper then you ready to use. 

Put the little plastic stick thru the other zipper then the bag is security. 


She is happy to have ZipperGuard and I am happy too, because one of my problem solved. 


Today, I want to share this here, then I can put ZipperGuard in mass production. I hope the thing happen to us will not happen to you with the help of Zipperguard.

Hope you can support it. Thank You for you time.
story_txt:
My Story
One day my girlfriend's phone was stolen from her backpack in urban place (not sure why she put the phone in the backpack). She was very upset(mainly is because the photo inside) and ask me if I can find some way to prevent it happen again (first come to my mind is don't put it in the backpack again, but it seem not good for her).  Then she come up with few rules I should include in the solution that I need to come up.


Do not want to have lock. because she will lost the key or forget the 
She want to open the backpack as easy and as fast as before.(I think is the hardest part)
Give her a bonus feature, since she add one stuff to her backpack so she want it useful. (How about two rules)






Searching, Thinking and Searching
Finally I find the solution, ZipperGuard. ZipperGuard is simple to setup, just tie the rope to the zipper then you ready to use. 


Put the little plastic stick thru the other zipper then the bag is security. 

She is happy to have ZipperGuard and I am happy too, because one of my problem solved. 


Today, I want to share this here, then I can put ZipperGuard in mass production. I hope the thing happen to us will not happen to you with the help of Zipperguard.


Hope you can support it. Thank You for you time.

story:
Horse On A Treadmill T-Shirt

We are Virginia Tech students who share a similar passion for Horse On A Treadmill.  Join the movement and spread the word today! Thanks and gallop on! 


                       

Why Crowdfunding?

The cost to produce individual t-shirts is much higher than buying in bulk. This site helps us give each individual a t-shirt at a much lower price. Our main mission is to see this shirt on every location around campus. We need you to join the movement by pitching in and getting your own shirt today! 




  • No shirts will be shipped unless we meet our goal
  • You will not be charged until the goal is met
  • FREE pickup will be held on campus (Virginia Tech)
  • If you have any questions, please email kyleh49@vt.edu

story:
Hi! My name is Alex London 'm a fashion designer based out of NYC and the owner and lead designer of Corvus + Crux. Recently, I won RAW: Natural Born Artist's  Designer of the Year Award!!  Sadly, we live fairly close to the edge here at Corvus + Crux so getting out to the awards show out in LA is a bit of a stretch for everyone here.

What I'm trying to do is to be able to raise enough money for me and an assistant to get out to LA for  a few days for the event and a couple of meetings.  I need to be able to cover air fare, hotel, and food. 

The number that we came up with is 1,900 for 6 nights +  travel.
  •  Two days of prep for the collection ( fittings, alterations, pressing / steaming )
  • Saturday RAW: Natural Born Artists has all of the winners doing interviews ect
  • Sunday! Awards Show!
  • Monday / Tuesday are our Meetings Days!  
Through the magic of Kayak.com I've been able to find some REALLY cheap flights but I need to book this soon before the rates go up.  So help if you can this will be a really cool experience for everyone involved and I hope to have this be a kickass show!


THE ARTIST AND BRAND:

CORVUS

noun \ˈkȯr-vəs\

: a small constellation adjoining Virgo on the south

CRUX

noun \ˈkrəks, ˈkru̇ ks\

: an essential point requiring resolution or resolving

an outcome

with love,

CORVUS 十 CRUX



CORVUS 十 CRUX is the rebirth of American born designer Alex London. Based out of NYC, CORVUS 十 CRUX possesses a deep need to to capture the images seen in the darkest and most beautiful parts of the human mind. To that end, the label uses less than conventional techniques to achieve each vision. Our lead designer, Alex London began designing formally at the F.I.T Pre-college program at fifteen. Alex attended Parsons and held various internships before a chance encounter with another designer allowed a mentor-ship that created the foundation, skills, and drive for Alex to pursue a solo career. In the fall of 2010, Alex officially created the signature label "ALEX LONDON." However, after several years of business Alex was no longer affiliated with the original label. In the spring of 2013 the designer was tempted to move on under a new brand. CORVUS 十 CRUX is the product of this renewal in life and in art, with the staples of collections that evoke the dark, dramatic, and ethereal, drawing inspiration from worlds of another time and of another fantasy. Long flowing gowns and high collars evoke a sense of the grandeur, while low necklines, low backs, and beautiful fits accentuate the beauty of the feminine form. Each piece is sculpted with unconventional techniques and individual care to play with the strengths of each fabric.

Publications include Vogue Taiwan, a Vogue gallery exhibition, Harper's Bazaar Vietnam, ELLE Vietnam, Hunger Magazine, Twelve, Adon, Factice, Kurv, Jimon, and Z!NK Magazine March cover featuring Taylor Momsen. CORVUS 十 CRUX pieces have been worn by many celebrities that include Carmen Dell'Orefice, Anne Hathaway, Taylor Swift, Pamela Anderson, Kat Deluna, Raja Gemini, and Amanda Palmer. CORVUS 十 CRUX 's first pret-a-porter collection "Blood Red, Sister Rose" was released exclusively in Japan via Monoco. CORVUS 十 CRUX made a surprise appearance in the most recent campaign for Canon Japan with makeup artist Yuko Takahashi as well as an advertorial campaign with Lexus.

Recently, Taylor Momsen has recently worn several pieces for her new music video for her highly anticipated new single " Going to Hell ". We were thrilled to get the chance to work with her again and hope to make this a long lasting relationship.
Taylor's single released 9/19/2013

CORVUS 十 CRUX would love to hear from you! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or comments you may have.

new york, new york
tel: (347) 688-5265
email:
contact@corvuscrux.com
press@coravuscrux.com
sales@corvuscrux.com
web:
www.corvuscrux.com



PERKS!

( WHY ELSE ARE YOU DOING THIS? )



$1: SHOUT OUT AND THANK YOU!

You will receive a whole ton of love from the CORVUS + CRUX team! Every little bit helps and we will always remember even the smallest contributions <3

Snag this super cool opportunity to get a shout out to our massive following and a 25% discount code to our sample sale at http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/

Grab a high resolution digital download to make into a print up to 45 inches in height as well as our exclusive 25% discount code to our sample sale http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/

Take one of our hand draped and over-sized 100% wool scarf/hoods with a modern rogue edge - as well as our exclusive 25% discount code to our sample sale http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/


* Add $10 for International Shipping


$75: DRAPED MODAL JERSEY TANK TOP

Snatch up one of our draped modal jersey tanks in black from the RTW collection ' Blood Red Sister Rose ' - as well as our exclusive 25% discount code to our sample sale http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/

* Add $10 for International Shipping * Sized Small, Medium, and Large. Send us an email at the time of your donation with your desired size option

$100: OOAK HANDPLEATED SILK SCARF

Get one of our brand new neoprene dresses at a discounted rate ( AVAILABLE IN  NUDE, PLUM, AND BLACK )  - as well as our exclusive 25% discount code to our sample sale http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/

* Add $10 for International Shipping * Sized 0,2,4,6,8. Send us an email at the time of your donation with your desired size option.


$350: DECONSTRUCTED SILK CHARMEUSE DRESS

Snag a remake of our classic dress from the 2011 Fall / Winter collection ' Kagami ' in a luscious mahogany brown silk charmeuse - as well as our exclusive 25% discount code to our sample sale http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/

* Add $10 for International Shipping * Sized 0,2,4,6,8. Send us an email at the time of your donation with your desired size option.


$500: LEATHER AND WOOL ASYMMETRICAL DRAPED COAT

You will receive one of our hand made leather shoulder and sleeved wool asymmetrical draped coats - as well as our exclusive 25% discount code to our sample sale http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/

* Add $10 for International Shipping * Sized Small, Medium, and Large. Send us an email at the time of your donation with your desired size option.


$1000: CUSTOM GOWN VALUED TO 1,000.00 !!!

Take the chance to get a custom made gown/look/shirt/pants/ect exactly to your liking!!! Valued up to 1,000.00 Perfect for a bride looking for a unique gown that will really be a show stopper - as well as our exclusive 25% discount code to our sample sale http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com/

* Add $20 for International Shipping * At the time of your donation send us an email and we will start the design consultation to make sure you get exactly what you want!



Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you can't contribute you can still get the word out! Every share, tweet, post, and status update is an opportunity to be able to get the word out and get us to our goal! If 1,800 people see this and donate one dollar we will have reached our goal! Plus, Every dime we can put into this ourselves we will at the first opportunity.

Also! Keep in mind, if you would rather not donate and would prefer to own a piece from our past collections for yourself check out our sample sale at http://alex-london-corvus-crux.goodsie.com

Thanks so much guys!!!
with love,
CORVUS 十 CRUX

story:
Wear a Cosby sweater for Christmas this year and support Children Incorporated! https://childrenincorporated.org/

Children Incorporated is a child sponsoring organization that is based in Richmond, Virginia. Thanks to past and current supporters around the globe, Children Incorporated now has over 300 projects in 23 countries which serve over 15,000 children annually. To date, over 250,000 children have been provided opportunities for growth and education and experienced the support and encouragement Children Incorporated programs provide.Children Incorporated envisions a world in which each and every child has the education, resources, and opportunity to build a better life.

 

Once our project is funded, a crew of fashion design students from various schools in NY will create replicas of the best sweaters that the Cosby family wore during the 8 seasons of "The Cosby Show."

Including:

The Track Sweater!

 

The Comb Sweater!

 

This Thing!

 

And many more!

Once completed, the sweaters will be auctioned off online.

And in December, people will be invited to a Cosby Sweater fund raising party and most of the proceeds will be donated to Children Incorporated.

We're really hoping that Beyonce and Jazy-Z will help out with publicity by putting on some sweaters and making a video for us, or by attending our party and maybe performing for a minute or two. Send them Tweets, guys! (In case you didn't sense it, that was mostly a joke. But if you can actually get their attention, go ahead and let them know.)

What We Need & What You Get

$20,000 will go toward renting a space and hiring a crew of knitters who will be supplied with the best sweater making materials around, and a few snacks to keep them energized. The sweaters will be comfortable, cozy and definitely not itchy.
 
$10,000 will be used to set up the Christmas Eve party.
 
The remaining $5,000 will be used for marketing and to build the website where the sweaters will be auctioned off.

The Impact

50% of the proceeds made from the sales of the sweaters (which we expect to be in the six figures range) will be donated to Children Incorporated in January, as well as most of the proceeds made from the sweater party.

We will also ship boxes of little sweaters to the children, like this one with the dinosaur:

Cute! But we will also ship some plain sweaters for the ones who aren't flashy.


(Thanks to The Cosby Sweater Project for the image above.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word around! And again, send tweets to Beyonce.

story:
InvigorateMe graced the market in December 2013 by Tanesha McDonald providing fashionable, affordable accessories to young ladies interested in “giving life” to their image. In 2014, InvigorateMe gained incredible consumer support for its release of HANDMADE, customizable infinity scarves.

Over the past year, we received an incredible amount of positive attraction. More people started to contact us showing interest on our designs across the United States, and our social media followers continues to increase. Even with the hot weather, requests for the winter scarves are still being demanded.

Due to the positive response to our customer service, we are more excited more than ever to provide more customizable options We want to make a step further in providing one-of-a-kind designs by releasing a collection of handmade jewelry, not only for ladies, but also for MEN!

Beginning by August 2015, ALL InvigorateMe designs (jewelry and scarves) will now be handmade with the finest hand-picked leather, metals, and charms. Each design will be made to reflect the goal, style, and attitude of the consumer.

Your Role

This is where I need your help!

With your help we could reach our goal of $10,000 to buy the tools and materials needed, produce samples, and boost marketing and branding. Your involvement will make it possible for us to impact the world with quality expression of our consumers WITHOUT DELAY. 

Any amount is helpful and will be allocated to the launch of our newest products. However, anyone who donates $100 or more to this campaign, will receive a permanent 50% discount on all InvigorateMe products (in addition to any other discount or sale offered).

Other Ways to Help

If you're not able to financially support, you could still help us by spreading the word about InvigorateMe to your friends and family:

  • Ask your friends and family to get the word out there about us.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on top of the page to show people our campaign.
  • Follow us Facebook and Instagram (@invgme)

Thank you in advance for your support...in any way possible!!

story:
We are committed to building a new experience for makers, innovators, builders and designers. 

 

 

 

We started this journey out of a passion for prototyping and purchased a couple lower-end printers for “beginners” to bring our ideas to life. The printers were fairly easy to set up, but the print quality was poor and the interface simplistic, but not easy. Then we bought a couple of the high-end machines - and when perfectly set up, they print well. But the set-up took way more time than we had expected - it was too technical and the interface too convoluted. And then there was the cost… 

 

So we had to ask: why aren’t there any mid-range printers that are affordable, easy-to-use, and have excellent print-quality? This is why we created NEA - an elegant, modular, and upgradeable 3D Printer that is made to last...and is not a $200 gimmick. 

A True Desktop Printer. 


 

 


 

 



 



 

 

 

 

 

 

Still can't decide? This video will help!

 

 


*all printers come with a free 1lb spool of filament!
 

 

NEA uses a technology called "Fused Filament Fabrication" or "FFF". This may be compared to a super small glue gun that carefully pushes or "extrudes" melted filament made of plastics, like PLA or ABS, out the hot end. The plastic is printed layer-by-layer in predefined cross sections which cool and harden almost instantly.

 

 

With each iteration of our prototype stages, NEA 3D printers have improved overall print quality.  Early on, we were excited just to get something printed, but since then our focus has been on reaching the perfect balance between accuracy, speed, reliability and repeatability. Maintaining a standard of quality can only be achieved by acquiring and designing the most precise components with the entire printer in mind.  We use a combination of small incremental stepper motors with custom slider blocks to handle all axis of movement; combined with our rigid build quality and Vibration Dampening Tech® and you get world class prints!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

NEA is super space-conservative with the best footprint-to-build-volume ratio in each class. Print more, take up less desk space. The only place we cut corners is the corners. Don't be square!
 

 

NEA is so space efficient because of our "gantry" or "print axis mechanics".  Most printers waste a lot of space by moving their print heads up, down and around an immobile print bed. NEA is different because our print bed actually moves back and forth on the Y axis, while the print head moves left and right as it climbs upwards on the Z axis. This means there is no wasted space around the outside of the print bed. Our design is the only cylindrical shaped FFF 3D printer on the market - which just happens to look pretty awesome!

 

 

Ever heard the saying "Round is Sound"? Compared to conventional box shaped printers that keep the vibrations inside the printer, NEA's cylindrical metal uni-body has no weak spots and reduces pesky vibrations by dissipating in an outward direction.  As a result you will gain far greater longevity on your printer components.

 

 

 

 

3D printing is evolving very quickly. That's why we made NEA modular. Future upgrades and maintenance are done in a snap. We have a ton of cool upgrades coming - like multi-color, multi-head, and even full colour printing.  Expect us to tackle higher print speeds and multi-mediums as well.  Gone are the days of buying a brand new printer every time a new feature comes along.  Your investment in NEA won’t leave you behind!
 

 

 

NEA's Extruder Head, Drop & Lock Shelf and Core Drawer are removable - without tools! This is very important if you plan on keeping your printer for more than a year. If any mechanical or electrical component on your NEA were to break or malfunction, just pop it off and send it back.  As soon as you receive your replacement module, snap it right back on and away you go. No need to return the entire printer and wait and wait and…...

 

 

 

 


Extruder Head - This is where the magic happens: it contains the gears that push the filament into the hot end. The tip melts the filament and brings your creations to life!

Drop & Lock Shelf - No, this is not a dance move. It’s a shelf that holds the motor that slides the Extruder Head along the X-axis, AND, at the same time, moving itself up and down along the Y-axis and controlling the Cool Spool elevator.

 

Core Drawer - When NEA is powered down the Core Drawer allows you to view, clean, maintain and even upgrade the electronic components in a snap. Think of it like a fully removable sock drawer full of robot brains. Not to mention the PRO and PRO+ models come with a robust 450 watt. A power supply this stable can power NEA with ease, and run future upgrades that require more juice.

Cool Spool - We love this!  The Cool Spool is our custom designed filament cartridge.  It wrangles the filament to remove potential twisting and breakage.  The best part about the Cool Spool is that it automatically lifts, allowing for the additional 2 inches in the Z-axis once the Drop & Lock Shelf reaches it’s vertical limit.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Here are just a few NEA prints you may have seen in the video. 

A special thanks goes to the talented people who designed these objects. 

  • Spiral Vase (modified) - be3D_printers
  • Juicer - Thav
  • Origamix Rabbit - Mirice
  • Bracelet - Roman Hegglin
  • Tree Frog - Morena Protti
  • Robot - Make (makezine.com)
  • Fender Guitar Knobs - Patrick Wiatt
  • Eiffel Tower - Michael Joyce
     

 

Our Goal is to make 3D printing more accessible and friendly.  That's why NEA is a high performance machine for all experience levels. Key features like Self-Leveling Bed, Open Source software and Non-proprietary filament means NEA is easy to set up the way you want it.

Self-Leveling Bed - Manually leveling a print bed can be a real pain. Not only is it often a complicated and time consuming process, but, if done wrong, will have compounding negative effects on your prints. NEA automatically self-levels every time you print. It can't get any easier!

Open Source software - Software for a 3D printer is kind of like an operating system for your phone or computer. If you are used to a specific one, its hard to use others. This is why we made NEA compatible with most 3rd party and open source software applications.

Non-proprietary filament - NEA 3D filament is a high grade PLA and offered at an awesome price. We've carefully selected high quality filaments which work especially well with NEA printers. But feel free to use other brands’ 1.75mm filaments with NEA (and use our filament with other printers too!).  We have filaments ranging from  basic PLA and ABS plastics, to Nylon, Carbon Fibre and metalized plastic hybrids.  NEA will be offering upgrades to higher temperature hot ends to facilitate the use of the more exotic filaments.

 

 
Out of the box NEA is ready to go! Simply plug it in, follow the simple instructions and you will be printing in minutes -it’s that easy. Our goal is to make the best experience possible. That’s why NEA's software comes with video tutorials to guide you every step of the way.
 

SOFTWARE
Software is the key to creating successful 3D prints. It takes years and countless revisions to create "usable" software, but we wanted NEA's software to be fantastic right out of the box. So we teamed up with one of the best names is 3D printing software, Repetier. Their extremely refined software has been in development for years and has features like no other. NEA will come ready to print with a customized version -  specific to your model, so no setup will be required.
 
 
 

Here are some of the many features offered with the NEA Repetier software.

 

 

  • Easy and intuitive to Learn.
  • Multi-extruder Support for future innovations. *Hint Hint
  • NEA added self-levelling
  • Supports several slicers for best printing results.
  • Preview resulting print with selectable layer ranges.
  • Live preview of printer action and temperature curves.
  • Send push messages on status changes using phone app.
  • Windows, Linux or Mac OS X compatible.
  • Integrated NEA Specific Tutorials and Help + UI upgrades
  • Slice with CuraEngine or Slic3r.
  • Alternatively integrates Skeinforge as second slicer.
  • STL composer - place, rotate and scale your STL files on your print bed and store or slice it.

 

There are so many great features here, but if you are more comfortable with other open source or 3rd party software packages, NEA 3D printers are willing and able!  Below is a list of known of compatible software packages that will work with your NEA printer.

 

  • Cura
  • Simplify3d
  • Octo-Print
  • Autodesk Spark
  • Ponterface
  • Kisslicer

 

 

After our reveal at CES in Las Vegas last January, NEA's campaign was set to launch in early February 2015. However, an amazing week at the show with industry reps and makers from the global community made us realize NEA still needed some improvements. We are not going to be a perpetual-start up company with a one-off product. We want to make an experience that will revolutionize the 3D world.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Refer a friend to purchase a printer and reap the rewards! 

Get up to 3 rolls of filament to share with friends!

For more information on how it all works check out the updates page.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

NEA would not have been possible without the help and support we've received along our journey. We are incredibly grateful for all the advice, guidance and kind words. Here is just a small list in no particular order.

Thank you so much!

 

 

 

 

 

 

With any crowd funded campaign there are risks to us as a company, but no more than the risk that you take by supporting us.  While we are proud of our 3D Printer and believe you will love it,  this is simply just the very beginning of our journey.

We have invested our time, resources and passion into turning this dream into a collective reality. And with your support, the possibilities for future innovations are already in the works. Our diverse team has been in the creative services and technology industries for years - and we know how to deliver.

NEA will be no different. NEA will deliver.

 

 

 

 
[Shipping] What are the shipping costs?
Shipping rates will average between $50-$100USD in North America and will be determined during the backer survey post pledge. We will follow up with pledgers with our shipping calculator to ensure the best rate possible before fulfilment. Canadians are subject to relevant provincial and territorial taxes. Applicable duties and taxes could apply to customers outside of Canada.

[REFUND] What is your refund policy?
Per Indiegogo standard and our own return policy, we do not offer refunds. However, if there are perk changes or additions you would like to make please contact us at info@nea3d.com.

[Production] What production phase are you currently in?
We are currently alpha testing our latest prototypes. Since CES, we have reduced the number of total components by 50 percent.  We have been working closely with our prototyping and manufacturing partners to find the ideal combination of materials and processes.  Our goal is to reveal our Beta at CE Week in NY this June.
 
[Manufacturing] Where are you manufacturing the NEA printers?
NEA printers will be manufactured and assembled in North America. Nearly every component has been researched, designed, produced and assembled in our local offices here in Toronto and Rochester NY.
 
[Manufacturing] How can you make these printers so affordable?
Our designers have spent many months engineering out costs to minimize components and labor, especially for the PRO PLUS model.  Each custom component has been meticulously designed to ensure little to no waste while maximizing overall print volume and quality.
 
[Media] I am with the media who should I contact?

Please find all press and media related content at www.nea3d.com.

Press Kit:Download April 30 Media Kit

Contact: info@NEA3D.com
 
[Shipping] When will my printer arrive? 
Quarter 3 of 2015
 
[Pricing] What will the market prices be for NEA after your crowdfund?
Mini US$1,995; PRO US$2,995; PRO-PLUS US$4,995 MSRP. They will most likely street for less.
 
[Features] What comes with the printer? 
Your NEA 3D printer will come stock, 1lb of filament with a cool spool, an instruction manual, and a NEA power cable.
 
[Software] What programs/software can be run with NEA
NEA will come equipped with Repetier firmware and host software out of the box, however NEA is compatible with all open source firmware/software bundles as well.
 
[Set-Up] How much calibration/set up is needed to print?
If you can set-up a coffee maker, you can set-up a NEA. Auto leveling and easy to use software make NEA ready to print shortly after taking it out of the box!
 
[Set-Up] Is there a mobile app available for NEA?
Yes. We will be offering a mobile app for OS and Android devices that will grant remote access through your favorite web browsers.
 
[Filament] What size filament diameter is used with NEA printers?
Initially, NEA will accept 1.75mm filament diameters, we will be offering upgrades to larger diameters shortly.
 
[Filament] What types of filaments can I use
We primarily recommend using PLA, but other plastic-based material, including ABS, can be used. We are hoping to offer a modular piece that can print Nylon and other higher temp materials, 300+ degrees celsius, in the near future.
 
[Partners] Who is Playfight?
Playfight is a visual effects and 3D Modeling company with decades of combined experience in the 3D industry. They will be contributing greatly to the Phase 1 launch of NEATSTUFF providing tutorials and premium model packs for download.
[Community] When will NEATSTUFF officially launch?

NEATSTUFF is aiming to launch during CE Week in NY City this June.

[Set-Up] How are you compensating for misaligned XY resonance issues as you go higher on the Z for the larger models?

Our printer utilizes parts recommended for higher-end CNC and precise machining. Rather than relying on a belt system, we use acme threaded rods for X, Y, and Z movements. We are proud to say that the NEA Pro and Pro Plus models will take advantage of our vibration dampening technology. While users will still need to print with "support material", our XY resonance issues are significantly reduced using our tech.

[Features] Can I get NEA in other colors?
Yes. We are happy that we can offer you NEA printers in multiple colors. Color variations will be made available post-pledge as an upsell.
 
[Warranty] What is your warranty policy
We ensure a 90 day limited hardware warranty. Extended warranties to one year are available post-pledge as an upsell as well. These will be priced as follows: NEA MINI - $70; NEA PRO - $90; and NEA PRO+ - $125.

We are committed to building a new experience for makers, innovators, builders and designers. 
 
 
 
We started this journey out of a passion for prototyping and purchased a couple lower-end printers for “beginners” to bring our ideas to life. The printers were fairly easy to set up, but the print quality was poor and the interface simplistic, but not easy. Then we bought a couple of the high-end machines - and when perfectly set up, they print well. But the set-up took way more time than we had expected - it was too technical and the interface too convoluted. And then there was the cost… 
 So we had to ask: why aren’t there any mid-range printers that are affordable, easy-to-use, and have excellent print-quality? This is why we created NEA - an elegant, modular, and upgradeable 3D Printer that is made to last...and is not a $200 gimmick. A True Desktop Printer.  
 
 
 

 

 
 

 

 
 
 

Still can't decide? This video will help!
 
 
*all printers come with a free 1lb spool of filament! 

 
NEA uses a technology called "Fused Filament Fabrication" or "FFF". This may be compared to a super small glue gun that carefully pushes or "extrudes" melted filament made of plastics, like PLA or ABS, out the hot end. The plastic is printed layer-by-layer in predefined cross sections which cool and harden almost instantly. 
 
 With each iteration of our prototype stages, NEA 3D printers have improved overall print quality.  Early on, we were excited just to get something printed, but since then our focus has been on reaching the perfect balance between accuracy, speed, reliability and repeatability. NEA is so space efficient because of our "gantry" or "print axis mechanics".  Most printers waste a lot of space by moving their print heads up, down and around an immobile print bed. NEA is different because our print bed actually moves back and forth on the Y axis, while the print head moves left and right as it climbs upwards on the Z axis. Compared to conventional box shaped printers that keep the vibrations inside the printer, NEA's cylindrical metal uni-body has no weak spots and reduces pesky vibrations by dissipating in an outward direction.  As a result you will gain far greater longevity on your printer components.
 
 

 
 3D printing is evolving very quickly. That's why we made NEA modular. Future upgrades and maintenance are done in a snap. We have a ton of cool upgrades coming - like multi-color, multi-head, and even full colour printing.  Expect us to tackle higher print speeds and multi-mediums as well.  Gone are the days of buying a brand new printer every time a new feature comes along.  Your investment in NEA won’t leave you behind! 
  
NEA's Extruder Head, Drop & Lock Shelf and Core Drawer are removable - without tools! This is very important if you plan on keeping your printer for more than a year. If any mechanical or electrical component on your NEA were to break or malfunction, just pop it off and send it back.  As soon as you receive your replacement module, snap it right back on and away you go. Drop & Lock Shelf - No, this is not a dance move. It’s a shelf that holds the motor that slides the Extruder Head along the X-axis, AND, at the same time, moving itself up and down along the Y-axis and controlling the Cool Spool elevator.

Here are just a few NEA prints you may have seen in the video. 

A special thanks goes to the talented people who designed these objects. 

Spiral Vase (modified) - be3D_printers
Juicer - Thav
Origamix Rabbit - Mirice
Bracelet - Roman Hegglin
Tree Frog - Morena Protti
Robot - Make (makezine.com)
Fender Guitar Knobs - Patrick Wiatt
Eiffel Tower - Michael Joyce

story:
UPDATE NEWS: NOW WE ARE READY FOR SHIPPING!  

Get Mo.80 Before Christmas (Limited Number Available).

 

Mo.Story 

We strive to make the best wallets on the market. Thus, we started [Mo.], the brand with the [Minimal Object] and clean look, but [Maximum Observation] in terms of functionality, usage, and design.

With many trials and errors, we developed Mo. signature card slot which proven to be the fastest for all card access. As a result, “80” is a combination of “8” cards that our signature card slot can hold on the left and “0” on the right. This is our fun fact figure that we will use in coming collections.

 

 

 

 

 

In early 2015, my sister and I were looking for a wallet that is both stylish and functional. We wanted to be able to store about 10 cards and have easy access to them. We searched high and low, across international waters, but didn’t come across any that met our needs! Most of crowdfunding wallets are short wallets for men. Where are the alternatives for stylish, long wallets for women? So, we decided to make our own wallet that reflects a minimalist, yet sophisticated style. We hope others will enjoy the quality of our wallets and love the design as much as we do.

 

 

Delivering a quality wallet to you is our happiness. We hope you can feel the difference with Mo.80 wallet design. Please support us and help us spread the words. With your help, we look forward to see Mo.80 in production soon!

 

 

 

 

What makes Mo.80 better?

Mo.80 wallet is an original unisex wallet that designed for functional usage and unique style. We also emphasize on the quality of materials and craftsmanship, so you can be assured that you will receive a high quality wallet at an honest price.

 

Quality

 

We sought out the tannery that can work with our Japanese minimalist style leather (inspired by Japanese durable schoolbag leather), and also highly experienced with Italian tanning technique that gives the consistent color throughout with the exact match of our selected city pantone. We're also working with a professional manufacturer who have been working for many global brands that has decades of experience. So craftsmanship is guaranteed.

Convenience

 

 

The patent-pending Mo.80 signature card slot gives you the most ergonomic way to use wallet. You can easily take cards out and put them back within a second. Cards & cash are distinctively separated on the left and the right side of the wallet. No need to figure out which side of wallet you put your needed card last time.

 

Design

 

 

 

 

The wallet is uniquely designed for both women and men to enjoy. Mo.80 is inspired by the lifestyle of urban light travellers who are looking for both functional products as well as style. This minimal style with an edge wallet is an everyday item that gives confidence and self-expression to the users.

 

Good News! We are very excited to announce that Mo.80 has passed to the final round of Good Design Award from Japan Institute of Design Promotion.

 

 

 

 

 

Mo.80 Features

Left (card side)

  • Mo.80 signature 8 card slots.
  • Back compartments for extra cards/receipts/business cards.

Right (cash side)

  • Shallow coin purse for quicker access.
  • 2 cash note slots (fit all notes from wherever you are)
  • 2 card slots on the right behind coin purse.

Note: To maintain the slim design, we recommend carrying no more than 10-12 cards. However, the wallet fits as many as 20 cards. Let’s simplify life.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Perks 

What's your favorite city? Choose your color palette.

 

Special Indiegogo price

Mo.80 Wallet at US$139 (Free Worldwide Shipping)

(Choose color from Sand / Black / White / Red / Green)

Mo.80 Specification

Dimension

18.4 cm × 9.7 cm × 2.3 cm (L × W × H)
(shorter than other long wallets to fit most small bags)

Materials

Genuine chrome-tanned leather, Korean tight lining, Magnet, YKK Excella Zippers.

  • The leather is water resistant treated to suit your everyday life. Small water spill is ok. Leather still has its pore, so it's not fully waterproof. Try to avoid heavy rain.
  • The beauty of leather is a patina, a soft sheen that develops on the surface of the leather. The more you use, the leather will become softer and give you greater tactile experience as it ages.

Finishing: Smooth acrylic color edging to give the sophisticated stylish look.

 

 

How can we be affordable?

 

 

 

Our Stories

Hello! We're Rosalin & Narisa, the founders of Mo. We're Thai-Malaysian sisters. Rosalin is the designer and Narisa is the marketing side. We have passion for leather crafts and believe that everyone should be able to enjoy well-designed products without having to pay the premium prices, so we started Mo., the brand that strive for high quality leather products with great design at an honest price.

Rosalin studied Product Design from Sydney, Australia (won Red Dot Design Award 2006) and learned leather product design & techniques from Japanese masters in Tokyo, Japan.

Narisa decided to pursue a career in Finance in London after graduating. She appreciates good designs with great functionality to help cope with modern day hectic life.

With determination and supports from local and international members (technicians, tanneries, factories, suppliers, designers, friends & family), we are certain that we are making the best possible wallets.

To achieve our goals, WE REALLY NEED YOUR SUPPORT. We believe in our fantastic community of crowdfunding backers. Please, share our campaign with your friends.

If you would like to reach us, feel free to email us at hello@mostory.co. We would love to hear from you!

Thank you!

Mo. 

 

Production Schedule

High quality craftsmanship in making beautiful individual wallet really takes time. When it comes to beautiful handmade leather wallets with many details, there are simply no shortcuts. We want and every wallet has to meet our quality standard before we send them out. We really appreciate your patience.

Note: If we reach the goal before the time of campaign ended, we will start working straight away so you can get your Mo.80 as soon as possible.

 

Warranty & Care

We offer 1 year warranty against defects from the day they were shipped, when used under normal conditions and for the purpose intended. We will replace/refund your product as necessary.

This warranty covers faults in unusual materials and workmanship and doesn't apply if damage is caused by unreasonable use, normal wear and tear or if you just change your mind.

If you wish to make a claim, or need help with Mo.80, Please email us at support@mostory.co and kindly attach your receipt.

 

Risks & Challenges

Delivery Time: In manufacturing, there's always a risk that suppliers do not fulfill orders on time. We're working with very experienced suppliers who have provided their items for many global brands for decades. We trust them to help us coordinate other material suppliers and produce in a timely manner. 

Duty/VAT charges & Customs: Depends on each country's regulation and customs, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges.

We are working hard to ensure this is a fantastic experience for all. We'll be sure to keep you updated in every production process, so our kind backers will be the first to know. 

Thank you for your support!

www.mostory.co
 

Facebook | Instagram 

Mo. Simply Makes Life Better.
story_txt:
UPDATE NEWS: NOW WE ARE READY FOR SHIPPING!  Get Mo.80 Before Christmas (Limited Number Available). Mo.Story We strive to make the best wallets on the market. Thus, we started [Mo.], the brand with the [Minimal Object] and clean look, but [Maximum Observation] in terms of functionality, usage, and design.With many trials and errors, we developed Mo. signature card slot which proven to be the fastest for all card access. As a result, “80” is a combination of “8” cards that our signature card slot can hold on the left and “0” on the right. This is our fun fact figure that we will use in coming collections.     In early 2015, my sister and I were looking for a wallet that is both stylish and functional. We wanted to be able to store about 10 cards and have easy access to them. We searched high and low, across international waters, but didn’t come across any that met our needs! Most of crowdfunding wallets are short wallets for men. Where are the alternatives for stylish, long wallets for women? So, we decided to make our own wallet that reflects a minimalist, yet sophisticated style. We hope others will enjoy the quality of our wallets and love the design as much as we do.  Delivering a quality wallet to you is our happiness. We hope you can feel the difference with Mo.80 wallet design. Please support us and help us spread the words. With your help, we look forward to see Mo.80 in production soon!    What makes Mo.80 better?Mo.80 wallet is an original unisex wallet that designed for functional usage and unique style. We also emphasize on the quality of materials and craftsmanship, so you can be assured that you will receive a high quality wallet at an honest price. Quality We sought out the tannery that can work with our Japanese minimalist style leather (inspired by Japanese durable schoolbag leather), and also highly experienced with Italian tanning technique that gives the consistent color throughout with the exact match of our selected city pantone. We're also working with a professional manufacturer who have been working for many global brands that has decades of experience. So craftsmanship is guaranteed.Convenience
 
 

The patent-pending Mo.80 signature card slot gives you the most ergonomic way to use wallet. You can easily take cards out and put them back within a second. Cards & cash are distinctively separated on the left and the right side of the wallet. No need to figure out which side of wallet you put your needed card last time. Design    The wallet is uniquely designed for both women and men to enjoy. Mo.80 is inspired by the lifestyle of urban light travellers who are looking for both functional products as well as style. This minimal style with an edge wallet is an everyday item that gives confidence and self-expression to the users. Good News! We are very excited to announce that Mo.80 has passed to the final round of Good Design Award from Japan Institute of Design Promotion.
 
 
 
  
Mo.80 Features
Left (card side)

Mo.80 signature 8 card slots.
Back compartments for extra cards/receipts/business cards.

Right (cash side)

Shallow coin purse for quicker access.
2 cash note slots (fit all notes from wherever you are)
2 card slots on the right behind coin purse.

Note: To maintain the slim design, we recommend carrying no more than 10-12 cards. However, the wallet fits as many as 20 cards. Let’s simplify life.
  
 
 
 
 
 
Perks 
What's your favorite city? Choose your color palette.
 
Special Indiegogo price
Mo.80 Wallet at US$139 (Free Worldwide Shipping)
(Choose color from Sand / Black / White / Red / Green)


Mo.80 Specification
Dimension
18.4 cm × 9.7 cm × 2.3 cm (L × W × H)(shorter than other long wallets to fit most small bags)
Materials
Genuine chrome-tanned leather, Korean tight lining, Magnet, YKK Excella Zippers.

The leather is water resistant treated to suit your everyday life. Small water spill is ok. Leather still has its pore, so it's not fully waterproof. Try to avoid heavy rain.
The beauty of leather is a patina, a soft sheen that develops on the surface of the leather. The more you use, the leather will become softer and give you greater tactile experience as it ages.

Finishing: Smooth acrylic color edging to give the sophisticated stylish look.



 
 
How can we be affordable?

Mo.

story:
The start of a Legacy

35 years ago Jim Thornton took the maple coffee table out of his living room in Boulder, Colorado and turned it into one of the first downhill longboard prototypes of its kind. He knew even then that this style of skateboarding would become an exciting new way for people to express themselves all across the world. Never satisfied, Jim would continue to tinker and improve upon his designs for many years.

Since 2010 Jim, inspired by his son Tony and the new generation of riders, has assembled the resources and put together a team of engineers, designers, woodworkers, and of course, skaters to take their obsession with longboard building as far as possible. Years of work have led to the development of a longboard of unsurpassed quality and beauty: The Legacy38

Now, Latitude Longboards uses the most advanced technology and highest quality hardwoods to hand craft unique and highly functional works of art. Through this campaign you can directly help change the way we design and build longboards forever.

The beauty of our process is its ability to be modified to fit an individual rider's needs. Our ultimate goal is to develop a never-before-seen interface, which will enable our customers to design and build their very own custom boards. At Latitude we know that every rider has different preferences and riding styles. Why should you buy another cookie-cutter laminate deck, when you can get a longboard unlike any other?


Our Process


The Legacy38 Overview



Our decks are offered with the worlds best components. Completes come with Bear 852 Trucks and Hawgs Wheels, so your Legacy38 can be ready to ride right out of the box.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to fund production and distribution of these gorgeous boards, we will raise $10,000. Our goals for this campaign are quite simple:

  • 25 Limited Edition Legacy38s
We will fund production of the initial batch of 25 limited edition Legacy38s. This will be the main reward for this campaign, and will go fast at an early-bird price of $425!

  • 200 Legacy38s 
After the first 25, we will be offering an additional 200 decks for $475 or a complete setup with Bear Trucks and Hawgs Wheels for $600 (a $150 value for only $125).

  • Additional Perks and Stretch Goals
Revenues from additional perks such as the My Latitude Experience with Team Rider Dylan Walsh, Thank-Yous, T-Shirts, Hoodies, and Beanies will all cover additional startup costs and enable other exciting stretch goals, such as development of an interface for deck customization directly on LatitudeLongboards.com!


The Impact

Latitude Longboards is a group of passionate riders and woodworkers who care about the impact they have on the world around them. That's why we have partnered with Halfmoon Works, a local woodshop in Halfmoon, New York, who make high-quality wood products and whose programs create a livelihood for people with special needs. (Learn more at www.halfmoonworks.com). This means that by supporting our campaign you are not only contributing to innovation in the sport of longboarding, but every deck you purchase directly helps someone with special needs get professional training for employment.

We have spent years pouring our hearts into this project, and will stop at nothing to take it to the next level. As a team we have developed a totally new production process with results that speak for themselves. Contribute to this campaign to support innovation in longboarding and become a part of something good.


The Latitude Team


Jim Thornton - Founder, Dreamer

Tony Thornton - Co-founder

Tim Szablewski - Photographer, Videographer, TS Photo & Video

Austin Esmond - Graphic Designer, Professional Portfolio

Joe Carmola - Master Woodworker, Halfmoon Works

David Mobley - Design and CNC Fabrication, Windhover Studios


Dylan Walsh - Team Rider, Woodworker


Press Coverage

       


Concrete Wave Coverage

Longboardism Coverage

Silverfish Coverage

Gazette Coverage


    Risks & Challenges

    At this point, we are getting pretty good at measuring the risks and tackling the challenges in producing a new type of longboard.

    No one board can be perfect for all situations, so we have chosen to launch this first high-performance model to show the capabilities of this technology, and hope that those with different preferences will help us collaborate on future models and features. The Legacy38 is just a start for Latitude Longboards.

    Any undertaking of this scale is bound to come across challenges, but with the experienced team we have as well as great resources such as Northeastern University's IDEA Accelerator behind us, we are particularly suited to deliver on our goals.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

      • Use the Indiegogo share tools directly below the video to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
      • Take our Skater Feedback Survey Here
      • Like us on Facebook and watch for more giveaways throughout the campaign.
      • Put together a skate session and invite us to come at tony@latitudelongboards.com! We are always looking for friends to skate with, and love getting feedback directly from riders.
      • Always ride safely and wear safety gear at all times. That means helmet, gloves, and knee/elbow pads.

      FAQ's

      • What are the exact specifications of the Legacy38?
      The Legacy38 is 38'' in length, with wheelbase options of 24'', 26.5'', and 29''. It is 10'' wide at the widest, 9.5'' at the waist, and boasts .5'' of concavity. It weighs 7 Lbs.

      • What is the deck made of?
      A central beam of red oak is sandwiched horizontally by strips of ash, then walnut, then ash again. The walnut pinstripes give you orientation on the contours of the board, the oak core ensures strength and stiffness, and the ash provides a durable perimeter. 
      This deck is fully weatherproof and maintenance-free. There is no risk of delamination on this construction, and any scratches or chipping that might occur over the years can be fixed by simply sanding and re-finishing the deck.

      • What is included?
      All of our perks come with free shipping and handling to the continental US. Orders of decks or completes also come with additional shipping insurance, as well as a serialized plaque unique to that board, and an optional roll of Hammer grip tape. Orders of completes include a set of Bear 852 Longboard Trucks, a set of Hawgs Micro Monster Wheels, a set of Space Balls Bearings with built in spacers, and lastly the necessary mounting hardware. 

      • Does the Legacy38 come with grip tape on it?
      It is up to you! If you would like, we will grip the deck with Hammer grip tape in our favorite pattern. Alternatively you can request that we ship it separately, allowing you to get creative and customize your own grip tape design.



      • What are the different wheelbases about?
      When you mount the trucks of a longboard at various wheelbases, the size of your turning radius changes. Changing the turning radius of the board can greatly impact the feel of the ride, so you should think about your riding style before choosing between the 24'', 26.5'', and 29'' mounting options.  As a rule, the shorter your wheelbase, the tighter your turns can be. Conversely a longer wheelbase will trade tight turns for stability at higher speeds. If you are looking to carve out some nice slalom turns, go with 24''. If you plan to go really fast, think about mounting at 29''. For the perfect balance of stability and control, 26.5'' is for you. Don't worry, we will ask you how you would like us to set up your complete after you place your order, and are happy to advise!

      • When will it ship?
      The first run of 25 Limited Edition Legacy38s, as well as the other Latitude merchandise WILL be shipped in time for the holidays. Additional decks beyond the first 25 will ship by March 2015. 

      • What about international shipping?
      Shipping a package of this size internationally can become prohibitively expensive. Therefore we must unfortunately ask that supporters outside the US cover the cost of shipping the deck or complete. Please shoot us an email at info@latitudelongboards.com if you would like help estimating your shipping costs internationally.

      • Where do I enter my T-Shirt/Hoodie size, grip tape choice, or wheelbase preference?
      Everyone who supports this campaign will receive an email to confirm your order and gather a bit more information. For T-Shirts and Hoodies this will include the desired size, for decks it will include your grip tape preference, and completes will also request your wheelbase preference.

      • I forgot to add trucks and wheels. How do I add to my order?
      At any time you may simply click the button "Contribute Now" to send us the additional $125 for wheels, trucks, and bearings. Make sure to use the same email address as your previous order and we will make sure you get the complete you deserve!

      • I would like to buy more than one item. How do I add to my order?
      At checkout you will have the option of changing your amount under the section "Additional Gift". In the field marked "Custom" you may enter the dollar amount you would like to spend. If you would like to purchase three Beanies for example, you should enter an additional gift of $40 after you select a Beanie. This would bring your total to $60. To add only one Beanie to your order, only add $20 under Additional Gift. Any questions or concerns can be directed to info@latitudelongboards.com

      • What is Latitude Longboards about?
      Latitude Longboards is a father-son longboard startup based in Burnt Hills, New York. Together Jim and Tony Thornton spent three years perfecting the Legacy model, which launched in November, 2014. Made from the highest quality materials and the most advanced production techniques, Latitude Longboards is committed to making innovative and high-performing rolling works of art. We try to always work with local craftsmen, and produce 100% in the USA. Like most longboarders, we care about connecting with, and positively influencing our community. That's why the seven-person Latitude Team has turned to Indiegogo to finance the first production run of the Legacy model, and to garner as much feedback as possible from the international longboarding family.
