story:
You can also find us at www.stylewithbenefits.org by clicking here!

Members of the Bosh Bosh Project, an organization that teaches girls sewing skills and uses their products to fund their school tuition. We want to carry these products in the U.S.! 

We're a movement that believes good is a cycle, and most companies only go half circle. We want to source goods that are ethically sound, produced with minimal environmental impact, and that help local economies. In turn, we want to donate part of the proceeds from these goods to smaller and local organizations trying to create change. We believe that by taking time to find small organizations looking to create change, partnering with them to help them achieve their goal, and creating a community of individuals powered by doing good, we can change the world. We want you to be able to submit local organizations creating change, and we want to connect you with the impact your support had on the organizations later.

Our model has three parts:

1.)  Find great, ethically produced, items from small businesses around the world. By supporting small businesses in developing parts of the world we can boost those economies, create jobs, and help lift citizens out of poverty.

2.)  Give back with every purchase. We’re not going to just market our goods with a charity. We’re going to search to find the real change-makers, wherever they may be, and make sure they have the funding they need to make the world a better place.

3.)  Create a community. We don’t want to just sell products; we want to create connections. We want the organizations we support to be able to tell you their story, and we want you to know the impact the money we raised had on their organization. We want to hear about the change-makers you know, and what we can do to help them out.


Every day, 27 non-profit organizations go out of business while .0083% of non-profits receive 1/8th of private donations. 100 non-profits get 1/8th of the pie, while the other 1.2 million split the rest, and the funding per organization gets minuscule as the list goes down. This is largely driven by the notoriety given to certain organizations through partnerships with powerful brands, while small, local, innovative groups struggle to find the funding to push forward.

We’re sick of it. Many of these powerful brands use unethical labor practices, cause extreme environmental harm, and even sell toxic products while hiding under the their charitable partnerships.

We don’t think it’s okay to say you want to help poverty while doing nothing to increase economic activity if you have the resources. Letting someone use their skills to earn a fair wage is a much more effective way to break the cycle of poverty.

We don’t think it’s okay to overprice poorly made products in the name of bettering the world while barely donating to the cause.

We don’t think it’s okay to sell products with carcinogens while supporting cancer awareness.

We do believe that every action can be for good, and that’s the principle we’ve built our supply chain around.

Ghandi said, "In a gentle way, you can shake the world."
We've taken that to heart.


We know what we’re doing, and we know how to do it. We've set up connections with local artisans and groups in several different cities, and we're ready to move forward with completing our supply chain. We just need funding to get there.

Right now, our goal is to import products from the Bosh Bosh Project, because we feel they embody everything our company wants to achieve. By teaching girls a skill they can use to support themselves, and using the money to keep them in school, they're empowering women to break the cycle of poverty. Importing products from Liberia is complicated and costly though, and we don't have the funding to do this without your help!


For our perks, we don't want to list specific products we're importing, because the exact color/style combinations are uncertain. Many groups, and in particular the Bosh Bosh Project, use the local fabrics and scraps available to come up with their designs so we can't guarantee a particular color available in a particular style until we get the funding to bring them in. However, you can buy a gift card worth 1.25x it's purchase price to use on these products on our official launch! In addition, we have these great perks


In most perks, you'll receive a hand-written thank you from us. We truly appreciate the support, much more than the internet can convey! 


We wanted to create something special for our backers, so this design will only be available during our campaign. The first 50 backers will be able to receive it in t-shirt form for only $25, along with everything included in our change-maker package, AND you will receive it in time for the holidays! After the first 50 have been claimed, you will still be able to get the design by specifying it in the dreamer package, but they won't ship out until January. 

Every $500 we raise will unlock a new design choice, and we will e-mail you a survey at the end of the campaign to let you choose! Designs that have already been unlocked are available in the gallery. Sizes available are XS-XL.

Creating change is important to us, so even during the campaign $5 from every pledge that purchases a product will go our featured organizations, which you can readabout below.

*International shipping is available, just add $30!

Manufacturing

We want our impact on the world to be positive. All our perk items use low-impact dyes. This means they do not contain heavy metals or toxic substances, nor are they petro-chemically based. The absorption (or fixation) rate for these dyes averages 75%, which means less dye is used to produce our colors and less water is used to rinse them in the process. For fabrics, we use innovative eco-friendly offerings, knitting organic cotton with recycled polyester and rayon to create an incredibly comfortable product.

The ink we print with is free of most environmentally damaging chemicals such as PVC, phthalate, heavy metals, azo compounds, nonylphenol and formaldehyde. We screen print every shirt by hand, which gives them a unique feel, and keeps us from having electrical equipment running constantly.


We searched for, and found, some amazing organizations, and we think you should hear their stories.

The U.N. and World Health Organization define access to water and sanitation as a basic human right, yet many - primarily the homeless - go without.

Lava Mae is nonprofit project working solve the problem of access to showers and toilets for the homeless. We're starting in San Francisco, where there are 16 showers for the 3,100+ men, women and children who make the streets their home.  Our goal is to retrofit retired transportation buses with two private showers, toilets, sinks and changing rooms and provide 80 showers per day. We'll be partnering with local nonprofits who serve the homeless but that do not have these services; this way we expanding their offering while leveraging their expertise working with the homeless.

The money we're raising will help ensure Lava Mae's first bus is as sustainable as possible. We're looking to incorporate solar, but panels are too heavy and too expensive. There's a company based in San Jose, CA that's created a Sun Bus Kit that uses thin film photovoltaic panels that can provide electricity to power WiFi, heating, air conditioning etc. while the bus is parked and the engine is turned off.

Kitechild is transforming the quality of care for orphan and vulnerable children through sustainable micro-projects. Once co-founder Jacqueline Herrera was able to see first hand how these children lived and meet them and see that they are wonderful, normal children who love to sing, play, dance just like every other child, she knew that the world needed to know about them and stop seeing orphans as hopeless causes. They are children full of potential and if we do not help them, they will continue the cycles of poverty, abuse, and violence that often led them to live in orphanages in the first place.

Our model is project based, which means we partner with select orphanages and assess the children's living conditions and see where there is a need. Needs include food security, quality of nutrition, access to education, and appropriate caregivers. Examples of projects to address these needs are chicken coops, greenhouses, fish farms, solar panel installation, etc. All projects are sustainable and have a direct impact on each child's quality of life. The projects also help the homes become less dependent on foreign aid, and they are able to devote more time to caring for each child. 

The money we're raising will help with four projects they have on deck. One is solar panels in Liberia that will save the home $450 per month they currently spend on generator fuel. The money saved will allow the home to feed the children three times a day as opposed to two. Other projects coming up are a school at an orphanage in India, a chicken farm in India, and clean water access in Kenya. They also need funding to cover administrative costs such as paying our liaisons who monitor each project in the field.    

Use the links below to help us get the word out, and to stay connected with us!
story_txt:
You can also find us at www.stylewithbenefits.org by clicking here!


Members of the Bosh Bosh Project, an organization that teaches girls sewing skills and uses their products to fund their school tuition. We want to carry these products in the U.S.! 


We're a movement that believes good is a cycle, and most companies only go half circle.
We want to source goods that are ethically sound, produced with minimal
environmental impact, and that help local economies. In turn, we want to donate
part of the proceeds from these goods to smaller and local organizations trying
to create change. We believe that by taking time to find small organizations
looking to create change, partnering with them to help them achieve their
goal, and creating a community of individuals powered by doing good, we can
change the world. We want you to be able to submit local organizations creating
change, and we want to connect you with the impact your support had on the
organizations later.
Our model
has three parts:
1.)  Find great, ethically produced, items from
small businesses around the world. By supporting small businesses in developing
parts of the world we can boost those economies, create jobs, and help lift
citizens out of poverty.
2.)  Give back with every purchase. We’re not
going to just market our goods with a charity. We’re going to search to find
the real change-makers, wherever they may be, and make sure they have the
funding they need to make the world a better place.
3.)  Create a community. We don’t want to just
sell products; we want to create connections. We want the organizations we
support to be able to tell you their story, and we want you to know the impact
the money we raised had on their organization. We want to hear about the
change-makers you know, and what we can do to help them out.









Every
day, 27 non-profit organizations go out of business while .0083% of
non-profits receive 1/8th of private donations. 100 non-profits get 1/8th of
the pie, while the other 1.2 million split the rest, and the funding per
organization gets minuscule as the list goes down. This is largely
driven by the notoriety given to certain organizations through
partnerships with powerful brands, while small, local, innovative groups
struggle to find the funding to push forward. 
We’re
sick of it. Many of these powerful brands use unethical labor practices, cause
extreme environmental harm, and even sell toxic products while hiding under the
their charitable partnerships. 
We
don’t think it’s okay to say you want to help poverty while doing nothing to increase
economic activity if you have the resources. Letting someone use their skills
to earn a fair wage is a much more effective way to break the cycle of poverty.
We
don’t think it’s okay to overprice poorly made products in the name of
bettering the world while barely donating to the cause.
We
don’t think it’s okay to sell products with carcinogens while supporting cancer
awareness.
We
do believe that every action can be for good, and that’s the principle we’ve
built our supply chain around.

Ghandi said, "In a gentle way, you can shake the world."We've taken that to heart.







We know what we’re doing, and we know how to do it.
We've set up connections with local artisans and groups in several different cities, and we're ready to move forward with completing our supply chain. We just need funding to get there. 
Right now, our goal is to import products from the Bosh Bosh Project, because we feel they embody everything our company wants to achieve. By teaching girls a skill they can use to support themselves, and using the money to keep them in school, they're empowering women to break the cycle of poverty. Importing products from Liberia is complicated and costly though, and we don't have the funding to do this without your help!










For our perks, we don't want to list specific products we're importing, because the exact color/style combinations are uncertain. Many groups, and in particular the Bosh Bosh Project, use the local fabrics and scraps available to come up with their designs so we can't guarantee a particular color available in a particular style until we get the funding to bring them in. However, you can buy a gift card worth 1.25x it's purchase price to use on these products on our official launch! In addition, we have these great perks








In most perks, you'll receive a hand-written thank you from us. We truly appreciate the support, much more than the internet can convey! 





We wanted to create something special for our backers, so this design will only be available during our campaign. The first 50 backers will be able to receive it in t-shirt form for only $25, along with everything included in our change-maker package, AND you will receive it in time for the holidays! After the first 50 have been claimed, you will still be able to get the design by specifying it in the dreamer package, but they won't ship out until January. 
Every $500 we raise will unlock a new design choice, and we will e-mail you a survey at the end of the campaign to let you choose! Designs that have already been unlocked are available in the gallery. Sizes available are XS-XL.

*International shipping is available, just add $30!

story:
RAScomRAS is a new environment for 3D printing that will make 3D printing as simple and easy to use so that anyone from 6 to the eldest can enjoy it. Architects, engineers, students, entrepreneurs and anyone who has an idea or just would like to construct an object, may be a 3D printing user.

 • RCR-D1 RAScomRAS printer. Our 3D printer gathers all the great qualities of 3D printers on market. The latter have been remarkably improved. You will be able to print on many materials (ABS, PLA, PVA, PVE, Nylon and even with a small click & changing of extruder you can print in chocolate or pasta; the possibilities are endless). Connectivity has no boundaries, the D1 comes with a 7 inches Android OS Tablet and the RAScomRAS App; all that will make 3D printing a children’s play.

 • RAScomRAS 3D Object Repository. We keep it simple and easy from your computer, from mobile and from the tablet; that is why we are creating a repository of 3D objects from which you can download all the items that you need and also the great designers; they will be able to put themselves out there.


 • App open source. We come from and believe in the Open Source movement, so our apps and other’s will be available online for you; that way you may even improve them or share them. 3D objects editors, 3D scan, printing enhancement formulas.

Our 3D printer has lived off of and learned from all its predecessors. We have been able to take the best of each and turn down the worst. The first feature that you can see at first glance is its sleek minimalist design. Giving it the deserved image for a revolutionary machine is what we have looked for. That was essential for RAScomRAS team. The technology inside will be a pleasure for any “great geek”; we have been able to put the best from Sanguinololu combined with the power of Raspberry Pi and the final Open Source great touch.


 Many load their printers quickly with two extruders. We have wanted to give you the choice, because our cart is not only prepared for one or two extruders, but you will also be able to easily incorporate any type of extruder; so that your printer can accommodate to any new material. Its hot bed gives it greater reliability when having to print with more grip base.

 Equipped with Wi-Fi, you will be able to control your printer not only from the incorporated-integrated 7” Tablet, but also from your web browser on any device from anywhere on the planet.


 The closing door is a great accessory that will make your printer be 100 % safe for children and also for the not so small. 

 Safety is our major concern. So, we have equipped the RCR-D1 with a carbon fan to put everything in a good atmosphere. Its supplies area is standard so you can use any printing material in the market. We do not want to set limits on, although we recommend our consumables for a better performance. We donot want to tell you which ones to use, so you can use the ones you want.



 We are passionate about Spanish and want to share it with the rest of the world. We believe that 3D printing is to create, to learn, to improve. For us, getting to know about other cultures, other points of view is as important as Science or Technology. 

 While the repository can also be used under any other subject, we would like that learning Spanish be as much fun as 3D printing. For that reason we wanted to do something different, something innovative. What do you have to lose? We think you have much to gain. 

 The 3D repository even in Beta, is the place to share & show; a place where you can make anything just from a click. You can send any objetct to your printer without knowing about modelling; you will be able to customize already existing objects simply by means of open source editors. You can share projects with others in public or private, work with several people simultaneously on objects or compositions, create large objects and make some money out of them. 

 We are creating the 3D printing iTunes! 

 You may enjoy the apps & repository both on the web platform and on the RAScomRAS OS. 

 

 OS such as Linux have been essential in the evolution of the OS that we enjoy today, open or closed. We have wanted to create an open 3D printing OS. Many will say that is just another app, but it is not. It is the first complete 3D printing system with which you will be able to control not only your 3D printer but all its functions that will make it operate and improve. We are working very hard to provide a quality software that makes 3D printing as simple as controlling a tablet and at the same time as advanced as an industrial management system. 

 We could share a comparative table between our printer and other 3D printers but we think it would be a waste of time. Today almost all 3D printers that have gone through indiegogo are very similar among them. We will not compare ours with printers that come from RepRap world, just like us. Our printing quality is equal to the rest, about 50 microns or even less. From the Makerbot to us has not changed much. However, here comes a differentiation: we promise that our printer will not make distinctions with everything new that will come. Thus, you will be able to vary your source of extrusion along with new software updates over anyone’s creation ahead. Has anyone ever promised you that? Our printer is like the rest of the Open Source world and we want to keep it like that. 

Yet we will share some technical data so you can compare: 

 Printing area: X: 200mm Y: 200mm Z: 175mm

 Printing materials: ABS, PLA, Nylon, PVA, PVE, Laywood, Lay-Brick

 Extruder: V.5 0.5 mm (detachable extruder; may install pasta or chocolate extruder), It has the ability to integrate a layer fan. 

 Hot Bed: Yes

 7" inches Tablet: Yes (printing control using Tablet 7" comes along with the printer; auto-updatable)

 Closing door: Apart from the printing kit. 

Software: Open Source RAScomRAS OS. 

 Electronics: Compatible with Sanguinololu + Raspberry Pi

 Air Filter: Carbon 

 Remote Control: Yes. Wi-fi, ip proxy system 

 Auto off: Yes 

 Colors: White Crystal Limited Edition 



 We have seeked the 3D printing being simple and practical as one of our principles. We think we got it with RAScomRAS 3D printing environment. Once you get the RCR -D1 3D printer you just have to take little steps to start printing. Below you can find them: 

 * Connect by means of network cable 

 * Let the tablet on charge recommended , however we know you can not wait to start printing, so bring it charged and start making your first object. 

 * Turn on and customize your printer (this step is recommended because you can have access to the printer from many sites and we want you to control it and not someone else) 

 * Enter into the RAScomRAS App, download the item you like and enjoy your printing.

 With these simple steps you will get to print any object. The RCR-D1 along with the RAScomRAS environment is as simple or advanced as you want it to be. That is the reason why is not only suitable for children from 6 to 85, but also for any professional in sectors as diverse as engineering, architecture, the world of jewelry and even baking. 

 Our printer comes with a single head. Although we know many others come with 2 extrusion heads, the RAScomRAS may be added not only with a second one but also you may incorporate a pasta or chocolate head or even any multi-head the RepRap world, us or yourself develop in the future. We wanted to make innovation as free as you want.

 Calibrating or settings are over. Both the limit switches and our hot bed or even the extruder are fixed so that you will never have to calibrate or adjust anything. Studying the 2D printing has led us to just one conclusion: fixed elements makes calibration non existing. Since components are the same to any Open Source printer, you may change cards or extruders and still calibration will be set.

 

 It is a logical evolution. We could give you a very nice 3D printer with high attributes, but would it be useful if you donot know how to make it work? So we believe that if we give you all means to get the most out of your printer on an intuitive and simple basis, you will be able to incorporate it not only into your life but also into your company. Our open source OS is faithfully adapted to any mobile device or computer. Controlling your printer will be as easy as turning it on, downloading or printing itself. Should you need go beyond, we are ready for it and we have a reserved place for all developers who want to include their app's. To begin with you can enjoy a 3D scan, a full repository of objects, a manual control system and a printing removal system. You will be able to print on 3D as well as 2D. Just as easy you watch a video on Youtube, you will edit objects. 

 We believe that the future of 3D printing relies on materials and items to be made upon them, so we do not want to set limits on our 3D printer. You will be able to print not only with any material nowadays on market, but RAScomRAS wants to go further. We are researching on new printing materials like graphene polymer. We assure you that your RCR-D1 can print on any material for 3D printing already in the market and will be able with the ones that come out in the future. This is because your software will be continuosly updated remotely and simultaneously all the printer updates will be available for you either for you to make or acquire. 

 You will not need internet or hi-fi at home to control your printer. We give everything out to control it from your tablet, which will be already connected once your turn it on and you will only have to connect to the internet in order to download others objects. If you already have items on your computer, you will just have to activate your printer as if it were a 2D and send your file. As simple as that! 

 Our project would have never been born without the Open Source Community, without the RepRap. So we will always be grateful and what a better way than releasing all the code and all the engineering files once this is 100% finished. 

 You may then ask yourself why should you support the project if it will be for free. The same reason that this would never be for real without your support. We will need the support from all of you so that we can go on with improvement and further development. Here and now the entire RAScomRAS would like to thank all those people who have made 3D printing to be a fact and a reality.

 It would be very easy to give full names of every RAScomRAS team, however RAScomRAS consists of all those who at some point have believed in our project. RAScomRAS is possible by virtue of RepRap.org. Thanks to RepRapbcn, thanks to Arduteka, thanks to Arduino, thanks to Raspberry pi, and thanks to Gaudi3D. Thanks to 3D printing, thanks to 3DLab Fab & Cafe, thanks to the city of Torrijos, thanks to the government of Castilla- La Mancha of Spain. And last but not least, thanks to Search and Make, SL and its founder Diego.G.Marín, thanks to the RepRap Community of Spain and Latin America, thanks to D1emy Solutions, thanks to all those who helped us at any time. You are so many… you know all of you are part of RAScomRAS and we know that altogether, you and the new backers we get we will be able to continue with this amazing project. 

 We have already developed all the elements. We have everything ready to market our 3D printer and its own environment, the only thing missing is your financial support which is necessary to build and end parts of the operating system and platform. We need to set them up 100% operational and create a nice design desired by our customers. We need to raise funds so that we can build our production line. We are really close to being able to achieve our purpose. With your help we can begin a new era in creativity and freedom of design. Help us to start building a dream, be part of this dream.

  1€ or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude.

  10 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude and your name in a place of honor on our website. 

  25 € or more: one of the objects of our repository will take your name as recognition to help get a dream. 

  58 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website and a exclusive RAScomRAS T-shirt.


  150 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website and 2 rolls of ABS or PLA with exclusive colors to choose from.

  400€ or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a complete set of materials for printing , ABS , PLA , Nylon, PVA , PVE , Laywood , Lay- Brick. 

 1,200 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR- D1 7 " Tablet ready to use.

 1800 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR- D1 7 " Tablet ready to use and a complete set of materials for printing. 

 2,200 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR- D1 7 " Tablet ready to use, complete set of materials and autograph of RAScomRAS team on the microcontroller. 

  5,000 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR -D1 with 7 " Tablet, complete set of materials, signed by the entire RAScomRAS team and a privileged place during one year on our website for your brand, company or name.

 9,995 € or more: All of the above , plus a round trip to Toledo ( Spain ) during one week , hotel included; you will meet the RAScomRAS team and the cities of Toledo and Torrijos, where HQ are based. 

The pledge amounts do not include shipping or tax (if applicable).


Why isn´t shipping included?

The RAScomRAS shipping costs is very dependent on location. Every part of the world has different shipping costs and it is very hard to put a uniform shipping price tag. We will do our absolute best to make sure it is the lowest it can be for each region.


 November 2013: Manufacturing and assembly materials collection, completion of rascomras.com page formatting, RAScomRAS OS testing. 

 December 2013: Delivery of casing, complete assemblies and printing test, completion of 3D object repository, completion of OS. 

 January 2014: Production line assembly, test settings and adjustments of international regulations, launching of printing app and finishing of connectivity.

 February 2014: Start of distribution and final assembly in shipping areas.

 March 2014: Delivery of devices to our sponsors. 

 Thank you very much! 

 The RAScomRAS team

 Search & Make, SL.

 OS such as Linux have been essential in the evolution of the OS that we enjoy today, open or closed. We have wanted to create an open 3D printing OS. Many will say that is just another app, but it is not. It is the first complete 3D printing system with which you will be able to control not only your 3D printer but all its functions that will make it operate and improve. We are working very hard to provide a quality software that makes 3D printing as simple as controlling a tablet and at the same time as advanced as an industrial management system. 




 We could share a comparative table between our printer and other 3D printers but we think it would be a waste of time. Today almost all 3D printers that have gone through indiegogo are very similar among them. We will not compare ours with printers that come from RepRap world, just like us. Our printing quality is equal to the rest, about 50 microns or even less. From the Makerbot to us has not changed much. However, here comes a differentiation: we promise that our printer will not make distinctions with everything new that will come. Thus, you will be able to vary your source of extrusion along with new software updates over anyone’s creation ahead. Has anyone ever promised you that? Our printer is like the rest of the Open Source world and we want to keep it like that. 
Yet we will share some technical data so you can compare: 
 Printing area: X: 200mm Y: 200mm Z: 175mm
 Printing materials: ABS, PLA, Nylon, PVA, PVE, Laywood, Lay-Brick
 Extruder: V.5 0.5 mm (detachable extruder; may install pasta or chocolate extruder), It has the ability to integrate a layer fan. 
 Hot Bed: Yes
 7" inches Tablet: Yes (printing control using Tablet 7" comes along with the printer; auto-updatable)
 Closing door: Apart from the printing kit. 
Software: Open Source RAScomRAS OS. 
 Electronics: Compatible with Sanguinololu + Raspberry Pi
 Air Filter: Carbon 
 Remote Control: Yes. Wi-fi, ip proxy system 
 Auto off: Yes 
 Colors: White Crystal Limited Edition 





 We have seeked the 3D printing being simple and practical as one of our principles. We think we got it with RAScomRAS 3D printing environment. Once you get the RCR -D1 3D printer you just have to take little steps to start printing. Below you can find them: 
 * Connect by means of network cable 
 * Let the tablet on charge recommended , however we know you can not wait to start printing, so bring it charged and start making your first object. 
 * Turn on and customize your printer (this step is recommended because you can have access to the printer from many sites and we want you to control it and not someone else) 
 * Enter into the RAScomRAS App, download the item you like and enjoy your printing.
 With these simple steps you will get to print any object. The RCR-D1 along with the RAScomRAS environment is as simple or advanced as you want it to be. That is the reason why is not only suitable for children from 6 to 85, but also for any professional in sectors as diverse as engineering, architecture, the world of jewelry and even baking. 
 Our printer comes with a single head. Although we know many others come with 2 extrusion heads, the RAScomRAS may be added not only with a second one but also you may incorporate a pasta or chocolate head or even any multi-head the RepRap world, us or yourself develop in the future. We wanted to make innovation as free as you want.
 Calibrating or settings are over. Both the limit switches and our hot bed or even the extruder are fixed so that you will never have to calibrate or adjust anything. Studying the 2D printing has led us to just one conclusion: fixed elements makes calibration non existing. Since components are the same to any Open Source printer, you may change cards or extruders and still calibration will be set.
 

 It is a logical evolution. We could give you a very nice 3D printer with high attributes, but would it be useful if you donot know how to make it work? So we believe that if we give you all means to get the most out of your printer on an intuitive and simple basis, you will be able to incorporate it not only into your life but also into your company. Our open source OS is faithfully adapted to any mobile device or computer. Controlling your printer will be as easy as turning it on, downloading or printing itself. Should you need go beyond, we are ready for it and we have a reserved place for all developers who want to include their app's. To begin with you can enjoy a 3D scan, a full repository of objects, a manual control system and a printing removal system. You will be able to print on 3D as well as 2D. Just as easy you watch a video on Youtube, you will edit objects. 


 We believe that the future of 3D printing relies on materials and items to be made upon them, so we do not want to set limits on our 3D printer. You will be able to print not only with any material nowadays on market, but RAScomRAS wants to go further. We are researching on new printing materials like graphene polymer. We assure you that your RCR-D1 can print on any material for 3D printing already in the market and will be able with the ones that come out in the future. This is because your software will be continuosly updated remotely and simultaneously all the printer updates will be available for you either for you to make or acquire. 


 You will not need internet or hi-fi at home to control your printer. We give everything out to control it from your tablet, which will be already connected once your turn it on and you will only have to connect to the internet in order to download others objects. If you already have items on your computer, you will just have to activate your printer as if it were a 2D and send your file. As simple as that! 


 Our project would have never been born without the Open Source Community, without the RepRap. So we will always be grateful and what a better way than releasing all the code and all the engineering files once this is 100% finished. 
 You may then ask yourself why should you support the project if it will be for free. The same reason that this would never be for real without your support. We will need the support from all of you so that we can go on with improvement and further development. Here and now the entire RAScomRAS would like to thank all those people who have made 3D printing to be a fact and a reality.


 It would be very easy to give full names of every RAScomRAS team, however RAScomRAS consists of all those who at some point have believed in our project. RAScomRAS is possible by virtue of RepRap.org. Thanks to RepRapbcn, thanks to Arduteka, thanks to Arduino, thanks to Raspberry pi, and thanks to Gaudi3D. Thanks to 3D printing, thanks to 3DLab Fab & Cafe, thanks to the city of Torrijos, thanks to the government of Castilla- La Mancha of Spain. And last but not least, thanks to Search and Make, SL and its founder Diego.G.Marín, thanks to the RepRap Community of Spain and Latin America, thanks to D1emy Solutions, thanks to all those who helped us at any time. You are so many… you know all of you are part of RAScomRAS and we know that altogether, you and the new backers we get we will be able to continue with this amazing project. 


 We have already developed all the elements. We have everything ready to market our 3D printer and its own environment, the only thing missing is your financial support which is necessary to build and end parts of the operating system and platform. We need to set them up 100% operational and create a nice design desired by our customers. We need to raise funds so that we can build our production line. We are really close to being able to achieve our purpose. With your help we can begin a new era in creativity and freedom of design. Help us to start building a dream, be part of this dream.


  1€ or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude.
  10 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude and your name in a place of honor on our website. 
  25 € or more: one of the objects of our repository will take your name as recognition to help get a dream. 
  58 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website and a exclusive RAScomRAS T-shirt.





  150 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website and 2 rolls of ABS or PLA with exclusive colors to choose from.
  400€ or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a complete set of materials for printing , ABS , PLA , Nylon, PVA , PVE , Laywood , Lay- Brick. 
 1,200 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR- D1 7 " Tablet ready to use.
 1800 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR- D1 7 " Tablet ready to use and a complete set of materials for printing. 
 2,200 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR- D1 7 " Tablet ready to use, complete set of materials and autograph of RAScomRAS team on the microcontroller. 
  5,000 € or more: Our & those part of RAScomRAS eternal gratitude, your name in a place of honor on our website plus a RCR -D1 with 7 " Tablet, complete set of materials, signed by the entire RAScomRAS team and a privileged place during one year on our website for your brand, company or name.
 9,995 € or more: All of the above , plus a round trip to Toledo ( Spain ) during one week , hotel included; you will meet the RAScomRAS team and the cities of Toledo and Torrijos, where HQ are based. 
The pledge amounts do not include shipping or tax (if applicable).
Why isn´t shipping included?
The RAScomRAS shipping costs is very dependent on location. Every part of the world has different shipping costs and it is very hard to put a uniform shipping price tag. We will do our absolute best to make sure it is the lowest it can be for each region.



 November 2013: Manufacturing and assembly materials collection, completion of rascomras.com page formatting, RAScomRAS OS testing. 
 December 2013: Delivery of casing, complete assemblies and printing test, completion of 3D object repository, completion of OS. 
 January 2014: Production line assembly, test settings and adjustments of international regulations, launching of printing app and finishing of connectivity.
 February 2014: Start of distribution and final assembly in shipping areas.
 March 2014: Delivery of devices to our sponsors. 
 Thank you very much! 
 The RAScomRAS team
 Search & Make, SL.

story:
Set apart with style. Made in the USA.

The Gaston Collective offers unique and products that adorn, delight, and empower the wearer. Artisan-designed and made in America, we believe that jewelry is a simple yet meaningful way for people to tell their story through personal adornment.

The Collective brings together American suppliers and artists, supporting them with a living wage and meaningful and enjoyable work. Environmental responsibility is also a prime factor in our mission. Our jewelry is cast in a verified green, non-toxic, sustainable workshop.

In today’s ever-changing retail market, the discerning customer is turning more toward domestic goods and products. In the world of cookie-cutter mall experiences, shoppers are continually looking for that unique piece that will set them apart from the crowd.

Gaston Collective Jewelry is ready to meet that challenge by sourcing, designing, and assembling jewelry in the USA. While the designs and charms are original and proprietary to the company, many of the materials used are re purposed and recycled from other sources, thus supporting the company's commitment to preserving the environment and keeping it “green.”

Gaston Collective is a new direction for business owner Jessica Gaston. Expanding on her successful jewelry component company, Jess is poised to launch into a new market. Current trends reflect a great opportunity in the jewelry industry for well-designed, fashionable, and affordable jewelry. She is ready to meet that demand by gathering industry experts and relying on the support of her business contacts and resources collected over her 20 years in the industry.

The visionary behind Gaston Collective Jewelry is Jessica Gaston, an entrepreneur with over 20 years in the jewelry business. Always with her finger on the pulse of the fashion jewelry world, Jessica has identified a niche in the ever-growing ready-made jewelry market and is ready to take her product to a national level. She is backed by a team of dedicated jewelry designers and entrepreneurs who bring passion, imagination, and over 100 years of combined experience in the jewelry industry.

Jessica Gaston, CEO Jessica Gaston began studying the arts early, with a special affinity for painting and photography. Now, as a jewelry designer and collector, she loves seeing her ideas come to fruition in wearable art. Clients such as Betsey Johnson, Urban Outfitters and the National Gallery of Art are among those who appreciate Jess’s unique style.

Jess created her business from scratch starting in India. Every time she returns, she’s inspired all over again by the intense color palates, long and storied history of jewelry, and seeing the way the women adorn themselves. Jess is passionate about colored and organic diamonds, and mixing metals to showcase each gem’s most beautiful traits.

The best part about Jess’s work is the flexibility and creativity she’s able act on every day. She loves meeting interesting people when she travels and is happy to pass on her knowledge through her workshops.

Kate Ferrant Richbourg, Design Team Lead  Simply put, Kate Richbourg loves jewelry. She loves to teach it. She loves to make it. She loves to wear it. Teaching and designing jewelry since 1992, she teaches at national shows, bead societies, and bead shops, is published in a variety of jewelry magazines, and is the author of the popular blog We Can Make That at Home. She has also appeared on several episodes of the DIY and HGTV network shows DIY Jewelry and Craft Lab. Kate is the author of the bestselling book Simple Soldering: A Beginner’s Guide to Jewelry Making. She is the former owner of Beadissimo, a popular bead store in San Francisco, and was the Director of Education for the popular online jewelry supply website Beaducation. 

Cynthia Thornton, Design Team Cynthia Thornton is an artist with a background in painting and sculpture, with an emphasis on illustration and jewelry arts. She is the author of Enchanted Adornments and is frequently published in a variety of magazines, including Stringing, Beadwork, and Bead and Button. Cynthia has also worked as a conceptual designer for The Limited, Warner Brothers, and Disney. Her early pursuits included sculpting for a major garden art company and creating masks and props for a haunted house factory. She is the founder and co-owner of Green Girl Studios, a company featuring original designs in metal. She lives in Asheville, NC, with her husband/partner Greg and their two children.

Bob Burkett, Design Team Bob Burkett, a master wax carver, has created and designed metal jewelry for over 40 years. His work has been featured in industry magazines, galleries, and gift shops across the country including The Smithsonian. He began his career as a two-year apprentice to a German jeweler, honing his craft through self-discovery and constant design work. He is known for his realistic renderings of the figure, flora, and fauna. Bob resides in Northern California's Bay Area.

In its limited release to date, Gaston Collective Jewelry has received favorable feedback and repeat orders from customers, and now it's time to take the next step.

Initial customer contact was made earlier in 2013 at the New York, Dallas, and Atlanta gift and trade shows. There, customers ordered pieces from the line that have proved to be popular sellers and have resulted in re-orders.

The influx of Indiegogo funding is a game-changer for the company. Specifically it will be used in the following ways:
  • Expansion of current inventory and design offerings
  • Accelerates product production and fulfillment.
  • Provides funds for advertising, dedicated website, and publicity needed to attract a wider national audience and customer base.
We are so excited about where this funding will take the company. The sky is the limit and this will boost us to new heights. In the coming weeks and months we'll post updates on our Indiegogo page and our website: www.gastoncollective.com so you can join in on this exciting journey with us.

UPDATED 12/15 New one-of-a-kind and a jewelry class perks just added. Check the gallery for images. We have some awesome perks to offer as reward for your support. All pieces are typical of the jewelry that we make at the collective, and we designed them just for this campaign.

Plus we have a SPECIAL perk for TWO ONE high-dollar supporters: An entire day of creativity with Jess, Kate, and Cynthia (and who knows who else might stop by). You choose what we'll do—paint, sculpt, learn to solder, make jewelry... the possibilities are endless. We'll create an unforgettable day just for you. We can't wait for a creativity explosion with two of our generous donors. The day is scheduled for May 2014, and we can work out the exact date to fit your schedule. (One has been claimed.) Check out this incentive, and other perks for all donation levels, on the list to your right.

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help—we appreciate help of all kinds! Be a booster of the collective and tell your friends, share it on social media and send them our way. The Indiegogo share tools make it easy to spread the word about the campaign.

Thanks so much for your support. Follow our Indiegogo page for updates about our campaign and what is happening at the collective. You can also visit our website at www.gastoncollective.com.

story:
UPDATE: Now that we have reached complete funding, perks will be given out on a first-come, first-served basis. No Auction.


Hi! My name is Jo Pires, and I am glad to present to you a project that will kickstart two organizations: L†C and PTSE.

L†C

Love The Christ (L†C) is a small creative group that seeks to use the arts as a means to support Christian ministries. This collection is our second work, but the first that is being promoted! (Check our first collection - which will be available later this year.) We operate from a living room and are not yet an official organisation, so by engaging in this campaign you are helping us move out of childhood! Find out more about L†C at here.

PTSE

Psalm Ten Seventeen and Eighteen (PTSE) is a non-profit organization that is taking steps towards raising an awareness of the reality of human-trafficking and its dangers. They seek to protect, rescue, and redeem victims of human-trafficking. Visit ptse.us to find out more about what they do, and even how you can get involved.

The Campaign

It is a pleasure for L†C to launch it's first crowd-funding campaign, specially when PTSE is also benefiting! L†C and PTSE are babies, having been in operation for only over 6 months. At the origin of these projects are two sisters, one a founder of PTSE and the other of L†C. The purpose of this campaign is to promote and fuel both projects for a good start.

60% of the money raised will go to PTSE, while the remaining will be kept by L†C. Though the goal set for the campaign is of $500, our dream is that any amount of money at all is raised! We will be happy with $10, and with $100,000. For example, L†C's next milestone is to open a basic online store, $14 would suffice to cover 2 months worth of fees! The same amount of money would let PTSE raise awareness at a neighbourhood. $100,000 would let L†C set up a recording studio for audio and video. The same amount of money would buy PTSE a rehabilitation house for rescued victims of human trafficking.

Your contribution, small or big, makes a huge impact! Thank you!

2XL Collection

This collection was developed using donated clothing, limited resources, and some creativity. How many handbags can we make from a pair of trousers? Well the answer came to 3! Can these old t-shirts be used for anything more than cleaning rags? The answer is yes!

Clothing sizes vary from XL to 3XL. Check the catalogue to find out more about each item.

The Perks

UPDATE: Now that we have reached complete funding, perks will be given out on a first-come, first-served basis. No auction.

HANDBAGS

Back Pockets Handbag

Side Pocket Handbag

XL

N.S.A.M. Shirt

Red Sky Sweater

XXL

Autumn Tee

Footsteps Sports Shirt

Sea Oops! Tee

3XL

Acid Tee

Crossword Tee

Stand In The Gap Tee


FAQ:

Will you ship perks to anywhere in the world? Yes! We will ship anywhere, so long as it is on the earth, i.e.: no shipments to the ISS, the Moon, Mars, etc.

Can I donate even though my card is not in dollars? We believe so, so long as your card provider accepts to pay in dollars. As a rule of thumb, if you use a Visa, Mastercard, or any other main card provider, you are good to go! Donate from anywhere in the world. You will donate in dollars, and your card will be charged in the converted amount to your currency.


Where will the money go?

As explained above, 60% will go to PTSE, while the rest is kept by L†C. So basically, if we reach our goal, PTSE will raise $300, while L†C will keep $180. Regardless if we fall short, reach, or exceed our goal, PTSE will always receive 60% of the money donated, while we (L†C) will cover the fees and take the remaining.

What does this means for PTSE? $300 would be enough to cover the expenses of a tour. Part of PTSE's work is to speak at churches, schools, and other public places. This money would help them cover several dates for the year of 2014.

What does this means for L†C? $180 would let us run a basic online store for a year! L†C's funding depends on the sale of our products, so the store is a very important next step for us. From that money there would still be $12 left to invest on materials. This seems very little, but seeing that most of the materials used by us are donated, and if we can get the online store running, the profit from sales will automatically cover expenses. 

Why does this matter?

L†C's concern, as explained on our website, is to facilitate an environment where young artists can come to learn, grow, experiment and gain experience in their creative traits, and a platform were they can display their portfolio. It is also our concern to use this art as a mean to communicate the Gospel, this becomes double-fold when we use the profits of our creations to support Christian ministries, such as PTSE.

Why is L†C important? Young artists are somewhat neglected and shoved aside. We believe no one can become fluent and grow in their skills unless they are allowed to exercise them and see purpose to their creations. This is the core of L†C, letting the artist create at our expense, while letting them see the fruits of their creations and the impact they cause on society.

Why is PTSE important? Human Trafficking is the second largest criminal enterprise in the world, surpassed only by Drug Trafficking. We see faces of missing young girls and children every day posted at the entry of supermarkets, we know of people who have been promised a job abroad only to find out on arrival that they had been lied to. PTSE seeks to bring awareness of these realities, educate people about how to identify such situations, report them and avoid falling into them, but most importantly they seek to rescue victims and council those whom stand in the role of the demander.

At the heart of both projects is the Gospel. We believe that only Christ can cause a real change in the lives of the struggling artist, the trafficked victim, the trafficker, and all of us who are touched by His work.

Ways to Help

Thank you for checking out this campaign, and if you are reading this, thank you for reading this far!!

We are thrilled to be receiving your contribution! As explained above, every dollar makes a difference.

If you can't contribute, then there are other ways you can help:

Spread the word! Share this on your Facebook, Twitter, etc. Tell it to your family, friends, schoolmates, work colleagues, neighbours...

If you really want that handbag or t-shirt, then convince your mom or girlfriend to contribute for you ;).


A thank-you to all who are contributing and spreading the word! Jo Pires, Founder of L†C

L†C and PTSE are babies, having been in operation for only over 6 months. At the origin of these projects are two sisters, one a founder of PTSE and the other of L†C. The purpose of this campaign is to promote and fuel both projects for a good start.60% of the money raised will go to PTSE, while the remaining will be kept by L†C. Though the goal set for the campaign is of $500, our dream is that any amount of money at all is raised! We will be happy with $10, and with $100,000. For example, L†C's next milestone is to open a basic online store, $14 would suffice to cover 2 months worth of fees! The same amount of money would let PTSE raise awareness at a neighbourhood. $100,000 would let L†C set up a recording studio for audio and video. The same amount of money would buy PTSE a rehabilitation house for rescued victims of human trafficking.Your contribution, small or big, makes a huge impact! Thank you!2XL CollectionThis collection was developed using donated clothing, limited resources, and some creativity. How many handbags can we make from a pair of trousers? Well the answer came to 3! Can these old t-shirts be used for anything more than cleaning rags? The answer is yes!Clothing sizes vary from XL to 3XL. Check the catalogue to find out more about each item.The PerksUPDATE: Now that we have reached complete funding, perks will be given out on a first-come, first-served basis. No auction.HANDBAGSBack Pockets HandbagSide Pocket HandbagXLN.S.A.M. ShirtRed Sky SweaterXXLAutumn TeeFootsteps Sports ShirtSea Oops! Tee3XLAcid TeeCrossword TeeStand In The Gap TeeFAQ:Will you ship perks to anywhere in the world? Yes! We will ship anywhere, so long as it is on the earth, i.e.: no shipments to the ISS, the Moon, Mars, etc.Can I donate even though my card is not in dollars? We believe so, so long as your card provider accepts to pay in dollars. As a rule of thumb, if you use a Visa, Mastercard, or any other main card provider, you are good to go! Donate from anywhere in the world. You will donate in dollars, and your card will be charged in the converted amount to your currency.Where will the money go?As explained above, 60% will go to PTSE, while the rest is kept by L†C. So basically, if we reach our goal, PTSE will raise $300, while L†C will keep $180. Regardless if we fall short, reach, or exceed our goal, PTSE will always receive 60% of the money donated, while we (L†C) will cover the fees and take the remaining.What does this means for PTSE? $300 would be enough to cover the expenses of a tour. Part of PTSE's work is to speak at churches, schools, and other public places. This money would help them cover several dates for the year of 2014.What does this means for L†C? $180 would let us run a basic online store for a year! L†C's funding depends on the sale of our products, so the store is a very important next step for us. From that money there would still be $12 left to invest on materials. This seems very little, but seeing that most of the materials used by us are donated, and if we can get the online store running, the profit from sales will automatically cover expenses. Why does this matter?L†C's concern, as explained on our website, is to facilitate an environment where young artists can come to learn, grow, experiment and gain experience in their creative traits, and a platform were they can display their portfolio. It is also our concern to use this art as a mean to communicate the Gospel, this becomes double-fold when we use the profits of our creations to support Christian ministries, such as PTSE.Why is L†C important? Young artists are somewhat neglected and shoved aside. We believe no one can become fluent and grow in their skills unless they are allowed to exercise them and see purpose to their creations. This is the core of L†C, letting the artist create at our expense, while letting them see the fruits of their creations and the impact they cause on society.Why is PTSE important? Human Trafficking is the second largest criminal enterprise in the world, surpassed only by Drug Trafficking. We see faces of missing young girls and children every day posted at the entry of supermarkets, we know of people who have been promised a job abroad only to find out on arrival that they had been lied to. PTSE seeks to bring awareness of these realities, educate people about how to identify such situations, report them and avoid falling into them, but most importantly they seek to rescue victims and council those whom stand in the role of the demander.At the heart of both projects is the Gospel. We believe that only Christ can cause a real change in the lives of the struggling artist, the trafficked victim, the trafficker, and all of us who are touched by His work.Ways to HelpThank you for checking out this campaign, and if you are reading this, thank you for reading this far!!We are thrilled to be receiving your contribution! As explained above, every dollar makes a difference.If you can't contribute, then there are other ways you can help:Spread the word! Share this on your Facebook, Twitter, etc. Tell it to your family, friends, schoolmates, work colleagues, neighbours...If you really want that handbag or t-shirt, then convince your mom or girlfriend to contribute for you ;).A thank-you to all who are contributing and spreading the word! Jo Pires, Founder of L†C

story:
We have been so lucky to get a slot at the Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Berlin

January 17th 2014 17.00H in the tent a the smalle part called Stage

This is great, and we are overly excited, but we need some help with the funding! We would love to do our own kind of show, within the frames of the Fashion Week tent! We would be so gratefull if you would help making this an reality, and to tell a story through a show that adresses political and social issues of the world we live in!


The MADS DINESEN fashion label showcases the creative exploits of its Danish-born designer and operates from Berlin, Germany. In 2010, Mads Dinesen graduated from the UdK University of the arts in Berlin with the menswear collection "Pain is felt by all...". For this collection, he was nominated several times in international competitions, among which the 2011 Hyères 26th International Fashion and Photography Festival (Jury: Raf Simons, Christopher Kane, Prouenza Schouler, Tim Blanks, etc.) and the Mango Fashion Awards 4th Edition 2012 (Jury: Carolina Herrera, Kate Moss, Derek Blasberg, etc.).

After two striking collection presentations/installations in gallery spaces, a show at the Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week would signify another leap forward for the label MADS DINESEN, and it would allow for the designer to expand upon his previous successes in delivering a unique show experience. 

Danish-born Berliner Mads Dinesen is one of the most striking fashion talents in town, all the while being one of the most idiosyncratic.

Nina Trippel, Cee Cee 01/2013

The fashion house of Dinesen combines an in-depth working knowledge of impeccable tailoring and a passionate approach to fine craftsmanship. The street models he carefully selects evoke the fabric of the contemporary human condition and their physical presence permeates through the layers of each costume to reveal its essential materiality. In so doing, the spectacular presentations of his collections evoke a raw and primal energy, though the experience remains determinedly brutal and contemporary in relation to the environmental and social-political nature of the world around us. His consistent interest in spirituality and his intensive research into tribal and nomadic culture impacts the physical world we inhabit when wearing a Dinesen piece. His work is haunting and beautiful, grotesque yet bold, and it is as compelling as it is taboo. He seeks to dismantle our preconceived notions about sexuality and physical beauty. Through his imagery, we gain a greater understanding about human difference and tolerance.



MADS DINESEN

Smoke-clad Warrior

AW 2014

Mixed Collection

Throughout the history of humanity and everywhere on earth, individuals, movements, and groups of people have expressed their ideals and principles by means of protests, marches and demonstrations. Recently, we have witnessed the Arab Spring and the resistance against the oppression of LGBT individuals and organizations in Russia.

Clashes occur between governments and people, between different interest groups, or between an individual and a society. The energy that is released in clashes like these serves as the main inspiration for the

AW2014 collection "Smoke-Clad Warrior" by MADS DINESEN.

How are protest, resistance and ideals expressed through clothing, not only from the point of view of the individual, but also from a societal and cultural point of view? Do we conform our style based on a certain way of living or on a sense of idealism? Or do we express ourselves through slogans on T-shirts and badges?

The collection is a tribute to all historical and contemporary pioneers who are risking their honour, freedom and occasionally also their life in order to change the world for the better.

Changes, that we as a society now may perceive as being natural or normal, often only occurred after long and heroic fights.

Mahatma Gandhi, Martin Luther King, the Dalai Lama, Shirin Ebadi, Harvey Milk, Susan B. Anthony, Ai Weiwei, Anthony Hegarty, Desmond Tutu, Aung San Suu Kyi, ... The list of people who have fought bravely, and are fighting bravely, is endless. The courage and integrity that binds them, is both impressive and inspiring.

To fight for political and societal change, we must go on an introspective journey to be convinced of the idealistic fight ahead. Only by accurately determining our own beliefs, it becomes possible to conquer any injustices we face. But where does an individual encounter his own limits?

This emotional, almost spiritual, way to construct a worldview is comparable to an inner journey where each and every one of us becomes our own spiritual leader. We transform into shamans, priests, or holy men, who through knowledge and experience attempt to shape the world to our personal ideals; that is the main theme of this ethnically mystical, yet youthfully provocative collection.

The collection is focussed on being a fusion of elements inspired by history, ethnic cultures, and youth culture.

The cuts and fabrics of this collection are an interplay between light and heavy, construction and draping, and of order and coincidence. The colour range is predominantly dark, though an occasional touch of colour does appear.

As in all MADS DINESEN collections, prints, fabric manipulation, and knitwear are the elementary particles of this collection.

In total, 15-20 outfits will be created, including 3-4 women's (or unisex) outfits.

Through the AW2014 collection “Smoke-Clad Warrior”, MADS DINESEN wants to challenge everyone: 

LOOK WITHIN! - CHOOSE YOUR BATTLES! – FIGHT THE FIGHT!


Show Concept

The ideal presentation of the show would be a classic runway show with strong personalities (i.e. street models), where the models would be entering the runway one by one.

An important element of MADS DINESEN's fashion is a theatrical and spiritual level, one that always fluctuates between approachability and performance. This balance is also expressed by using a mix of live music (song) and electronic soundscapes. Folkloric and tribal elements are combined with the classic "Western" fashion show choreography. The lighting is intended to be rather dark and mystical and as the show progresses, the transition from dark to light will be made. In line with the inspiration and the title of the collection, the use of smoke will be an integral part of the presentation.


What we need and what you get!

The goal for 4500 € will be spend as following (some costs we already have covered)

Locationrent 3500 €

Setdesign 500 €

Technical stuff 700 € (projectors, smokemachines, mikrophones etc)

Models 1500 €

Catering 300 €


If we do not not reach the goal, we will make it happen. Cut down some of the costs, and do some magic


Donate 25€ and you get:

- A special edition photoprint size: 15x21 from the coming collection campaignshoot by photographer Mali Lazell, Signed by photographer and designer
Worth: 50 €

Donate 50€ and you get:

 - A personal invite to the show for 1 person
 - A special edition photoprint size: 15x21 from the coming collection campaignshoot by photographer Mali Lazell, Signed by photographer and designer
Worth 75 €

Donate 100€ and you get:

 - A signed printed lookbook of the Collection
 - A personal invite to the show for 2 persons
 - A special edition photoprint size: 30x45 from the coming collection campaignshoot by photographer Mali Lazell, Signed by photographer and designer
Worth  € 140

Donate 250€ and you get:

 - A limited edition jewelerypiece from the Moondog-collection made of burned wood and silverchain
 - A signed printed lookbook of the collection
 - A personal invite to the show for 2 persons.
 - A special edition fine art print size:30x45 from the coming collection campaignshoot by photographer Mali Lazell, Signed by photographer and designer
Worth  € 400

Donate 500€ and you get:

 - A MADS DINESEN T-shirt from the collection, contributors choise (delievery summer 2014)
 - A signed printed lookbook of the Collection
 - A personal invite to the show for 2 persons + Backstagepasses
 - A special edition serie of 3 fine art prints size:30x45 from the coming collection campaignshoot by photographer Mali Lazell, Signed by photographer and designer
Worth  € 800

Donate 1000€ and you get:

 - A private order giftcetificate in value of 1000€ retail-price (delievery summer 2014)
 - A signed printed lookbook of the Collection
 - A personal invite to the show for 2 persons + Backstagepasses
 - A special edition serie of 5 fine art prints size:30x45 from the coming collection campaignshoot by photographer Mali Lazell, Signed by photographer and designer
Worth  € 2000


If you cant donate this time, please make some noise! send it to your friends, share on social media, make the world know!

Thank you so much!

Mads Dinesen

story: Thank you
story_txt: Thank you

story: ....

FLIP-FLOPS FOREVER

Hello, I have been an amputee for the past 27 years. My leg was amputated after being crushed between two cars on a highway in Carson City, NV. I was nineteen years old at the time and cruising on a basketball scholarship at a small college. Since then I have been a triathlete, pro inline skater, speaker, stuntman and inventor. Prior to losing my leg I always wore flip-flops. After losing my leg I wore  different types of heavy strap on sandals. They didn't stay on very well and as I said were heavy and costly so I never really liked them. Wearing a split-toe foot is not an option since the loss of performance and durability won't work with my lifestyle.

For years I have had a simple solution for converting almost any flip-flop to fit a prosthetic foot and still look mostly normal and even stylish. With the advent of the new breed of high quality industrial 3-D printers I now can share that with all amputees around the world at a low cost. There is no longer a need to buy a separate foot for flip-flops or those pricey sandals. I have found that low cost Old Navy flip flops work great. I am putting together a deal with an American Flip-Flop company to use their high-quality flip-flops with my design and sell directly to amputees. I need one of the new industrial 3-D printers coming on the market to go into production.

I am here at Indiegogo asking for a chance at sharing this design to make this world a little more foot friendly to those of us missing a foot or two.

Some Links about me -

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0682521/?ref_=sch_intint

http://joeclark.org/caseypieretti.html

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/07/08/what-is-a-supersurvivor_n_5549072.html

TECHNICAL DETAILS

I am creating two avenues to get this fabulous footwear.

The first way; I will make them for you. As I stated above I am working with an American manufacturer to use their established high-quality flip-flops and bring them directly to you. This will assure you that you will be getting a high-quality proven product at a great price. I will also be able to refit your favorite pair of flip-flops to work on your foot as well. I can do fabric and leather strapped flip-flops. I also have a design team working on more fashionable and unique flip-flops.

The second way; This is really for the parents out there who have kids that seem to wear through and grow out of their shoes almost weekly. I am making a kit that will convert those Old-Navy or Target style flip-flops to work on their kids feet. The system will be simple to use and refillable. It will come turn-key with all tools and supplies to convert up to six pairs of flip-flops.

What we have is a patent-pending design that works! I have worn them and can convert a pair in under 15 minutes.

WHAT IS OFFERED

This is really the great part. For helping me I am offering you, Flip-Flops! Get them for yourself or for your favorite amputee! If you don't have a favorite amputee then you can donate a pair to a kid, a much deserving veteran or someone who contacts me for a pair. For this campaign it's twenty-two dollars a pair delivered to your/their door. My friend Paddy Rossbach has a kids camp for amputees named after her. Send a dozen pairs there. They will love them! Of course you can just donate and know that the money will go to the development of this product. Thank You!
