story:
Who We Are...

We are Lola's Wings primarily a woman's lifestyle e-commerce boutique. Lola's is also an acronym for who we are; Luxury Organics, Lingerie, Activewear & Skincare

Lola's Wings is a unique concept and shopping experience for today's woman that is eco-friendly, active with a healthy lifestyle and fashion conscious.

We are a father and daughter start up, with a strong business background, an entrepreneurial spirit, an education in women's studies and a team with vast experience in internet marketing, organics and skincare. A passion for what we are about to undertake and a work ethic to deliver. 


What we do...

Our lifestyle site will be like no other. We have sourced the world over for the finest international brands in Organic Skincare, Organic fashion minded Apparel, including Yoga Attire, Activewear and Exquisite Lingerie.


Lola's will offer a choice to the consumer that is not readily available at your local mall or on the web. Our brands are good for your mind, body and spirit. Lola's Wings will create a shopping experience as if you had traveled to an exotic locale and walked into an international boutique, not just hitting the buy button and proceeding to check out.

Not to worry men, we will soon add skincare, shaving products and apparel for you too. We will also be adding products for mother and baby and children as well.

                                     Contribute Now and Select your Perk------------------------->                



 Including the e-commerce side of business, our site will publish an online magazine called Lola for the reading pleasure of our visitors.

                                                                  Select a Perk and Contribute---------------->

The magazine will have articles of interest and entertainment for today's woman. Our stories will be about women in business and leadership, sport, academia, fitness, yoga, ayurveda, fashion, lifestyle and many others all by contributing writers from around the world.We believe this approach will also be most beneficial to young women and teens by focusing on such issues in a positive way.


Why Contribute to Us?

 You, the contributor can help fund a startup that rocks with the smart ideals of today for our tomorrow.

Having the confidence to spread the word about your lifestyle through the support of Lola's Wings, yes you will receive a perk for your contribution but it is a lot more than just that.

Helping to create and be on the ground floor of a Woman's Life Style magazine called Lola that will focus on issues of today's woman. It is our hope to promote self confidence and self esteem for the young women of today, through our powerful and inspirational articles.

Knowing that our products are safe, ethically produced and made with quality natural ingredients that few others could match.

Are we a feel good company? You bet and proud of it!

You want to feel good too, knowing when you purchase something or throw your support towards a company that they are following similar ideals.That they are providing a safe & clean work environment, that their products are chemical free, not destroying our natural resources and planet. But many products, from many large retailers knowingly or unknowingly have these products on their store shelves.

Contribute to Lola's Wings, we promise to lead the way.


Our Beliefs...


Lola's belief is that every country has something wonderful to offer, something that is indigenous to their people and a desire to be shared. 

With so many products out there produced by large multinational companies purely for shareholder value and not in the interest of the consumer, our health, the environment or our sustainable future; we chose to speak out.

We all make choices everyday, what we do, what we eat and drink or other lifestyle desires but there are products we use everyday and expect or at least have some reasonable expectation that they are safe and not toxic. That is not the case in personal care items and most specifically skincare products. Our skin, the largest organ absorbs over 60% of what it comes in contact with. Due to a recent illness in our family, did we begin to understand and educate ourselves.

So we chose to go into business and develop Lola's Wings as a way to speak out and share the benefits of organics. We believe the old saying, "beauty is skin deep" is so far from the truth and that our beauty shines from within.

Most of us get up in the morning, brush our teeth, shower, dressed and get ready for our day. We do this for good hygiene, it makes us feel good and we want to be able to present ourselves in a manner of our choosing. With the selection from Lola's Wings, one can do just that and have the confidence of what you are using and wearing is better for you and the environment. A lifestyle choice and variety that has not been available until now.


The Brands...


Lola's Wings will proudly represent exclusive brands from Australia, Bali, Brazil, Columbia, Finland, France, India, Italy, New Zealand, South Africa, Sweden, Switzerland, Tahiti, United Kingdom and the United States. All of our products have been carefully selected for their quality and contemporary design, proven efficacy, international awards, certifications and commitment to a sustainable future.


Organic Skincare that is both vegan and certified organic, produced with fruits, flowers, and plant extract.

                Fund Lola's Wings by selecting your Perk---------->



 Organic Apparel of cotton, bamboo, hemp, linen and wool.

 

 Yoga Attire that's comfortable, peaceful, fashion minded and all natural.


Activewear that's ready when you are, great fitting and suitable for all types of sport.

 



Lingerie that is elegant, both sensual and exquisite for that romantic time with your loved one.




Why We Are Here

We are very proud to be on Indiegogo and have the opportunity to present ourselves to you. Lola's Wings is seeking your support to help fund our passion and bring our business to fruition and beyond. Our company is unconventional and certainly not mainstream, so we have chosen this platform to raise capital and let you the people be an integral part of our beginning. With your support, we know that you have an interest in us and will help contribute to complete the following:

  • Finish our website and shopping cart
  • Purchase inventory
  • Begin a solid marketing campaign
  • Secure a shipping and distribution location
  • Develop our brand image through social media and the blogosphere
  • Launch our site

Our Funding Goal

In crowd funding it is said to have a very realistic goal, meet that goal and then surpass it many times over with your momentum, your excitement and your support. Our requirements and the capital needed are much more than what we have established as our goal but will contribute to a healthy beginning.

We would like to break Indiegogo's record by meeting our goal faster than the current holder of that esteemed title and then bust it wide open ten times over.

Our goal is $12,300.00 Get ready, set Let's GoGo 1 2 3 !

                                                               Fund Us by Selecting a Perk------------>

Can't Contribute, No Worries

Can't contribute monetarily, no worries but you can contribute in other ways by supporting us and spreading the word via social media, telling your friends that we are on Indiegogo and the great products we will have to offer. We would be very humbled by this very personal relationship and a Huge Heart Felt Thank You to all.



Our Vision


We have put together a five year plan and would like to share it with you.

Phase One

  • Launch a successful e-commerce site and develop into a well recognized brand

Phase Two

  • Develop a home based business for women to help augment their income by becoming their own business owners and resell Lola's Wings' selection.

Phase Three

  • Initiate a wholesale distribution of Lola's products via specialty and organic retailers, boutiques and health spas'

Phase Four

  • Open our first flag ship boutique somewhere in California. Any suggestions?

Phase Five

  •  Shhh, already in the planning stage and is TOP SECRET but sure to take the organic industry to a new level. 


Questions ?

Do you have a website?

Answer- We are in the process of building it now and hope to be live by December 2013

What if you do not reach your goal, will I still receive my perks?

 Answer- Yes, your support will be our top priority.

When should I expect to receive my discount and perk?

Answer- We are expecting to launch our site December 1st 2013, at that time you will be emailed a discount code to be applied towards your purchase and products should be shipped by 12/10/13

Are all of your products organic?

Answer- Yes, with the only exceptions in our lingerie and some of our activewear, but they have been vetted as a good steward to our environment.


Giving Back

There are so many wonderful organizations doing unbelievable projects around the world; many that support the ending of world hunger, no GMO, saving our environment, clean water, clearing of landmines, childhood disease. The needs of our world are huge and the tasks are daunting.

We have selected the following charities to support that best exemplifies our team.

Doctors Without Borders - Providing urgent medical care in the areas of greatest need.

Pro Mujer - They are providing health care to women and children in impoverished areas of Latin America, also empowering and mentoring them to become entrepreneurs.


Lastly, we ask our visitors to check out this campaign that still has few more days left on Indiegogo. They are called Bombas and provide socks to homeless shelters,a cause very close to one of us at Lola's. Their link is http://igg.me/at/bombas/x4385430




Lola's Team

  • Scott Campbell - Founder
  • Chelsea Campbell - Co Founder and Consultant
  • Julie Kim - Internet Marketing,E-Commerce, Magazine Editor
  • Lara Wagstaff - Esthetician
  • Jason Forrest - Supply Chain
  • Cam Campbell - Specialty Products
  • Trevor Giove -Videographer
  • Lindsay Luckenbach - Graphic Artist

Our email address   lolasinfo@yahoo.com


Thank You For Visiting Us
story_txt:
Who We Are...

We are Lola's Wings primarily a woman's lifestyle e-commerce boutique. Lola's is also an acronym for who we are; Luxury Organics, Lingerie, Activewear & Skincare
Lola's Wings is a unique concept and shopping experience for today's woman that is eco-friendly, active with a healthy lifestyle and fashion conscious.
We are a father and daughter start up, with a strong business background, an entrepreneurial spirit, an education in women's studies and a team with vast experience in internet marketing, organics and skincare. A passion for what we are about to undertake and a work ethic to deliver.  
What we do...

Our lifestyle site will be like no other. We have sourced the world over for the finest international brands in Organic Skincare, Organic fashion minded Apparel, including Yoga Attire, Activewear and Exquisite Lingerie.

Lola's will offer a choice to the consumer that is not readily available at your local mall or on the web. Our brands are good for your mind, body and spirit. Lola's Wings will create a shopping experience as if you had traveled to an exotic locale and walked into an international boutique, not just hitting the buy button and proceeding to check out.
Not to worry men, we will soon add skincare, shaving products and apparel for you too. We will also be adding products for mother and baby and children as well.                                     Contribute Now and Select your Perk------------------------->                 



 Including the e-commerce side of business, our site will publish an online magazine called Lola for the reading pleasure of our visitors.
                                                                  Select a Perk and Contribute---------------->

 The magazine will have articles of interest and entertainment for today's woman. Our stories will be about women in business and leadership, sport, academia, fitness, yoga, ayurveda, fashion, lifestyle and many others all by contributing writers from around the world.We believe this approach will also be most beneficial to young women and teens by focusing on such issues in a positive way.Why Contribute to Us?
 You, the contributor can help fund a startup that rocks with the smart ideals of today for our tomorrow.
Having the confidence to spread the word about your lifestyle through the support of Lola's Wings, yes you will receive a perk for your contribution but it is a lot more than just that.
Helping to create and be on the ground floor of a Woman's Life Style magazine called Lola that will focus on issues of today's woman. It is our hope to promote self confidence and self esteem for the young women of today, through our powerful and inspirational articles.
Knowing that our products are safe, ethically produced and made with quality natural ingredients that few others could match.

story:
WIR HABEN ES GESCHAFFT - DANK EURER HILFE! 

Vielen Dank, dass ihr #SOLiPOWER unterstützt habt. In den kommenden Tagen widmen wir uns den UnterstützerInnen-Listen, um eure Prämien vorzubereiten. Außerdem führen wir Gespräche in Sachen Photovoltaik-Anlage und hoffen, euch bald auch hierzu mehr Neuigkeiten mitteilen zu können. Auf Facebook findet ihr immer die neuesten News zu Fairytale Fashion und zum Photovoltaik-Projekt. In regelmäßigen Abständen werden wir euch aber natürlich auch hier mit allen wichtigen News updaten. Bis dahin, liebe Grüße von Fairytale Fashion-Team! 

----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- -----

#SOLiPOWER-ENDSPURT:


Ihr könnt das Projekt auch auf dem "klassischen" Bankweg unterstützen und euren Wunschbetrag unter Angabe des Names, der E-Mail-Adresse und ggf. deiner Wunschprämie auf folgendes Konto überweisen:

BLZ: 44790 und Konto-Nr: 30136380001 (lautend auf FAIRytale- Fair Fashion e.U.)

oder via IBAN: AT094479030136380001 und BIC: VOEEAT21XXX 

Wir werden euren Beitrag dann hier einfließen lassen und euch auf Wunsch auch namentlich erwähnen.

Vielen Dank!
----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- 

Updates: 


  • Kreditkartenzahlung: wir wurden gefragt, warum man das Projekt nicht über Kreditkarte unterstützen kann. Indiegogo bietet für €-Kampagnen leider keine direkte Kreditkartenzahlung an, man kann jedoch über PayPal mit Kreditkarte zahlen, ohne dort einen Account haben zu müssen. Mehr dazu unten in den FAQ - Häufig gestellten Umfragen. 
  • Deutsch/Englisch: Außerdem erscheint das Menü bzw. die Zahlungsmodalitäten hier auf dieser Seite bei vielen in Englisch. Das liegt daran, dass Indiegogo standardmäßig auf Englisch betrieben wird. Man kann jedoch ganz unten rechts die Sprache umstellen, siehe ebenfalls FAQ. 
  • IBAN/BIC: Wir haben die Daten zu IBAN und BIC unten ergänzt. 


----- ----- for english short description please scroll to the bottom ----- -----


SOLiPOWER - Photovoltaik statt Diesel

Unter dem Namen Fairytale Fashion betreiben wir seit mehreren Jahren ein Modelabel in Österreich für bio-faire Damenmode - designed in Austria, handmade in Nepal. Gemeinsam mit unserer Partnerschneiderei in Kathmandu erarbeiten wir Kollektionen, bei denen wir die traditionelle nepalesische Sticktechnik mit europäischen Designtrends verweben. Dabei werden die einzelnen Kleidungsstücke überwiegend aus Biobaumwolle hergestellt, Taschen aus edlen Khadi-Stoffen. Wir machen nicht Mode, weil es zu wenig Mode gibt. Wir machen Mode, weil es zu wenig bio-faire Mode gibt - und das leistbar und trendig für unterschiedlichste Frauen!

Nepal ist eines der ärmsten Länder der Welt und hat unter anderem große Probleme mit der Energieversorgung. Täglich fällt in Kathmandu stundenlang der Strom aus und somit gibt es in unserer Schneiderei kein Licht und auch keinen Strom für die Nähmaschinen. Aktuell arbeitet die Schneiderei daher mit einem Diesel-Notstrom-Aggregat, um diese Stromausfälle zu überbrücken. Da wir nicht nur auf faire Arbeitsbedingungen achten, sondern als Klimabündnis-Betrieb auch versuchen in der gesamten Produktionskette umweltfreundlich zu arbeiten, haben wir nach einer Lösung gesucht, um auch in Kathmandu umweltfreundliche Maßnahmen umzusetzen. 

Aus diesem Grund wollen wir anstatt des Notstrom-Aggregats eine Photovoltaik-Anlage anschaffen und installieren. Zur Zeit re-investieren wir jedoch unser gesamtes, erwirtschaftetes Geld in den Ankauf von Biobaumwolle und die Ausbezahlung gerechter Löhne an unsere Mitarbeiter. 


Daher haben wir das Projekt SOLiPOWER gestartet: gemeinsam mit euch wollen wir unserem Ziel einer fairen UND ökologischen Mode-Produktion in Nepal näher kommen und ersuchen euch, uns dabei zu unterstützen: 

Wenn es uns gelingt, 

in den kommenden Wochen 

15.000 Euro einzusammeln, 

kann unsere Partner-Schneiderei 

eine Photovoltaik-Anlage installieren. 

In diesen Kosten ist die Anschaffung sowie die Installation der Photovoltaik-Anlage enthalten. Nach der Errichtung wird die Photovoltaik-Anlage zur Gänze in den Besitz der Schneiderei übergehen. Für die Abwicklung des Kaufs und des Aufbaus der Anlage zeichnet Hari Gautam, Leiter unserer Partner-Schneiderei verantwortlich. Er wird alles in die Wege leiten und dokumentieren. 

Für eure Unterstützung haben wir uns originelle Gegenleistungen einfallen lassen, die ihr euch abhängig von der Höhe eures Beitrags auf der rechten Seite aussuchen könnt. Zum Beispiel habt ihr die Möglichkeit, mit uns gemeinsam an einem Fair Trade Mode-Workshop für den Entwurf eines individuellen Einzelstücks oder bei einem exklusiven Foto-Shooting im Fairytale Fashion Style teilzunehmen. Oder ihr werdet NamensgeberIn für ein Modell oder entscheidet euch für einen Werbeauftritte am Stand von Fairytale bei der WearFair 2014 - Messe für ökofaire Mode und nachhaltigen Lebensstil. Ebenso könnt ihr ein Überraschungs-Mitbringsel erstehen, euch einen Fifty-Fifty-Joker sichern oder die "Männer"-Prämie in Anspruch nehmen und euch damit namentlich im Etikett eines Modells der Herbst/Winter-Kollektion 2014 verewigen. 

Für individuelle Prämien kontaktiere uns bitte gerne! 


Werdet Teil von SOLiPOWER!

Unsere Crowdfunding-Aktion läuft bis 21. Dezember 2013 12. Januar 2014. Bis dahin bitten wir euch nicht nur um eure finanzielle Unterstützung. Helft mit, dass möglichst viele Menschen von unserem Projekt erfahren. Erzählt euren Freunden, Familienmitgliedern und Kollegen davon, teilt unseren Link auf Facebook, Twitter, Google+ oder per E-Mail. Bloggt darüber, erzählt Leuten im persönlichen Gespräch von SOLiPOWER oder legt ein paar unserer Unterstützer-Karten bei Veranstaltungen auf. 

Auf der Fairytale Fashion Facebook-Seite und in unserem Blog auf der Fairytale Fashion Webseite bzw. via Newsletter halten wir euch auf dem Laufenden über unser Projekt. Gerne könnt ihr uns auch (nach Vereinbarung) im Atelier  in Eferding/OÖ besuchen kommen, um mehr über Fair Trade und bio-faire Modeproduktion zu erfahren. 

Wenn ihr uns finanziell unterstützen wollt, aber keine Kreditkarte bzw. keinen PayPal-Account besitzt, dann findet ihr unten in den FAQ - Häufig gestellten Fragen unsere Kontonummer, auf die ihr das Geld direkt überweisen könnt. Bitte vergesst nicht, euren Namen und eure E-Mail-Adresse sowie euren Prämienwunsch anzugeben, damit wir euch später kontaktieren können. 

Wir danken euch für eure Unterstützung und dafür, dass ihr mithelft, die Welt ein kleines Stück zu verbessern! 

Eure Ingrid Gumpelmaier-Grandl


FAQ - Häufig gestellte Fragen

  • Kann ich SOLiPOWER auch ohne Kreditkarte oder PayPal unterstützen? 

Ja, klar. Du kannst den Wunschbetrag unter Angabe deines Names, deiner E-Mail-Adresse und ggf. deiner Wunschprämie auf folgendes Konto überweisen: BLZ 44790  KontoNr: 30136380001 lautend auf FAIRytale- Fair Fashion e.U. (IBAN: AT094479030136380001, BIC: VOEEAT21XXX) - Wir werden deinen Beitrag dann hier einfließen lassen und dich auf Wunsch auch namentlich erwähnen. 

  • Kann ich SOLiPOWER mit Kreditkarte, aber ohne PayPal unterstützen? 

Wie man mit Kreditkarte und ohne Account über PayPal unterstützen kann, erfährst du hier: http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20501786-how-to-contribute-via-paypal-without-a-paypal-account - Kurz: Einfach auf der rechten Seite eine Gegenleistung auswählen und auf "Unterstützen" klicken. Danach wirst du zu PayPal weitergeleitet, wo du dich auf der ersten Seite einloggen oder darunter "Mit Kreditkarte zahlen" auswählen kannst. Einfach darauf klicken, Daten eingeben und absenden. Fertig! 

  • Was passiert, wenn die 15.000 Euro nicht erreicht werden?

Sollten wir den angestrebten Zielbetrag in den kommenden Wochen nicht erreichen, wird Fairytale Fashion den fehlenden Betrag aufzahlen und zwar je nach Höhe des fehlenden Betrags aufgeteilt auf die kommenden drei Kollektionen. 

  • Was passiert, wenn wir mehr als 15.000 Euro erreichen? 

Wenn wir mehr als den benötigten Betrag zusammenbekommen, wird Biobaumwolle angekauft, denn die großen Abnahme-Mengen sind ohnehin ein großes Handicap für unser kleines Projekt.

  • Warum stehen oben 18.000 Euro, ihr braucht doch nur 15.000 Euro? 

Für die Photovoltaik-Anlage selbst benötigen wir 15.000 Euro, das stimmt. Da wir für die Nutzung der Internet-Plattform Indiegogo Gebühren und Transaktionskosten bezahlen und auch für den Versand und die Abwicklung der Gegenleistungen aufkommen müssen, liegt der tatsächliche Betrag höher. 

  • Ist Fairytale Fashion Besitzer der Schneiderei? 

Die Schneiderei ist ein selbständiger Betrieb und Partner von Fairytale Fashion. Inhaber der Schneiderei sind Hari Gautam und Hari P.Sedhai. Die Photovoltaik-Anlage wird nach der Installation in ihren Besitz übergehen.

  • Wie komme ich zu den Unterstützer-Karten?

Die Flyer erhältst du bei uns im WELTLADEN EFERDING oder nach Absprache via E-Mail per Post. 

  • Was bedeutet bio-faire Damenmode? 

Ich reise regelmäßig nach Nepal, um dort mit dem Team vor Ort die Kollektionen zu entwickeln und mich von den fairen Arbeitsbedingungen zu überzeugen. Dabei achte ich darauf, dass gerechte Löhne gezahlt und hohe soziale Standards eingehalten werden, dass es keine Benachteiligung von Frauen sowie ein striktes Arbeitsverbot von Kindern unter 15 Jahren gibt. Außerdem finanzieren wir die Materialkosten vor, achten auf weitestgehende Verwendung von schadstoffarmen Materialien und bauen uns nebenbei ökologische Arbeitsweisen auf. Ein großer Schritt in Richtung Qualitätsentwicklung konnte durch die Verwendung von GOTS-zertifizierter BIO-Baumwolle gemacht werden. Das bedeutet für mich bio-fair! 

  • Wieso ist hier alles auf Englisch? 

Rechts unten auf dieser Seite kann man zwischen Englisch und Deutsch wählen. Je nachdem welche Sprache dort eingestellt ist, wird man durch Indiegogo inklusive des Bezahlungsvorgangs navigiert. In manchen Fällen stellt sich die Seite automatisch auf Deutsch um, andernfalls bitte einfach nach unten scrollen und selbst umstellen.  

  • Gibt's mehr Details zur Photovoltaik-Anlage? 

Die Anlage wird ca. 10 kWp Leistung haben. Die  Installation und die Wartung möchten wir an eine lokale Firma übergeben, weil es einerseits praktisch ist, wenn etwas an der Anlage gemacht werden muss und andererseits die Wertschöpfung auch in Nepal liegen soll.

---

ENGLISH VERSION

Fairytale Fashion is a design label from Austria that creates fair trade fashion for women. The clothes are produced in a small garment factory in Kathmandu, Nepal. Unfortunately, power failures occur daily at which point, the lights and sewing machines are switched off. When this occurs, our partners in Nepal turn on an emergency power source run with diesel fuel. However, since diesel is not ecological, we decided to crowdfund a photovoltaic system instead. To achieve this aim we need to raise 15.000 Euros. In return, we will give our donators some very unique perks. 

€ 10,-   A personal thank you and your name mentioned on our website.

€ 25,-  The right to name a garment in our store. 

€ 35,-  A surprise gift from Kathmandu.

€ 50,-  For Men: your name printed on a label saying "women make our world beautiful."

€ 100,-  Fifty-Fifty Joker (50% off price) in our shop in Eferding/Austria

€ 250,-  A fashion workshop on your own fair trade design in Eferding/Austria

€ 350,-  A photo shooting with Fairytale Fashion in Eferding/Austria

€ 700,-  Advertising space on paper bags at the WearFair 2014 in Linz/Austria

€ 1000,-  Advertising space at the Fairytale Fashion stand at the WearFair 2014 in Linz/Austria

€ 2000,-  An exclusive fashion show at your company (in Austria only)

€ 5000,-  A flight voucher from Austria to Nepal and a visit to our partners in Kathmandu.
story_txt:
WIR HABEN ES GESCHAFFT - DANK EURER HILFE! Vielen Dank, dass ihr #SOLiPOWER unterstützt habt. In den kommenden Tagen widmen wir uns den UnterstützerInnen-Listen, um eure Prämien vorzubereiten. Außerdem führen wir Gespräche in Sachen Photovoltaik-Anlage und hoffen, euch bald auch hierzu mehr Neuigkeiten mitteilen zu können. Auf Facebook findet ihr immer die neuesten News zu Fairytale Fashion und zum Photovoltaik-Projekt. In regelmäßigen Abständen werden wir euch aber natürlich auch hier mit allen wichtigen News updaten. Bis dahin, liebe Grüße von Fairytale Fashion-Team! ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- -----#SOLiPOWER-ENDSPURT:
Ihr könnt das Projekt auch auf dem "klassischen" Bankweg unterstützen und euren Wunschbetrag unter Angabe des Names, der E-Mail-Adresse und ggf. deiner Wunschprämie auf folgendes Konto überweisen:BLZ: 44790 und Konto-Nr: 30136380001 (lautend auf FAIRytale- Fair Fashion e.U.) oder via IBAN: AT094479030136380001 und BIC: VOEEAT21XXX Wir werden euren Beitrag dann hier einfließen lassen und euch auf Wunsch auch namentlich erwähnen.Vielen Dank!----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----- Updates: 

Kreditkartenzahlung: wir wurden gefragt, warum man das Projekt nicht über Kreditkarte unterstützen kann. Indiegogo bietet für €-Kampagnen leider keine direkte Kreditkartenzahlung an, man kann jedoch über PayPal mit Kreditkarte zahlen, ohne dort einen Account haben zu müssen. Mehr dazu unten in den FAQ - Häufig gestellten Umfragen. 

Deutsch/Englisch: Außerdem erscheint das Menü bzw. die Zahlungsmodalitäten hier auf dieser Seite bei vielen in Englisch. Das liegt daran, dass Indiegogo standardmäßig auf Englisch betrieben wird. Man kann jedoch ganz unten rechts die Sprache umstellen, siehe ebenfalls FAQ. 
IBAN/BIC: Wir haben die Daten zu IBAN und BIC unten ergänzt. 
----- ----- for english short description please scroll to the bottom ----- -----SOLiPOWER - Photovoltaik statt DieselUnter dem Namen Fairytale Fashion betreiben wir seit mehreren Jahren ein Modelabel in Österreich für bio-faire Damenmode - designed in Austria, handmade in Nepal. Gemeinsam mit unserer Partnerschneiderei in Kathmandu erarbeiten wir Kollektionen, bei denen wir die traditionelle nepalesische Sticktechnik mit europäischen Designtrends verweben. Dabei werden die einzelnen Kleidungsstücke überwiegend aus Biobaumwolle hergestellt, Taschen aus edlen Khadi-Stoffen. Wir machen nicht Mode, weil es zu wenig Mode gibt. Wir machen Mode, weil es zu wenig bio-faire Mode gibt - und das leistbar und trendig für unterschiedlichste Frauen!Nepal ist eines der ärmsten Länder der Welt und hat unter anderem große Probleme mit der Energieversorgung. Täglich fällt in Kathmandu stundenlang der Strom aus und somit gibt es in unserer Schneiderei kein Licht und auch keinen Strom für die Nähmaschinen. Aktuell arbeitet die Schneiderei daher mit einem Diesel-Notstrom-Aggregat, um diese
Stromausfälle zu überbrücken. Da wir nicht nur auf faire Arbeitsbedingungen achten, sondern als Klimabündnis-Betrieb auch versuchen in der gesamten Produktionskette umweltfreundlich zu arbeiten, haben wir nach einer Lösung gesucht, um auch in Kathmandu umweltfreundliche Maßnahmen umzusetzen. Aus diesem Grund wollen wir anstatt des Notstrom-Aggregats eine Photovoltaik-Anlage anschaffen und installieren. Zur Zeit re-investieren wir jedoch unser gesamtes, erwirtschaftetes Geld in den Ankauf
von Biobaumwolle und die Ausbezahlung gerechter Löhne an unsere Mitarbeiter. Daher haben wir das Projekt SOLiPOWER gestartet: gemeinsam mit euch wollen wir unserem Ziel einer fairen UND ökologischen Mode-Produktion in Nepal näher kommen und ersuchen euch, uns dabei zu unterstützen: Wenn es uns gelingt, in den kommenden Wochen 
15.000 Euro einzusammeln, 

kann unsere Partner-Schneiderei 
eine Photovoltaik-Anlage installieren. In diesen Kosten ist die Anschaffung sowie die Installation der Photovoltaik-Anlage enthalten. Nach der Errichtung wird die Photovoltaik-Anlage zur Gänze in den Besitz der Schneiderei übergehen. Für die Abwicklung des Kaufs und des Aufbaus der Anlage zeichnet Hari Gautam, Leiter unserer Partner-Schneiderei verantwortlich. Er wird alles in die Wege leiten und dokumentieren. Für eure Unterstützung haben wir uns originelle Gegenleistungen einfallen lassen, die ihr euch abhängig von der Höhe eures Beitrags auf der rechten Seite aussuchen könnt. Zum Beispiel habt ihr die Möglichkeit, mit uns gemeinsam an einem Fair Trade Mode-Workshop für den Entwurf eines individuellen Einzelstücks oder bei einem exklusiven Foto-Shooting im Fairytale Fashion Style teilzunehmen. Oder ihr werdet NamensgeberIn für ein Modell oder entscheidet euch für einen Werbeauftritte am Stand von Fairytale bei der WearFair 2014 - Messe für ökofaire Mode und nachhaltigen Lebensstil. Ebenso könnt ihr ein Überraschungs-Mitbringsel erstehen, euch einen Fifty-Fifty-Joker sichern oder die "Männer"-Prämie in Anspruch nehmen und euch damit namentlich im Etikett eines Modells der Herbst/Winter-Kollektion 2014 verewigen. Für individuelle Prämien kontaktiere uns bitte gerne! 
Werdet Teil von SOLiPOWER!Unsere Crowdfunding-Aktion läuft bis 21. Dezember 2013 12. Januar 2014. Bis dahin bitten wir euch nicht nur um eure finanzielle Unterstützung. Helft mit, dass möglichst viele Menschen von unserem Projekt erfahren. Erzählt euren Freunden, Familienmitgliedern und Kollegen davon, teilt unseren Link auf Facebook, Twitter, Google+ oder per E-Mail. Bloggt darüber, erzählt Leuten im persönlichen Gespräch von SOLiPOWER oder legt ein paar unserer Unterstützer-Karten bei Veranstaltungen auf. Auf der Fairytale Fashion Facebook-Seite und in unserem Blog auf der Fairytale Fashion Webseite bzw. via Newsletter halten wir euch auf dem Laufenden über unser Projekt. Gerne könnt ihr uns auch (nach Vereinbarung) im Atelier  in Eferding/OÖ besuchen kommen, um mehr über Fair Trade und bio-faire Modeproduktion zu erfahren. 
Wenn ihr uns finanziell unterstützen wollt, aber keine Kreditkarte bzw. keinen PayPal-Account besitzt, dann findet ihr unten in den FAQ - Häufig gestellten Fragen unsere Kontonummer, auf die ihr das Geld direkt überweisen könnt. Bitte vergesst nicht, euren Namen und eure E-Mail-Adresse sowie euren Prämienwunsch anzugeben, damit wir euch später kontaktieren können. Wir danken euch für eure Unterstützung und dafür, dass ihr mithelft, die Welt ein kleines Stück zu verbessern! Eure Ingrid Gumpelmaier-GrandlFAQ - Häufig gestellte FragenKann ich SOLiPOWER auch ohne Kreditkarte oder PayPal unterstützen? Ja, klar. Du kannst den Wunschbetrag unter Angabe deines Names, deiner E-Mail-Adresse und ggf. deiner Wunschprämie auf folgendes Konto überweisen: BLZ 44790  KontoNr: 30136380001 lautend auf FAIRytale- Fair Fashion e.U. (IBAN: AT094479030136380001, BIC: VOEEAT21XXX) - Wir werden deinen Beitrag dann hier einfließen lassen und dich auf Wunsch auch namentlich erwähnen. Kann ich SOLiPOWER mit Kreditkarte, aber ohne PayPal unterstützen? Wie man mit Kreditkarte und ohne Account über PayPal unterstützen kann, erfährst du hier: http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20501786-how-to-contribute-via-paypal-without-a-paypal-account - Kurz: Einfach auf der rechten Seite eine Gegenleistung auswählen und auf "Unterstützen" klicken. Danach wirst du zu PayPal weitergeleitet, wo du dich auf der ersten Seite einloggen oder darunter "Mit Kreditkarte zahlen" auswählen kannst. Einfach darauf klicken, Daten eingeben und absenden. Fertig! Was passiert, wenn die 15.000 Euro nicht erreicht werden?Sollten wir den angestrebten Zielbetrag in den kommenden Wochen nicht erreichen, wird Fairytale Fashion den fehlenden Betrag aufzahlen und zwar je nach Höhe des fehlenden Betrags aufgeteilt auf die kommenden drei Kollektionen. Was passiert, wenn wir mehr als 15.000 Euro erreichen? Wenn wir mehr als den benötigten Betrag zusammenbekommen, wird Biobaumwolle angekauft, denn die großen Abnahme-Mengen sind ohnehin ein großes Handicap für unser kleines Projekt.Warum stehen oben 18.000 Euro, ihr braucht doch nur 15.000 Euro? Für die Photovoltaik-Anlage selbst benötigen wir 15.000 Euro, das stimmt. Da wir für die Nutzung der Internet-Plattform Indiegogo Gebühren und Transaktionskosten bezahlen und auch für den Versand und die Abwicklung der Gegenleistungen aufkommen müssen, liegt der tatsächliche Betrag höher. Ist Fairytale Fashion Besitzer der Schneiderei? Die Schneiderei  ist ein selbständiger Betrieb und Partner von Fairytale Fashion. Inhaber der Schneiderei sind Hari Gautam und Hari P.Sedhai. Die Photovoltaik-Anlage wird nach der Installation in ihren Besitz übergehen.Wie komme ich zu den Unterstützer-Karten?Die Flyer erhältst du bei uns im WELTLADEN EFERDING oder nach Absprache via E-Mail per Post. Was bedeutet bio-faire Damenmode? 

Ich reise regelmäßig nach Nepal, um dort mit dem Team vor Ort die Kollektionen zu entwickeln und mich von den fairen Arbeitsbedingungen zu überzeugen. Dabei achte ich darauf, dass gerechte Löhne gezahlt und hohe soziale Standards eingehalten werden, dass es keine Benachteiligung von Frauen sowie ein striktes Arbeitsverbot von Kindern unter 15 Jahren gibt. Außerdem finanzieren wir die Materialkosten vor, achten auf weitestgehende Verwendung von schadstoffarmen Materialien und bauen uns nebenbei ökologische Arbeitsweisen auf. Ein großer Schritt in Richtung Qualitätsentwicklung konnte durch die Verwendung von GOTS-zertifizierter BIO-Baumwolle gemacht werden. Das bedeutet für mich bio-fair! Wieso ist hier alles auf Englisch? Rechts unten auf dieser Seite kann man zwischen Englisch und Deutsch wählen. Je nachdem welche Sprache dort eingestellt ist, wird man durch Indiegogo inklusive des Bezahlungsvorgangs navigiert. In manchen Fällen stellt sich die Seite automatisch auf Deutsch um, andernfalls bitte einfach nach unten scrollen und selbst umstellen.  Gibt's mehr Details zur Photovoltaik-Anlage? Die Anlage wird ca. 10 kWp Leistung haben. Die  Installation und die Wartung möchten wir an eine lokale Firma übergeben, weil es einerseits praktisch ist, wenn etwas an der Anlage gemacht werden muss und andererseits die Wertschöpfung auch in Nepal liegen soll.---ENGLISH VERSION
Fairytale Fashion is a design label from Austria that creates fair
trade fashion for women. The clothes are produced in a small garment factory in
Kathmandu, Nepal. Unfortunately, power failures occur daily at which
point, the lights and sewing machines are switched off. When this occurs,
our partners in Nepal turn on an emergency power source run with diesel fuel. However,
since diesel is not ecological, we decided to crowdfund a photovoltaic system instead.
To achieve this aim we need to raise 15.000 Euros. In return, we will give our donators
some very unique perks. 

€ 10,-   A
personal thank you and your name mentioned on our website.
€ 25,-  The
right to name a garment in our store. 
€ 35,-  A
surprise gift from Kathmandu.
€ 50,-  For Men: your name printed on a
label saying "women make our world beautiful."
€ 100,-  Fifty-Fifty
Joker (50% off price) in our shop in Eferding/Austria 
€ 250,-  A fashion workshop on your own fair trade design
in Eferding/Austria
€ 350,-  A photo shooting with Fairytale
Fashion in Eferding/Austria
€ 700,-  Advertising space on paper bags at
the WearFair 2014 in Linz/Austria
€ 1000,-  Advertising space at
the Fairytale Fashion stand at the WearFair 2014 in Linz/Austria
€ 2000,-  An exclusive fashion show at your company (in
Austria only)
€ 5000,-  A flight voucher from Austria to Nepal and a visit
to our partners in Kathmandu.

story:
Short Summary

Bri Seeley has been personally invited to show her new collection of women's fashion, Escape, at LA Style Fashion Week in October, 2012. This opportunity was presented to her with minimal time to budget for the expense of the entry fee, but it's an opportunity she CANNOT say no to! Bri is a highly talented designer and is excited to expand her brand with your help!

Bri Seeley is:
1. 100% Made in America
2. Natural and regenerated, high quality fibers
3. Uniquely luxurious feminine fashion designed to outlive trends and be worn over a multitude of seasons
4. Empowerment and pride in women's fashion

Style Fashion Week is the newest and most ambitious fashion week to emerge from Los Angeles. The week of events consist of a welcome party for VIP and Media, followed by five days of runway shows. Style Fashion Week LA has made a global impact on the fashion scene by presenting fashion in new ways, merging interior design with fashion design, and giving Los Angeles based designers a world-class platform to showcase their collections. SFW represents the diverse culture that embodies the people of L.A., making the City of Angels a fashion hub, and being a leader in the world’s fashion community where it belongs.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $4000.00 to cover the entry fee to LA Style Fashion Week

By contributing to this campaign, you will receive a hand written thank you from Bri with a preview image from the new collection. You will also receive exclusive email updates from Bri during LA Fashion Week including photos of the events, backstage photos, and stories from Bri's week in LA

Any money received above the goal will go directly to the costs associated with American manufacturing!

The Impact

Bri believes in fashion, but not just fashion - American fashion. It is what drives her and inspires her continued creation.  She is on a mission to reignite the American fashion industry. Her research has revealed that as of 3/2011 - 98% of the clothing purchased in the United States is imported from abroad. Only two percent of clothing bought in this country is manufactured in this country. The apparel and accessories trade accounted for 824,000 jobs in 1950, but by the 1970’s it had lost a quarter of it’s workers. The United States Department of Labor has estimated that an additional hundreds of thousands of textile and apparel manufacturing jobs will be lost between 2008 and 2018.  Bri sources all of her tags, labels, and fabric from American companies in California and Washington - AND performs all of her manufacturing in Washington state!

Also, Bri is discouraged by the disposable fashion trend that has been occurring over the past few years. There has been an increase in sales of poorly constructed garments that use cheap fabric, which has caused an increase in the amount of clothing sent to landfills.  This is contributing to decomposition issues and increased methane production. Some have come to say that fast, disposable fashion is just as unhealthy to our environment as eating at fast food chains is to our bodies. Bri's fashions are timeless, unique, feminine, and high quality to withstand the test of time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please forward this to a friend, share it on your social media sites, and encourage others to contribute - Every bit counts!

story:
Making August Glow!

Au Baby's vision is to transform the look of breastfeeding advocacy and needs your support to become real. Au Baby seeks to inspire, educate, and raise funds and awareness for breastfeeding.

I am a mother of three breastfed babies, and hope to help remove the barriers that prevent women from reaching their breastfeeding goals. Of the more than 75% of women in the US who initiate breastfeeding, less than half reach their goals, and only 13% are exclusively breastfeeding six months later. The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that women should breastfeed babies for at least one year.

The Vision

My vision is that each year in August, starting August 2014, during National Breastfeeding Awareness month, women will paint their eyelids with bright gold eye shadow in order to raise funds for breastfeeding.

Why gold? Gold, the element Au, is chosen because of its shared properties with breastmilk: delicate, precious and valuable - one drop is like liquid gold!

Our Mission

Our mission is to transform how breastfeeding advocacy looks into an attractive, non-controversial, relatable promotion with mass-appeal in order to enable women to start and keep breastfeeding as long as they want. 

The statistics on why breastfeeding is a worthy cause:

There are roughly 156 million women in the US. 81% will become mothers by the age of 44.77% will start breastfeeding, but less than half will reach their goals. 

The Barriers to Breastfeeding

The funds raised will go to existing organization helping to remove the barriers that prevent mothers from reaching their breastfeeding goals, which include:

1. A rough or painful start

2. Worry about not enough milk

3. Discomfort with breastfeeding in public

4. Going back to work

Non-Controversial, Mass Appeal

Breastfeeding can be an uncomfortable topic, even for supporters. This campaign will transform how the cause is promoted. The simple daily routine of applying make-up is relatable for many women. With the stroke of a brush you can ‘Make August Glow’ with a visible outward symbol to easily display support.

How it Will Work

The campaign will live on aubaby.org, where women can create a profile, seek sponsorship from friends and family for wearing the shadow for 31 days, and receive electronic donations through the website.

Where the Money Goes

Your donation will go towards website development to create the campaign website at aubaby.org.

The Ask: Your Contribution!

We are here on Indiegogo to raise the funds to make the creative and transformational vision of this campaign come to life.

Thanks,

The Au Baby Team

story:
Peterson’s Broomsticks, my company, is on the verge of expanding into mass production - and I need your help to make it happen.

New to Quidditch? See more here.

International Quidditch Association Website

The Basic Idea:

  • I hand make my goals currently with readily available parts. While durable, they are expensive to ship.
  • With your help, we can open the door to innovative, affordable, and better products that fill the needs of Quidditch players.

  • Your funding will help quidditch move into a new stage of growth, stability, and quality. With your contribution, we can make standard equipment affordable and effective.

Why is this company special?

  • This is the first company to design and customize equipment exclusively for quidditch. My goals were used at World Cup VI, and that’s just the beginning. Quidditch is a unique sport presenting its own set of unique challenges pertaining to equipment, and I strive to fill these needs at the best prices.

  • My mission is to expand and provide a wide range of new and innovative  products specifically for quidditch that are not currently available anywhere.

 

Every contribution helps; even a five-dollar donation could make the difference in opening another product line! I am here for you, and one of my goals is to pay your contributions forward - The World Cup hoops alone saved the quidditch community around $2000!

You Get Shiny things

(Above is the Big Snipe - $50 perk)

 

Why this expansion is so expensive:

  • The design requires two injection molds - each cost several thousand dollars.

  • Most of the parts require a minimum order of at least one thousand units. 160+ sets of goals are very costly. Although I’ve searched for a retailer who supplies smaller quantities of materials, I have yet to find one.

  • I am also working towards other quidditch-exclusive products such as better balls, bags, and brooms. The highest priority with this merchandise is affordability - I don't sell things made with unobtainium.

  • You will have access to new and better products.

  • My mission is to lower the final retail prices below the currently posted perk prices. Until the final order is placed, the final price is still in flux. It wouldn't be a very good fundraiser if I lost money.

 

This is a preorder as well as a community effort. I will do my best to pay forward any contributions made by keeping my products affordable and helping teams/tournaments where I can. 

The Impact on Quidditch

Are you tired of different equipment at every event? I want to change that. You work hard to be the best you can – let’s even the playing field.

  • These new products will better the overall professionalism of quidditch, standardize gameplay, and keep your wallet happy.

  • I want to bring the dream of international standards to life. My hoops have been shipped to every region in the United States, and I have even shipped some into Canada. I have requests for my hoops in the UK and Australia, and with some financial assistance, I strongly believe that we can realize the dream of international standards within the sport.

  • Costs are looking comparable to home builds of similar strength, while providing a better and more consistent product. I am based in the Southwest, and due to the durability and popularity of my hoops this region is no longer concerned about hoops. Tournament directors will agree that standardization of hoops simplifies the planning and success of a tournament.

     

  • Beginning a team requires enough organizing as is without trying to build equipment in a dorm. Commercially available and affordable equipment options will allow more teams to start, and more infant teams to grow and be successful.

  • Half of my sales are through school purchase orders, and require tax forms. Most universities and camps prefer established prices and companies to writing blank checks. Imagine if entire school systems brought quidditch into their standard curriculum -Texas is actually close to making it a recognized UIL sport.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute you can still help!

Spread the word - Share the link on team, region, and group pages!

Poke your friends - Even if they don't play they can still contribute!

Thank you! I really do appreciate the help and support!

Why this expansion is so expensive:


The design requires two injection molds - each cost several thousand dollars.


Most of the parts require a minimum order of at least one thousand units. 160+ sets of goals are very costly. Although I’ve searched for a retailer who supplies smaller quantities of materials, I have yet to find one.


I am also working towards other quidditch-exclusive products such as better balls, bags, and brooms. The highest priority with this merchandise is affordability - I don't sell things made with unobtainium. 


You will have access to new and better products. 


My mission is to lower the final retail prices below the currently posted perk prices. Until the final order is placed, the final price is still in flux. It wouldn't be a very good fundraiser if I lost money.

 
This is a preorder as well as a community effort. I will do my best to pay forward any contributions made by keeping my products affordable and helping teams/tournaments where I can. 
The Impact on Quidditch
Are you tired of different equipment at every event? I want to change that. You work hard to be the best you can – let’s even the playing field.


These new products will better the overall professionalism of quidditch, standardize gameplay, and keep your wallet happy.


I want to bring the dream of international standards to life. My hoops have been shipped to every region in the United States, and I have even shipped some into Canada. I have requests for my hoops in the UK and Australia, and with some financial assistance, I strongly believe that we can realize the dream of international standards within the sport.


Costs are looking comparable to home builds of similar strength, while providing a better and more consistent product. I am based in the Southwest, and due to the durability and popularity of my hoops this region is no longer concerned about hoops. Tournament directors will agree that standardization of hoops simplifies the planning and success of a tournament.

 


Beginning a team requires enough organizing as is without trying to build equipment in a dorm. Commercially available and affordable equipment options will allow more teams to start, and more infant teams to grow and be successful. 


Half of my sales are through school purchase orders, and require tax forms. Most universities and camps prefer established prices and companies to writing blank checks. Imagine if entire school systems brought quidditch into their standard curriculum -Texas is actually close to making it a recognized UIL sport.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute you can still help!
Spread the word - Share the link on team, region, and group pages!
Poke your friends - Even if they don't play they can still contribute!
Thank you! I really do appreciate the help and support!

story:
What is Sci-Squad?

Sci-squad is much more than a geek box with geeky collectibles, it is a love letter to all things Science and Fantasy! Rather it is the love for the steampunk, post-apocalyptic, science fiction, fantasy or mythical creatures! We love them all! 

As a lover of these genres, we create a box that is dedicated to those who enjoy Science and Fantasy graphic novels as much as we do. Every month, you will receive a graphic novel along with goodies that relates to the theme of the month or even the book itself! Goodies such as art prints, shirts, collectible toys, bath and beauty, and many more! Sometimes we will include another book that we like to consider a classic. 


How does Sci-Squad work?

Sign up and join the Squad! 

Choose a length of your subscription and as a Indiegogo backer, you'll get exclusive founding members items!


We curate the box!

We will head off on an epic quest to find awesome items! We will feature a new graphic novel every month and add neat items that will go along with the book or the theme! 

Receive, enjoy, and share!

Boxes will get shipped from the 15th-20th of every month with the help of the good guys from ShipMonk! So you'll know your package is handled with love and care! When you receive your box, do the happy dance, read, and share your awesome experience! 


How you can help us

Donations and pre-orders will help us curate and upscale products for our boxes, from the durability and design of the packaging to the exclusive items and wearables for our customers. This will also help us with setting up the necessary licenses and legal services that we need to get this box up and running.

  • Licenses to operate 
  • Website costs 
  • Boxes and other supplies needed 
  • Shipping costs 
  • Fulfillment service with ShipMonk
  • Purchase of inventory


Where does Sci-Squad! come from?

Sci-Squad started by Jennifer and Martin, a Chicago based couple who happen to share their geeky love for all things comics, video games, and pop culture. Given the inspiration of wanting to open their own comic book store but felt the power of technology was more suitable for their lifestyle, they decided to shift their dream into the web. Thus, Sci-Squad was born! 

We dedicated our box for long time readers or even beginners who want to get introduced to the science and fantasy graphic novels for the first time. We wanted to create more than a box with a graphic novel, we wanted our subscribers to embrace their reading adventure! Rather you are drinking a Firefly inspired tea, Mudder's milk and reading the latest volume of Serenity, we want you be apart of the story! 


How can I find out more about Sci-Squad!?

You can always visit our website http://scisquad.com to subscribe to emails for updates and more information. You'll find out directly what Sci-squad! is up to before and after launch.

Our social media accounts are always available too if you want updates as well and really really want to talk more about science with us!

https://www.facebook.com/scisquadbox/

https://www.twitter.com/scisquadbox/

http://instagram.com/scisquadbox


Check it out! We're featured in.....

Thanks to our fellow friends and supporters, we've been featured in these awesome podcasts! 


twoguysonemic.com

gatcast.com

story:
Encircled is a small batch designer and maker of clothing in Toronto that believes that less is the new more when it comes to your closet. We create high-quality, stylish and comfortable women’s wardrobe essentials, locally in Toronto. Encircled is passionate about creating garments that respect people and planet in their creation, and is a certified B Corporation. We want you to wear your closets, and focus on quality over quantity when building your wardrobe. So, we design pieces that easily go from day to night, work to weekend - stylishly, comfortable and ethically.

 

 

Founded by former road warrior, and management consultant, Kristi Soomer, Encircled designs are made for women on the go.

The Unblazer was a design dreamt up by Kristi after nearly a decade of wearing restrictive and uncomfortable blazers to work.

She wanted a piece that was flattering, breathable, elevated and most importantly - comfortable. Our in-house design team worked collaboratively to create the Blazer of your dreams.

Comfortable, stylish, stretchy, with two zippered pockets, lux premium and sustainable bamboo merino wool french terry fabric, and elegant details like double faced labels, cuffs, and front closure. This draped blazer will be your new go-to for work, weekend and beyond.

 

 

 

We have been designing and producing versatile, made in Canada womenswear for 7 years, with sustainability at the core of everything we do.  With this campaign, our backers will help us scale our growth, and amplify our reach. We’re a small, female-founded business with ambitious goals, but need the funding to grow to be the leading sustainable athleisure brand in Canada.  

We need YOU: women who believe in quality over quantity in their closets, and that fast fashion needs to change it’s harmful environmental and human rights practices.

Your funding will help us:

 

 

 

Encircled makes 100% of our collection within a 30km radius of our studio located in Toronto, Canada. This ensures a high-quality product, ethical labour and environmental practices, amazing relationships with our suppliers and a lower carbon footprint by staying local. Local apparel manufacturing also helps create valuable manufacturing jobs that were lost decades ago when everyone outsourced their production overseas.

 

The sewing studio making the Unblazer is a female-founded business in Toronto’s east end that we’ve worked with for almost 5 years. They’re skilled in the sewing of stretch fabrics, and are responsible for sewing our most popular design, The Dressy Sweatpant.

 

 

The Core Basics Sewing Studio is owned by Nikki and Sherri. These two passionate entrepreneurs took on their operation in 2014 from a long-time apparel manufacturer who retired. We’ve worked with this studio since 2015, when they started making our Chrysalis Cardis

 

 

 

 

The secret to the versatility, elegance, and comfort of the Unblazer is the fabric. We tested dozens of fabrics and chose a blend of Merino Wool, Rayon from Bamboo, Spandex French Terry.

It has 4-way stretch built into the fabric so it’ll move with you throughout the day. The Rayon from Bamboo is breathable, and soft. The French terry is soft against your skin, and Merino wool is naturally odour resistant, breathable, temperature regulating and has moisture wicking properties. It’s biodegradable, naturally UPF resistant and perfect for travel and everyday wear.

This fabric is OEKO-TEX 100 Certified to be free of harmful chemicals, and the Merino Wool is responsibly sourced from non-Mulesed wool in Australia. The zippers are from Canada, and our buttons are high-quality metal, and imported from France.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

"Investing in great quality garments that can be worn many different ways will always leave you satisfied with your purchase (even if it’s a practical one, not a “fun” one) and will help you consume less! I am a HUGE fan of the new UNblazer by Encircled it looks sharp while feeling as soft as a blanket."

 

 

 

"The Unblazer is the perfect piece to wear all day because of how comfortable it is. I work a 9-5 and am in and out of the office all day- because of that reason, I need to feel comfortable in my clothes especially when dealing with clients. The Unblazer is the best of both worlds, it looks as chic as a blazer but wears like a sweater, it's perfect harmony and I am in love."

story:
John and John's Crazy Christmas Store

At John's Crazy Socks, everything we do starts with John, our co-founder, inspiration and Chief Happiness Officer. A young man with Down syndrome, it was his idea to start John’s Crazy Socks due to his love of socks.

Now John wants to start John’s Crazy Christmas Store. John says, “Christmas is my favorite holiday. Everybody loves Christmas.”  

You may have heard about John and John's Crazy Socks because you saw John on TV. He was the first person with Down syndrome to win the EY Entrepreneur of the Year Award;  he testified twice before Congress and spoke at the U.N. and when you see John dance, you cannot stop smiling.  John likes to say, "I have Down syndrome and Down syndrome never holds me back." 

Why create John's Crazy Christmas Store?

John is on a mission to spread happiness and what better time to share joy than at the holidays? This new online store will let us:

  • Create a line of John's holiday items: socks, ornaments, cards, pajama pants, etc.  
  • Spread more happiness.
  • Hire more people with differing abilities.
  • Raise more money for our charity partners.
  • Have more fun.

The new Christmas store will be an expansion of the social enterprise at John's Crazy Socks. Here's what we do at John's Crazy Socks: :

  • We spread happiness every day. 
  • We show the world what people with differing abilities can do.
  • We give back to charity partners like the Special Olympics, National Down Syndrome Society , the Autism Society of America  and Autism Speaks.
  • We deliver the world's best socks all with a personal touch: candy and a thank you note from John.

We have have happy customers. We have over 22,000 online reviews and 96 percent are five star reviews. We have over 220,000 Facebook followers and last year, we shipped over 144,000 orders across the U.S. and to 80 different countries. We have raised over $300,000 for our charity partners and more than half our employees have a differing ability. Haven't heard about John's Crazy Socks? Check out this profile from the CBS Evening News or this story from Fox.  

We Need Your Help to Make a Christmas Store Like No Other

What's better than a Christmas Store dedicated to spreading happiness?

  • A Christmas Store that employs people with differing abilities and shows the world what they can do.
  • A Christmas store that gives back to charity partners.

 

We are asking for your help in creating just such a store.   Everything we create and sell in our Christmas Store will pass three tests:

  • It must spread happiness
  • It must be fun
  • John must be excited about it 

    What Will We Do with the Indiegogo Money? 

    We recognize that we are asking for some of your hard-earned money. We are running this Indiegogo so we can create a brand new online store, John’s Crazy Christmas Store, and a line of products to sell in that store. We will use the funds to design and produce our first products:  

    • Christmas and Holiday Socks from a new line of John’s Crazy Socks.
    • Holiday Cards designed by people with differing abilities.
    • Christmas ornaments designed by people with differing abilities.
    • Wrapping paper designed by people with differing abilities. 
    • Christmas hats and stockings.
    • John’s Crazy Pajama Pants.

    We will also use some of the funds to make changes in our warehouse for the new products and to make changes at our website for the new store. 

    ​We will make the Christmas gifts that you can love, but that's only the beginning:

    • People with differing abilities will design the products.
    • We will hire more people with differing abilities to work in our fulfillment. We call our colleagues Sock Wranglers and Happiness Packers
    • We show the world what people with differing abilities can do by making videos, holding school tours and hosting work groups for schools and social service agencies
    • We Give Back. We will donate 5 percent of our earnings from the Christmas Store to the Special Olympics. 
    • Every package from the Christmas store will get a thank you note from John and some candy.

    This store will enable us to create more jobs, to show more of what people with differing abilities can do and to spread more happiness. We have asked our customers if they would like to see us offer a Christmas store and we received an overwhelming positive response.

    What about the Perks?

    We love our customers and supporters and have designed perks to spread happiness and say thank you to our backers. We have a range of rewards that start with thanking you on our website to John hand-delivering custom socks to anywhere in the continental U.S. Here are some of the rewards available to you:

    • A set of three Christmas or Hannukah socks made exclusively for our Indiegogo backers
    • A box of 20 Christmas cards designed by people with differing abilities 
    • A John's Crazy Socks Santa hat
    • Having your name added to our Big Book of Gratitude
    • Having John make a personalized video for you
    • Receiving a Certificate that you are a Holiday Legend 
    • Receiving a tour of our office and warehouse with John for you and your friends and then eating lunch with John
    • Designing socks with John. You get 100 pairs and we will sell them in our store with 10 percent of the sales going to the charity you choose that supports people with differing abilities
    • Designing socks and then having John hand-deliver them to you. He will bring lunch or speak in front of an audience of your choosing: your company, your school, your non-profit fundraiser, etc. 

     

    We have already begun working on designs for products in the Christmas store and identifying our manufacturing partners. If the Indiegogo succeeds, we will finish the designs and place the orders in August. We will receive delivery of the products by November with a promised delivery date no later than the first week of December, well before Christmas. We have experience delivering on time (that's why we have so many happy customers) and can ship over 2,000 orders a day. You can count on us to deliver your rewards on time. 

    Be Part of a Christmas Store that Can Change the World

    We are a small business, yet all we want to do is change the world. We want to spread happiness to a world that often seems harsher and meaner by the day. We want to show what people with differing abilities can do. We want to change the world for them and everyone they meet.  We want to Give Back, to raise funds for our charity partners, so our efforts have ripple effects into the world. And you can make this happen. You can be part of this effort.  Back our project. Make a difference. 

    Showing What People with Differing Abilities Can Do

    John has Down syndrome, but he always says, "Down syndrome never holds me back." John told his Dad that he wanted to go into business with him and John came up with the idea to sell Crazy Socks. John has testified before Congress, spoken at the United Nations and brought 20,000 people to their feet at Madison Square Garden. Now he wants to open John's Crazy Christmas Store. 

    How do we show what people with differing abilities can do? We built our business on the principle that we would look at what people can do, not what they cannot do. Here's what we do:

    • We have a young man with Down syndrome serve as the face of our business
    • We hire people with differing abilities
    • We make videos all the time to show what  our colleagues can do
    • We host school tours so younger people can see what's possible
    • We host work groups from high schools and social service agencies
    • John and Mark take on speaking engagements to spread the word
    • John and Mark advocate for people with differing abilities going the Washington, Albany and even the United Nations.

    In creating John's Crazy Christmas Store, our products will be designed by people with differing abilities and our orders will be picked and packed by people with differing abilities.  

     

    More than half our employees have a differing ability. The most common diagnosis among our staff is autism, but we have employees with Down syndrome, Fragile X, cerebral palsy and many other conditions. We have people with differing abilities filling orders, writing sock descriptions, designing products and helping our office run smoothly. 

    We do more than hire people. Giving them a chance to earn a job in an environment where they are welcome lets people blossom. They benefit from the dignity of work.   

    Spreading Happiness

    When you walk into our offices, you see a sign that reads "Spreading Happiness." That's our mission and it infuses everything we do. It is the reason we want to open John's Crazy Christmas Store. 

    How do we spread happiness? Start with John, his desire to do for others, his infectious smile and his dancing. Neither Down syndrome nor anything else will hold him back. 

     

    Then we make a connection with our customers. Every package gets a thank you note from John and some candy. Jeff Bezos and Amazon are not putting a thank you note and candy in their packages, but John does. We started out making home deliveries and John still does make those personal deliveries to local customers (he loves it). And John makes some home deliveries along the way. Our customers love it: we have over 20,000 online reviews and 96 percent are five star reviews.

     

    We spread happiness by Giving Back. We pledge 5 percent of our earnings to the Special Olympics and that will be true for John's Crazy Christmas Store. And we raise money for charity partners by donating money from specific products to them. So our Down Syndrome Awareness Socks raise money for the National Down Syndrome Society and ACDS. Our Autism Awareness Socks raise money for the Autism Society of America and Autism Speaks. 

    We spread happiness by having fun and sharing that with others.  

    Tell Me about John's Crazy Socks, the Company that Wants to Build John's Crazy Christmas Store 

    John’s Crazy Socks is a father-son venture inspired by John Lee Cronin, a young man with Down syndrome, and his love of colorful and fun socks—what he calls his “crazy socks.” We're on a mission to spread happiness.

    The company is built on four pillars:

    • Inspiration and Hope: We hire people with differing abilities, share videos to show what people can do, host school tours and school groups that come for work experience. We want the world to see what people with differing abilities can do. More than 50 percent of our employees have a differing ability. 
    • Giving Back: We donate 5 percent of our earnings to the Special Olympics and raise money through our Sock of the Month Club and charity and awareness socks for our charity partners like Autism Speaks, the Autism Society of America, the National Down Syndrome Society, and the Williams Syndrome Association. We have raised more than $300,000 for our charity partners and publish a monthly Giving Back Report.
    • Socks You Can Love: We have over 2,300 different socks plus a Sock of the Month Club, gift boxes and gift bags. And our selection is matched by our customer service: We do same day shipping and most customers receive their socks within two days of ordering.
    • Making It Personal: Every package gets a thank-you note from John and some candy.

    You can learn about us from some of the media coverage that we have received:

    • CNBC
    • BBC
    • Martha MacCallum Show 
    • Money Magazine
    • The New York Post
    • The Mighty
    • CBS National News
    • Fox and Friends

    Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella selected John as one of the ten people who inspired him most in 2018. 

    We have worked hard to spread happiness to our customers. We have over 22,00 online reviews and 96 percent are 5 star reviews. In a recent customer survey, 94 percent of customers said they will definitely buy from us again. 

    For more information about John's Crazy Socks, visit our web page, Facebook page, Instagram account or YouTube channel. You can also contact us at 631-760-5625 or via email at service@johnscrazysocks.com.

We will also use some of the funds to make changes in our warehouse for the new products and to make changes at our website for the new store. 

​We will make the Christmas gifts that you can love, but that's only the beginning:

People with differing abilities will design the products.
We will hire more people with differing abilities to work in our fulfillment. We call our colleagues Sock Wranglers and Happiness Packers
We show the world what people with differing abilities can do by making videos, holding school tours and hosting work groups for schools and social service agencies
We Give Back. We will donate 5 percent of our earnings from the Christmas Store to the Special Olympics. 
Every package from the Christmas store will get a thank you note from John and some candy.

This store will enable us to create more jobs, to show more of what people with differing abilities can do and to spread more happiness. We have asked our customers if they would like to see us offer a Christmas store and we received an overwhelming positive response.

What about the Perks?
We love our customers and supporters and have designed perks to spread happiness and say thank you to our backers. We have a range of rewards that start with thanking you on our website to John hand-delivering custom socks to anywhere in the continental U.S. Here are some of the rewards available to you:

A set of three Christmas or Hannukah socks made exclusively for our Indiegogo backers
A box of 20 Christmas cards designed by people with differing abilities 
A John's Crazy Socks Santa hat
Having your name added to our Big Book of Gratitude
Having John make a personalized video for you
Receiving a Certificate that you are a Holiday Legend 
Receiving a tour of our office and warehouse with John for you and your friends and then eating lunch with John
Designing socks with John. You get 100 pairs and we will sell them in our store with 10 percent of the sales going to the charity you choose that supports people with differing abilities
Designing socks and then having John hand-deliver them to you. He will bring lunch or speak in front of an audience of your choosing: your company, your school, your non-profit fundraiser, etc. 


 
We have already begun working on designs for products in the Christmas store and identifying our manufacturing partners. If the Indiegogo succeeds, we will finish the designs and place the orders in August. We will receive delivery of the products by November with a promised delivery date no later than the first week of December, well before Christmas. We have experience delivering on time (that's why we have so many happy customers) and can ship over 2,000 orders a day. You can count on us to deliver your rewards on time. 

Be Part of a Christmas Store that Can Change the World
We are a small business, yet all we want to do is change the world. We want to spread happiness to a world that often seems harsher and meaner by the day. We want to show what people with differing abilities can do. We want to change the world for them and everyone they meet.  We want to Give Back, to raise funds for our charity partners, so our efforts have ripple effects into the world. And you can make this happen. You can be part of this effort.  Back our project. Make a difference. 
Showing What People with Differing Abilities Can Do
John has Down syndrome, but he always says, "Down syndrome never holds me back." John told his Dad that he wanted to go into business with him and John came up with the idea to sell Crazy Socks. John has testified before Congress, spoken at the United Nations and brought 20,000 people to their feet at Madison Square Garden. Now he wants to open John's Crazy Christmas Store. 

How do we show what people with differing abilities can do? We built our business on the principle that we would look at what people can do, not what they cannot do. Here's what we do:

We have a young man with Down syndrome serve as the face of our business
We hire people with differing abilities
We make videos all the time to show what  our colleagues can do
We host school tours so younger people can see what's possible
We host work groups from high schools and social service agencies
John and Mark take on speaking engagements to spread the word
John and Mark advocate for people with differing abilities going the Washington, Albany and even the United Nations.

In creating John's Crazy Christmas Store, our products will be designed by people with differing abilities and our orders will be picked and packed by people with differing abilities.  

 
More than half our employees have a differing ability. The most common diagnosis among our staff is autism, but we have employees with Down syndrome, Fragile X, cerebral palsy and many other conditions. We have people with differing abilities filling orders, writing sock descriptions, designing products and helping our office run smoothly. 
We do more than hire people. Giving them a chance to earn a job in an environment where they are welcome lets people blossom. They benefit from the dignity of work.   

Spreading Happiness
When you walk into our offices, you see a sign that reads "Spreading Happiness." That's our mission and it infuses everything we do. It is the reason we want to open John's Crazy Christmas Store. 
How do we spread happiness? Start with John, his desire to do for others, his infectious smile and his dancing. Neither Down syndrome nor anything else will hold him back. 

 
Then we make a connection with our customers. Every package gets a thank you note from John and some candy. Jeff Bezos and Amazon are not putting a thank you note and candy in their packages, but John does. We started out making home deliveries and John still does make those personal deliveries to local customers (he loves it). And John makes some home deliveries along the way. Our customers love it: we have over 20,000 online reviews and 96 percent are five star reviews.
 
We spread happiness by Giving Back. We pledge 5 percent of our earnings to the Special Olympics and that will be true for John's Crazy Christmas Store. And we raise money for charity partners by donating money from specific products to them. So our Down Syndrome Awareness Socks raise money for the National Down Syndrome Society and ACDS. Our Autism Awareness Socks raise money for the Autism Society of America and Autism Speaks. 
We spread happiness by having fun and sharing that with others.  


Tell Me about John's Crazy Socks, the Company that Wants to Build John's Crazy Christmas Store 
John’s Crazy Socks is a father-son venture inspired by John Lee Cronin, a young man with Down syndrome, and his love of colorful and fun socks—what he calls his “crazy socks.” We're on a mission to spread happiness.

The company is built on four pillars:


Inspiration and Hope: We hire people with differing abilities, share videos to show what people can do, host school tours and school groups that come for work experience. We want the world to see what people with differing abilities can do. More than 50 percent of our employees have a differing ability. 

Giving Back: We donate 5 percent of our earnings to the Special Olympics and raise money through our Sock of the Month Club and charity and awareness socks for our charity partners like Autism Speaks, the Autism Society of America, the National Down Syndrome Society, and the Williams Syndrome Association. We have raised more than $300,000 for our charity partners and publish a monthly Giving Back Report.

Socks You Can Love: We have over 2,300 different socks plus a Sock of the Month Club, gift boxes and gift bags. And our selection is matched by our customer service: We do same day shipping and most customers receive their socks within two days of ordering.

Making It Personal: Every package gets a thank-you note from John and some candy.

You can learn about us from some of the media coverage that we have received:

CNBC
BBC
Martha MacCallum Show 
Money Magazine
The New York Post
The Mighty
CBS National News
Fox and Friends

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella selected John as one of the ten people who inspired him most in 2018. 

We have worked hard to spread happiness to our customers. We have over 22,00 online reviews and 96 percent are 5 star reviews. In a recent customer survey, 94 percent of customers said they will definitely buy from us again. 
For more information about John's Crazy Socks, visit our web page, Facebook page, Instagram account or YouTube channel. You can also contact us at 631-760-5625 or via email at service@johnscrazysocks.com.

story:
We're Ty & Karen of Kole Jax Designs

We're so thankful you took a moment out of your busy lives to check out our Freedom Project.

Short Summary of the Project

We’re doing this Freedom Project campaign to raise money for us to put together a business opportunity for YOU!  We’ve had so many people respond positively to the idea of selling Kole Jax as an affiliate, or direct sales partner and we’re wanting to make that possibility a reality.

If you would like to be notified when the opportunity is getting ready to be launched please follow this link and add your information: http://eepurl.com/cf91q5

What We Need & What You Get

The funds we raise will help with the building of software, creation of our compensation plan, legal fees and overall growth expenses needed to help us to build a business opportunity for you in the form of direct sales and/or affiliate program.  You’ll get the opportunity to partner with us and receive some one of a kind jewelry and experiences in exchange for your support monetarily.

The Impact

This is a huge next step for Kole Jax Designs as a company and one in which we do not want to travel alone.  We want you to be a part of our organization and realize the freedom that comes with working for yourself.

The Freedom Necklace
