story:
Blessings dear One...

My name is Asherah and I am a clothing designer, healer and facilitator for the awakening of this planet into a higher consciousness of life. I have been working with my clothing line the last 3 years where I have brought out 3 successful collections (www.asherahsoulclothing.com). However, in the prior collections, it hasn't been able to make all of the processes organic. 

With this campaign, I aspire for my collections to turn fully green and work with only organic, eco-friendly fabrics that are dyed with vegetable colours. The process of the production of the natural fibres is done without chemicals, therefore, it keeps the soils healthy and also protects the workers of getting contaminated by the toxins from the crop as well as from the dying process. Organic and Sustainable clothing benefits the earth and the workers and has an impact on YOU who will be wearing the magnificent garments. It is much healthier for our skins and our souls. 

By contributing to this campaign we can make it happen together! You are not only supporting the birth of my dream in creating High Vibrational Garments on all levels, but you are also supporting the evolution of consciousness in bringing more awareness to every being that will purchase this clothing. 

Karma Free Clothing for the World.


What We Need 

I will need approximately 5500 Euro in order to make this Dream come true. The funds contributed go into the fabrics, which are almost 4 times the price of conventional fabrics, as well as into the veg-dying process which is a separate procedure. The funds also go into the sewing and making of the garments. Within my production, we only use the highest quality of machines and threads. It is important to highlight that the production of my collection also supports women in India by giving them work on fair wages. The funds will also be used to cover the post-production processes, where I will be focusing on getting various high-quality photo shoots so that you can see the products in the best and most exact way!

 

Gifts for You 

We have many beautiful gifts for you as an exchange for your contribution! I am opening the option of vouchers which give you special offers, making you one of the first ones to get to have a piece of the new all sustainable collection! As a healing facilitator, I am offering private energetic healing sessions and private retreats for a special price (you can find more about my work as a facilitator under www.theauthenticway.love),


Transparency

One might face obstacles when creating an all-encompassing sustainable clothing line that is also ethically committed to fair trade conditions. It is very important that you know that as a conscious fashion designer, I have travelled to my production company in India, spent time with the owners and personally checked the conditions of the workers in the production as well as their wages. I am also mindful of industrial productions and so I request certificates and proof from all companies that I buy the fabric with to be sure that it is qualified. My commitment to creating a fully conscious, sustainable and ethical clothing line allows the navigation through the challenges that may arise in terms of the transparency of the production and ensuring a full organic design. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are in a situation in which you would like to contribute but financial means are not available to you at the moment, please know that it would be a great help to get the word out there! I am grateful for support in every form! If you feel inspired, help me share this campaign on your Facebook, Instagram or with your friends and spread the word in any way you can! 

Your support is of great help and I am so grateful for whatever form you can contribute! 

Any contribution and share is a great help.
LETS MAKE IT HAPPEN TOGETHER. LOVINGLY FOR MOTHER EARTH.

THANK YOU 

ASHERAH SOUL CLOTHING

story:
Lily Inc. at a Glance

Lily Inc. is an upcoming women's clothing store aimed at speaking true identity over women! Fashion can be an exclusive industry only catering to some. We, on the other hand, design our masterpieces with the understanding that everyone is different! 

We'll start with our online store offering affordable custom-sized garments for customers. Phase II will be a series of actual stores where you can come explore styles that remind every woman that she was made for beauty.

We will be launching Phase I in just a few weeks! But to do this, we'll need your help. Your contributions will cover the costs of custom production, workspace, and material. Would you consider helping us create fashion that includes everyone?

The Details

To get this whole thing going, we need $10,000 more. The money goes towards renting studio space, hiring a few employees, and building a user-friendly online platform that gets our products out without kinks. Even if we don't reach our goal, any money we raise will go towards the above in whatever capacity possible.

We value everyone's contribution, and here is how we'd like to thank you! For any amount, you will receive your choice of one of the following:

  • A free 30 minute fashion consultation with yours truly (via Skype if you're not local)
  • A $30 Lily Inc. gift card
  • An opportunity to suggest a color for next season's Lily Inc. collection

The Impact

We're excited to finally make this available. There are some great efforts popping up along these lines, and while we value them, we are not coming with the same mindset. There are tons of specialty brands for those whose style isn't "mainstream," or for women of color, etc. But we believe that everyone is mainstream and equally valuable, and sometimes creating a separate brand can send a marginalizing word. We want to remind people that if anyone is mainstream (i.e. worth the mass production of clothing), no one is mainstream. We are all so beautifully unique, or we'd have no need for tailors!

So far, Lily Inc. has maintained an online presence and gained a following through our fashion and food blogs. This is my first foray into selling my own designs, unless you count my selling handmade greeting cards when I was eight :). But with a business, retail, and finance background, and some wise helpers, I am ready to go!

Risks & Challenges

Sure, the fashion industry (especially in NY) is competitive. But we believe that when someone is created to serve his or her world in a certain way, it will happen. Each business, like each person, is fully unique. We come into the sphere with something no one else has to offer, which is the aesthetic, the nuances, and the one of a kind love each Lily Inc. employee will carry. A blend of this uniqueness combined with the time, persistence, and diligence that's gone into bringing this company forth will keep it afloat as God's power goes before us.

Non-Financial Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is in the position to help finance us, but you can still help! Please share our link with friends, coworkers, and family. If each of you shared with 10 people, we would really be able to multiply our influence! 

Also, please stay in touch by liking us on Facebook, following us on Twitter, and checking out our blogs! Bless you, and be in touch.

story:
HELLO

My name is Jessica and I am the founder of Liebling and Burke, an online fashion haven consisting of current fashion forward looks and vintage clothing for plus size girls. For years I have been in love with fashion, but fashion more often than not, hasn't been in love with me. Falling somewhere above the size 16 margin can prove to be more than difficult when shopping, it's down right frustrating. What you so often find are styles circa 2002 or something resembling what your grandmother would wear to church. So you can understand how necessary it is for Liebling and Burke to get off the ground! That is where you come in. I would like to invite you along on this amazing journey of providing fashion for girls who have been ignored for far too long!

WHAT IS NEEDED & WHAT YOU GET

I have been covering many of the expenses of starting a business such as, becoming an LLC, some web design, purchasing product, paying photographers for shoots and all of the things that come along with starting a business! But I have not been able to do all of this at speed necessary to fully begin this journey of owning a plus size shop.

My goal with this campaign is to reach $10,000.00. This will allow me to do the following:

  • Complete building the website. (most plus size websites are pretty cheesy!) I want girls to be able to shop with ease on a cool and clean looking site made just for them. A beautiful site that just happens to be plus size is the goal!
  • I am also on the hunt for a seamstress in downtown LA to create pieces like cool tees and dresses out of rad fabric. Cool fabric can be pretty pricey and I want to offer great options!
  • I will also be able to keep the shop stocked with clothes that I am able to source. Although let me tell you, there isn't much out there, but I am being very selective in what I choose and only pick the absolute best pieces. Often times plus size girls get stuck with this mentality that if it fits I better buy it because I don't know the next time something I kinda like will come along. I know this because I am that girl. I know what's missing from the plus size market and with your help I will be able to change that!
  • I have included some fun perks that you will receive (while they last!) Handwritten thank you cards, fun pencils that say things like "start a revolution", tote bags that say "whateva whateva" and logo tee shirts with my favorite and shop motto "Ignore the Should"!
  • If I don't reach my entire goal of $10,000.00 I will finish the website first and then focus on sourcing clothing and lastly find a seamstress. ALL are equally important, but if I had to break it down it would be in that order.

THE IMPACT
This shop of mine has been my dream for a very long time. But about 2 years ago I awoke from a dream where I was making this shop happen and realized enough time had gone by! It is time for this plus size dream to become a reality. Plus size girls deserve this shop. It can be so disappointing to walk into a plus size shop and find the same options time after time, year after year, in the worst materials, the worst prints and all around just what seems to be a mediocre at best attempt to dress us. Girls need the same cool options their friends who aren't plus size are offered. Girls deserve to feel good about themselves when they get dressed right!? It's supposed to be fun, its fashion!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I definitely understand that helping financially is not always an option. There are so many other ways to help! PLEASE share this campaign through the ingiegogo share tools, or any other way you'd like!

INSTAGRAM - TWITTER - FACEBOOK - PINTEREST - YOUR PERSONAL BLOG - TUMBLR - TELL YOUR FRIENDS

Any help you can give would be BEYOND APPRECIATED

                                                                  XOXO
                                                      JESSICA B BLAIR

story:
JEKKAH - AFRICAN INSPIRED CLOTHING

jekkah [je-kka], n. (1) to be beautiful or elegant, (2) to be well-dressed.

Nakam! Our brand JEKKAH was born one year ago. We set out with a clear goal in mind; to create a fun clothing brand with a true, positive social impact to Africa - a country we love and care for. 

  • JEKKAH is a uniquely entrepreneurial collaboration between an ex-management consultant (Petros Solomou - living in London, UK) and a former Engineer (Kamil Farage - living between UK and The Gambia). Jekkah was born to bring African Fashion to the world using cutting edge designs
  • In 15 months we have built the brand from an idea in our heads to a business showing a steady revenue stream. We hold regular markets in London from the world famous Portobello Road Market to Old Spitalfields and Brick Lane
  • Our clothes have been worn by artists such as Paloma Faith, MNEK, Will and The People, Bipolar Sunshine and Natty
  • JEKKAH is already proving to be hugely popular but we need your help!

With your help, we want to take some giant leaps to realise our vision, and all the while directly impact the lives of Africans and a country that we love - The Gambia


Why We Need £50,000 To Be Raised: 

  • 5% of the total amount raised will be given directly to the ERASE Foundation - more on that below
  • 30% will be invested into fabric to achieve economies of scale, making the products cheaper and thus more accessible to a wider audience internationally
  • 40% towards creating the Jekkah headquarters and shop in London, giving the brand the chance to really maximise the market and create a physical presence
  • 25% to invest in a robust marketing and PR strategy to build the brand and implement a coordinated communication approach
  • If we do not reach our goal we will still stick to the above plan but we will prioritise in order as per above


What Your Money Will Receive:

As gratitude for your contribution to grow this sustainable business we're offering limited-edition pieces made for this campaign only. Sport your unique Jekkah apparel, knowing you have donated to a cause to not only grow an aspiring business but also community

  • Your item will be delivered anywhere in the world within 1 month once the campaign has ended
  • You will receive a thank you letter from the ERASE Foundation and a certificate to show how much the campaign raised for this amazing charity
  • You will be invited to our members-only Jekkah family, first to find out latest news, VIP invitations, product launches, brand events


Who Are We?

JEKKAH ORIGINS

JEKKAH is the fun and funky brand that will bring a bit of African colour to your life. Founded in June 2013, we design and manufacture our African Inspired Clothing made from 100% cotton African Wax Print materials in The Gambia, West Africa.

JEKKAH is a brand that aims to bring contemporary, cutting edge fashion and shapes to the global marketplace whilst maintaining a true African sense via use of the print fabrics.

JEKKAH is a word taken from the Wolof language, which is a language spoken by over 10 million people in West Africa, mainly in Senegal and The Gambia

jekkah [je-kka], n. (1) to be beautiful or elegant, (2) to be well-dressed.


SUPPORT AFRICA

All of our products are all sourced, designed and manufactured in The Gambia, using highly skilled local Gambian tailors. When you buy any item by JEKKAH you are actively supporting and making a difference to Gambian people.

In addition, JEKKAH has partnered with a charity called the ERASE Foundation whose main objective is to provide resources and assistance to communities in West Africa, particularly The Gambia. 5% of revenue from all online sales is donated to this charity who use the money to build schools and orphanages to help provide a better life to impoverished children living in rural areas in The Gambia.


Other Ways You Can Help

We recognise that some people can't contribute and that's OK! However, you can help us with the campaign. Money isn't the only way to grow this business and help the community:

  • Please make as much noise about our campaign as possible, spread the word!
  • Feel free to use the IndieGoGo share tools to share this to your friends and followers

From us we just wanted to say a big THANKS at this stage just for reading the above. And we have our fingers firmly crossed that this will work out! 

For more information check out our website and online store at www.jekkah.com  Thank you for reading this far, and we hope you join us in - creating this African brand with a true social impact.

JEKKAH - AFRICAN INSPIRED CLOTHINGjekkah [je-kka], n. (1) to be beautiful or elegant, (2) to be well-dressed.Nakam! Our brand JEKKAH was born one year ago. We set out with a clear goal in mind; to create a fun clothing brand with a true, positive social impact to Africa - a country we love and care for. 
JEKKAH is a uniquely entrepreneurial collaboration between an ex-management consultant (Petros Solomou - living in London, UK) and a former Engineer (Kamil Farage - living between UK and The Gambia). Jekkah was born to bring African Fashion to the world using cutting edge designs
In 15 months we have built the brand from an idea in our heads to a business showing a steady revenue stream. We hold regular markets in London from the world famous Portobello Road Market to Old Spitalfields and Brick Lane
Our clothes have been worn by artists such as Paloma Faith, MNEK, Will and The People, Bipolar Sunshine and Natty
JEKKAH is already proving to be hugely popular but we need your help!
With your help, we want to take some giant leaps to realise our vision, and all the while directly impact the lives of Africans and a country that we love - The GambiaWhy We Need £50,000 To Be Raised: 


5% of the total amount raised will be given directly to the ERASE Foundation - more on that below
30% will be invested into fabric to achieve economies of scale, making the products cheaper and thus more accessible to a wider audience internationally
40% towards creating the Jekkah headquarters and shop in London, giving the brand the chance to really maximise the market and create a physical presence

Please make as much noise about our campaign as possible, spread the word!
Feel free to use the IndieGoGo share tools to share this to your friends and followers


From us we just wanted to say a big THANKS at this stage just for reading the above. And we have our fingers firmly crossed that this will work out! 
For more information check out our website and online store at www.jekkah.com  Thank you for reading this far, and we hope you join us in - creating this African brand with a true social impact.

story:
Introduction

Thank you so much for taking the time to view the Trep Wear crowdfunding campaign. This is a very exciting time for us, and we want to give you the opportunity to be a part of the Trep Wear family from the very start. With your help from the very beginning, we can ensure that Trep Wear is a huge success and begin to fund numerous young entrepreneurs everywhere.

In business, trust is everything. You should know the background of the visionary behind the project that you are funding, so first let me tell you a little bit more about myself, Zach Engle, founder of Trep Wear.

I have always been an entrepreneur my whole life. From telling my mother I wanted to be a salesman at age 3, to selling bubble gum and candy at school at age 10, I have always had the entrepreneurial mindset. In 2008 at age 20, I started my own cleaning company in central Indiana. 6 years later, The Cleaning Solution has grown into a reputable six figure company and recorded 6 years of consecutive growth.

As a serial entrepreneur however, I have always been brainstorming new business ideas in the meantime. I wanted to start a company that could make a huge difference in the world. One that could impact not just the local community like my cleaning company, but help everyone everywhere.

I have always been into fashion, and we all know that clothing is obviously a necessity. Everyone needs a shirt on their back. Why not buy one that is going to make a difference? Why not buy a shirt that means something more? One that will motivate you to bring out your best every single day. One that will create jobs for your community by funding young startups. One that will help young entrepreneurs stay motivated to keep pushing forward and realize that there is always hope in getting their business dreams off the ground through hard work and perseverance....Trep Wear was born.

Our Mission

Trep Wear is more than your average T-Shirt brand. Trep Wear is a lifestyle brand. In a world full of fear and doubt, we all need that extra motivation to keep pushing forward when times get tough. To be a part of the Trep Wear family means to be a dreamer, an over-achiever, a do-er. Trep Wear isn't just for entrepreneurs, it’s for those who want more out of life and want to make a difference in the world at the same time. For those who want to take control of life, instead of letting life control you. One shirt at a time, we can make a difference not only in our local communities, but in the entire world around us. That is Trep Wear.

Our goal is to help fund at least 50 young entrepreneurs every year through the sales of our stylish, motivational shirts and accessories.

How are we going to accomplish this?

For every single item that Trep Wear sells, $5 is held back in our startup fund. Once the startup fund hits the $5,000 mark, we write a $5,000 check to a young entrepreneur ready to take their business idea from a dream to reality. We are also partnering with B2B services such as designers, printers, etc., to help these donations stretch even further for the entrepreneur. The $5,000 donations will actually be upwards of $8,000 in value to the recipient.

What We Need

There are a few reasons why it is important for us to use a crowdfunding campaign for Trep Wear, over securing our own funding elsewhere. Our funding goal is set at $10,000. Where is this money going?

  • With your funding up front, we can jumpstart our donations and help fund startups even sooner (Even in the funding stage, $5 from every shirt you receive will still be added to our startup fund just as it would if you were making a regular purchase).
  •  Trep Wear will be able to secure a much lower cost per shirt, since our funding options include a shirt (or shirts) for yourself as perks. This will enable us to keep costs down so that we can focus on growth and funding more startups!
  •  Building a large following is the most important part of a new clothing brand, or any other brand for that matter! Any leftover funds will go towards T-Shirt giveaways at local schools to spread brand awareness and help drive more traffic to Trep Wear, which in turn helps us get that much closer to our goal of funding 50 startups every year!

What You Get

As you can see, we are offering some pretty sweet perks for your help. From exclusive shirts and stickers only available to you, to a lifetime supply of our designs, we want to make sure you are well rewarded for your faith in Trep Wear. With thousands of followers already (Facebook Page), you don’t have to worry about Trep Wear being another short lived brand. We are here to stay and would love for you to be a part of the family.

Welcome to the #TrepFam. Fashion with a purpose.

story:
Short Summary

Whorl, named “Best New Boutique of 2015” by Westword Magazine is so excited to announce our private label to launch this fall! We are so grateful for the continuous support we receive from all of our clients, business partners, friends and family. In order to launch this exciting new venture we need your help!

We love to bring good things to great people! Imprint’s by Whorl is a refined collection locally curated, designed, and produced in Denver Colorado. The inspiration for this brand stems from our clients love of shift dress, and tailored ready to wear pieces that easily transition from day to night. With your gracious love support, we will be able to produce our first season, and continue to grow this brand and its various influential aspects.  

Design & Production

The Whorl team is dedicated to constructing a well-made, fashion forward label, and for us quality is essential. We have built a strong production team whose experiences in Design, Sourcing, Pattern Making and Production offer a talented mixture of industry professionals. Whether it’s creating flattering silhouettes, picking the most comfortable fabrics, or developing innovative ways to cut costs we want this label to offer affordable luxury.  

Supporting local fashion industry professionals is a major part of the Whorl story, which is why we are producing this line just a few miles away from the shop. Our team will be cutting and sewing at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design, and will work closely with the RMCAD faculty and students to elevate Imprints and the Denver fashion community alike.

Why does Imprints by Whorl need 10K?

This Indiegogo campaign was created to help with the costs associated with completing and producing the first collection of Imprints. 

Among these costs are:

·  Quality materials & fabrics

·  Local production

·  Designer fees

·  Unique Packaging

·  Marketing

·  Professional photoshoot for lokobook and online images

·  Production of lookbooks

·  Finalizing the online shop

Contribution go towards FEAR FREE

Fear Free is a non-profit that is in the process of becoming a 501(c)(3). Once established, it will begin providing a group environment for teenage girls with anxiety and depression to come together and not feel so alone. The group will be led by licensed psychologist and female mentors to help facilitate the conversation. Initial fundraising will take the form of silent auctions and community dinners that directly correlate with the private label launch. After the private label launches, a portion of each sale and events will go to Fear Free.

Risks & Challenges

This will be Imprint's first time producing work at a larger scale. The designers have previously designed individual pieces for clients, so this Indiegogo campaign will put our new production model to the test. So please be patient while we work with our timeline.

Rewards

This campaign invites you to support Imprints by Whorl simply giving to the cause and also offers the unique opportunity to receive a piece or two before they go on sale. 

Please check out the exciting rewards Imprints is offering for this campaign on the right-hand side of this page. Feel free to email us if you have any questions: hello@whorlshop.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? Share on social media through the Indiegogo tools and follow us on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram @whorlshop! 

Future Goals

Moving forward, Imprints by Whorl is looking forward to identifying seasonal trends and client needs to produce two collections per year.

A huge THANK YOU to Falon Wilson for the production and editing of the video! 

Music credit:

Freesound.org, Desert Springs by Alkama, Aziba by DJ Sayron & Sory

story:
UPDATE 20 Dec 2014: If you’ve come late to the campaign, never fear! You can now preorder the XOO belt from xoo.co.

UPDATE 26 Nov 2014: We’ve released a new line of belts in collaboration with the incredible Casely-Hayford fashion house. Designs and information a few scrolls down (in the ‘A Range Of Styles’ section).

Say Hello To Our Flexy Beast

The original wearable, rebuilt for modern lifestyles

The XOO Belt is a simple solution to an everyday problem: smartphone battery life. No new gadget to lug around but something we wear everyday anyway, redesigned with the help of some clever new technology.

It looks, feels and weighs about the same as a really nice belt… but comes with a mighty 2,100mAh of hidden charge and can charge pretty much any device.

Mentions

Nice people saying nice things

“Nifty’s Xoo is a belt for Batman that Bruce Wayne could wear” // The Verge

“Charging my Nexus 5 was as simple as popping out the lead and attaching the phone” // The Next Web

“Nifty is threatening to breathe new life into the humble waist-based loop” // Yahoo! Tech

“A collaboration that celebrates the ever growing relationship between tech and fashion” // Wired

“A belting idea! […] We absolutely love the idea of being able to top up our phones or other gadgets without having to worry about remembering any additional chargers” // Gadget Show

How it works

Charging made simple

The charging wire is magnetically (and invisibly) nestled against the inside of the belt when not in use. Flick down to reveal, plug it in and pop your phone in your pocket—then carry on about your day. Unplug and flick back up when you’re done.

POCKET-CHARGING // You keep your phone in your pocket so that’s where we charge it.

TOP-UP-AS-YOU-GO // Power-up in the background as you go about your day.

WHEREVER, WHENEVER // Office, bar, train or half way up a mountain. If you’re wearing trousers it’s there when you want it.

NOTHING TO SHOUT ABOUT // No complicated set-up or strange bulges. Just a simple wire that hides away.

4 Steps And Off You Go

 

The Belt

A Wearable You’ll Actually Want To Wear

 

Charging your phone is only half the job; we wanted to make sure the belt wasn’t an afterthought.

ONLY THE BEST MATERIALS // We’ve chosen full-grain tanned leather to create a premium belt that’s hard-wearing enough for everyday life.

PROFESSIONAL DESIGN // We’re working with experienced designers on every aspect of the belt’s appearance.

MULTIPLE SIZES // Shipping in small (28–34"), medium (32–38"), large (36–42") and extra-large (40–46").
 

The Buckle

Better Than ‘Good Enough’

 

Each buckle contains 2 charging points—to transfer charge in and out of the belt—along with 2x400mAh lithium-ion batteries. We opted to use a ratchet mechanism to better secure your belt along with zinc buckles for solid wear and a beautiful finish.

POLISHED ZINC // We tried many materials; we chose zinc for its resilience and quality finish.

A PERFECT FIT, EVERY TIME // Unlike traditional pin-to-hole belts, our ratchet allows 1/4" adjustments for the snuggest fit.

HOLD TO RELEASE // We’ve included a quick release mechanism to smoothly de-belt.

KNOW WHERE YOU STAND // Five LEDs hidden on the upper side of the buckle show you how much battery you have remaining.

​

Shipping

Delivering To Your Doorstep

We’ve done our best to minimize the costs of shipping and have discussed options with all the big couriers. We’re really happy that we’ve managed to keep costs down and even offer free shipping to most countries.

Unfortunately we can’t manage that for all; in order to deliver a product like this safely and securely some extra costs are unavoidable for certain countries.

If you’re in one of those countries that requires an extra shipping fee please include an ‘additional gift’ (as IndieGoGo calls it) equal to the shipping amount on the perk confirmation page.

Our shipping costs are as follows:

Free for: Anyone in USA, Canada, EU, Norway and Switzerland.

$15 for: Australia, China, Hong Kong, Japan, New Zealand, Macau, Malaysia, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan & Thailand.

$40 for: Everyone else.

Timeline

What we’re doing and when you’ll have it

Based on our experience and extensive conversations with our manufacturing partners we’ve put together a detailed timeline as listed below. Excepting any unforseeable events we should start shipping in July.

Frequently Asked Questions

When will you start shipping?We expect to start shipping orders in July 2015.

When do I choose my belt colour and style of buckle?Shortly after the conclusion of the campaign (approximately 2 weeks afterwards) we will send out a survey where you will be able to select what colour leather strap and which buckle type you would like.

What will be included in the box?For everyone who ordered the standard belt package the following items will be included:- 1x buckle - 1x leather strap - 1x low-profile USB-to-microUSB cable

What are the belt sizes available?We’re currently making belt in size in small (28–34"), medium (32–38"), large (36–42") and extra-large (40–46").

We’re considering expanding the range to include larger sizes. Currently we’re gauging interest—if this applies to you please join our larger size mailing list.

Is it safe to wear?Unlike the lithium-ion batteries that are found in most rechargeable devices—like phones—the flexible batteries encapsulated in our belt are composed of a solid lithium ceramic polymer electrolyte (which means no liquid that can leak and no flammable material that can burn).

Can I take it through airport security?Every effort has been made to conform to the safety parameters set out by the Civil Aviation Authority.

The batteries within the XOO Belt are certified by the manufacturer as ultra safe, being highly resistant to high temperatures, electrical damage, physical impact and even cutting and piercing.

However, as this is a new and innovative piece of technology, we cannot guarantee that all airlines will allow passengers to travel with the XOO Belt and we therefore recommend consulting your airline carrier before travelling with the item.

How do I charge the belt?The belt comes with a microUSB port built into the buckle and charges in the same way as your mobile devices—plugged into the wall with a USB-wall adaptor.

The low-profile USB-to-microUSB adaptor used to charge devices from the belt can also be taken out, turned around and used to charge the belt from a computer.

How long will it take to charge the belt?It takes approximately 3 hours to charge the belt via a USB port.

How long will it take to charge my phone?The belt transfers its entire 2,100mAh charge in around 3 hours but the time taken to charge a phone—which depends on the size of your phone’s battery—will vary.

An iPhone 6 for instance (with a 1,810mAh battery) will usually take just over 2 and a half hours to fully charge from empty.

Does it work with Apple devices?It requires a microUSB-to-Lightning adaptor add-on—we’re supplying official MFi certified adaptors to backers free with the belt.

Technical dimensions?The buckle: 39mm x 86mm x 18mm
The belt: 35mm x 4mm-2mm (it has feathered edges) x 750mm–1,100mm (depending on size chosen).

The charging wire is magnetically (and invisibly) nestled against the inside of the belt when not in use. Flick down to reveal, plug it in and pop your phone in your pocket—then carry on about your day. Unplug and flick back up when you’re done.POCKET-CHARGING // You keep your phone in your pocket so that’s where we charge it.TOP-UP-AS-YOU-GO // Power-up in the background as you go about your day.WHEREVER, WHENEVER // Office, bar, train or half way up a mountain. If you’re wearing trousers it’s there when you want it.NOTHING TO SHOUT ABOUT // No complicated set-up or strange bulges. Just a simple wire that hides away.4 Steps And Off You Go
   
 
The Belt
A Wearable You’ll Actually Want To Wear
 Charging your phone is only half the job; we wanted to make sure the belt wasn’t an afterthought.ONLY THE BEST MATERIALS // We’ve chosen full-grain tanned leather to create a premium belt that’s hard-wearing enough for everyday life.PROFESSIONAL DESIGN // We’re working with experienced designers on every aspect of the belt’s appearance.MULTIPLE SIZES // Shipping in small (28–34"), medium (32–38"), large (36–42") and extra-large (40–46"). 
The Buckle
Better Than ‘Good Enough’
 Each buckle contains 2 charging points—to transfer charge in and out of the belt—along with 2x400mAh lithium-ion batteries. We opted to use a ratchet mechanism to better secure your belt along with zinc buckles for solid wear and a beautiful finish.POLISHED ZINC // We tried many materials; we chose zinc for its resilience and quality finish.A PERFECT FIT, EVERY TIME // Unlike traditional pin-to-hole belts, our ratchet allows 1/4" adjustments for the snuggest fit.HOLD TO RELEASE // We’ve included a quick release mechanism to smoothly de-belt.KNOW WHERE YOU STAND // Five LEDs hidden on the upper side of the buckle show you how much battery you have remaining.​
Shipping
Delivering To Your Doorstep
We’ve done our best to minimize the costs of shipping and have discussed options with all the big couriers. We’re really happy that we’ve managed to keep costs down and even offer free shipping to most countries.Unfortunately we can’t manage that for all; in order to deliver a product like this safely and securely some extra costs are unavoidable for certain countries.If you’re in one of those countries that requires an extra shipping fee please include an ‘additional gift’ (as IndieGoGo calls it) equal to the shipping amount on the perk confirmation page.Our shipping costs are as follows:Free for: Anyone in USA, Canada, EU, Norway and Switzerland.$15 for: Australia, China, Hong Kong, Japan, New Zealand, Macau, Malaysia, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan & Thailand.$40 for: Everyone else.
Timeline
What we’re doing and when you’ll have it
Based on our experience and extensive conversations with our manufacturing partners we’ve put together a detailed timeline as listed below. Excepting any unforseeable events we should start shipping in July. Frequently Asked QuestionsWhen will you start shipping?We expect to start shipping orders in July 2015.When do I choose my belt colour and style of buckle?Shortly after the conclusion of the campaign (approximately 2 weeks afterwards) we will send out a survey where you will be able to select what colour leather strap and which buckle type you would like.What will be included in the box?For everyone who ordered the standard belt package the following items will be included:- 1x buckle - 1x leather strap - 1x low-profile USB-to-microUSB cable
What are the belt sizes available?We’re currently making belt in size in small (28–34"), medium (32–38"), large (36–42") and extra-large (40–46").
We’re considering expanding the range to include larger sizes. Currently we’re gauging interest—if this applies to you please join our larger size mailing list.
Is it safe to wear?Unlike the lithium-ion batteries that are found in most rechargeable devices—like phones—the flexible batteries encapsulated in our belt are composed of a solid lithium ceramic polymer electrolyte (which means no liquid that can leak and no flammable material that can burn).
Can I take it through airport security?Every effort has been made to conform to the safety parameters set out by the Civil Aviation Authority.
The batteries within the XOO Belt are certified by the manufacturer as ultra safe, being highly resistant to high temperatures, electrical damage, physical impact and even cutting and piercing.
However, as this is a new and innovative piece of technology, we cannot guarantee that all airlines will allow passengers to travel with the XOO Belt and we therefore recommend consulting your airline carrier before travelling with the item.

How do I charge the belt?The belt comes with a microUSB port built into the buckle and charges in the same way as your mobile devices—plugged into the wall with a USB-wall adaptor.
The low-profile USB-to-microUSB adaptor used to charge devices from the belt can also be taken out, turned around and used to charge the belt from a computer.
How long will it take to charge the belt?It takes approximately 3 hours to charge the belt via a USB port.
How long will it take to charge my phone?The belt transfers its entire 2,100mAh charge in around 3 hours but the time taken to charge a phone—which depends on the size of your phone’s battery—will vary.
An iPhone 6 for instance (with a 1,810mAh battery) will usually take just over 2 and a half hours to fully charge from empty.
Does it work with Apple devices?It requires a microUSB-to-Lightning adaptor add-on—we’re supplying official MFi certified adaptors to backers free with the belt.Technical dimensions?The buckle: 39mm x 86mm x 18mmThe belt: 35mm x 4mm-2mm (it has feathered edges) x 750mm–1,100mm (depending on size chosen).

story:
Our online store is now open!

Please visit vario.sg 


Wear your Personality

NATO straps are flexible and practical, but they certainly lack a healthy dose of personality. 

Professional graphic designer Ivan Chua was yearning for a way to customize the looks of his favourite wristwatches, when he came up with VARIO, a great way to dress up your watch to your own taste! 

With the help of his trusted team, Ivan came up with a selection of 10 unique printed themes in 3 different sizes (18,20,22mm) for his custom VARIO straps! 

Watch Face

Case Material:  Alloy (Ion-Plated Silver colour) with Stainless Steel Case Back
Case Diameter: 38 mm
Strap Width: 20 mm
Dial Window Material: Mineral Glass
Display: Analog
Movement: Japanese Quartz
Water Resistant: 3 ATM
Warrenty: 1 Year

Warranty does not cover:  

  • The life of the battery 
  • Wear and tear and aging (e.g. scratched crystal; alteration of the color and/or material of watch case; peeling of the plating) 
  • Any damage on any part of the watch resulting from abnormal/abusive use, lack of care, negligence, accidents (knocks dents, crushing, broken crystal, etc.) 



mentioned on



Why NATO straps?
  • Comfortable
  • Washable
  • Perfect for summer heat

FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING VIA REGISTERED AIRMAIL

Customers who purchase 2 Straps from indiegogo will get a watch pouch for FREE. 

Customers who purchase 3 Straps from indiegogo will get a watch roll for FREE. 

Please add $2 to your contribution if u need a spring bar removal tool


please like us on facebook

please follow us on instagram



FAQ

Q: How to check which NATO strap size to get?

measure your lug width as shown in picture. the one in picture is 20mm

Q:How to convert your watch for NATO strap?


or you can always get your nearest watch technician to do it for you. it's a simple 2 mins job.

Q: Can i choose the design and size of my strap?

A: Yes you can. We will email a survey to every person who contributes to our campaign and that's where you will select the straps you want. Indiegogo will provide us with your email address in order to do so.

Q: If I buy multiple straps, can I get any combination of the styles?

A: Yes, you are able to get any combination you would like. For example, if you are ordering 4 straps, you can get all 4 of the same style and size (18mm,20mm,22mm) or mix it up any way you like. you can choose between silver,gold,rose gold,black metal buckle.

Q: Can I still buy your strap if my strap size is 19mm, 21mm or 23mm?

A: Yes, you can buy 1mm smaller and it will still fit relatively well.

Q: When will my watch strap(s) arrive?

A: We have ready stock for the straps. Once u've emailed us your order, it will be mailed out within 48 hours. 

Q: Do you ship internationally?

A: Yes we do! Our straps ship worldwide and shipping is free of charge via registered air mail. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

More questions? We're here for you!

If you have questions about VARIO straps or our campaign, you can email Ivan at varioeveryday@gmail.com .  If you are looking to cover our story, please email us and we will supply you with a press kit.

More community photos can be found on gallery page

story:
Jewelry In Motion 

Kinetics12 is a small start-up company, a for profit LLC, consisting of a single owner who is willing to bring in extra investing partners to place kinetic jewelry in every store in the country while bringing jobs to Michigan.

My name is Cary Stewart and I’m out to revolutionize the jewelry industry.  I as born and raised in Grand Rapids, Michigan; one out of six, my designation would be 5 of 6.  From a very early age, I loved to tinker and experiment with anything I could get my hands on.  The hardware store is my equivalent to a kid in a candy store.  I have worked in the medical field for over 15yrs but I have realized that I should have studied some form of engineering.  I like to create.  (Close your eyes, think it, design it, make it work ~my motto)

Kinetics 12’s name means jewelry in motion.  

Creation of Kinetics 12

In order to revolutionize the jewelry industry, kinetics 12 needs revenue to open its doors.

     The major expense is for design molds to be created followed by packaging and shipping.

 I currently have 3 designs but would love to push it up to 10 before mass production can be started.

Pushing the World into Motion.

     I believe that Kinetics 12 can be a major force in the jewelry industry.   The same way that Ford changed the auto industry, we can do it here.  Help me bring jobs to Michigan and bring back a work environment where respect and dedication has true meaning in the workplace.  But first, we need to open the doors and start producing product, so please invest or donate.

Please use the Indiegogo share tool.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
With $100,000,
we'll begin empowering
every child in every school
with myActions bracelets
and tablets for sharing
their actions to create
a better world.

Champions for a New Generation

Thane MaynardDhani Jones

Executive Director of the Cincinnati ZooFounder of BowTie Cause, Former NFL Player

 Project

 Impact

 Tech

 Press

 Perks

 Team

_________________________________________________________________________

  A New Generation of Change


·  RFID Bracelets | inexpensive -
no smartphones or apps required

·  Tablets | quickly share actions and
see personal and collective impact

·  COPPA compliant system |
safe community for children under 13

With your support, every child in every school will have the opportunity to share their sustainable, caring and healthy actions with a simple swipe of a RFID bracelet on tablets at their schools and at home from any device.


A successful $100,000 campaign will advance our work from fully functional "prototype software and hardware" to "turnkey technology programs" ready for elementary, middle and high schools by this Fall. 

_________________________________________________________________________

  Real World Impact

As each real-world action is shared on the myActions platform, we recognize and celebrate the impact of both the individual action and the collective total of all students.  These actions inspire others to do more and share more. Today's youth are growing up in a world of social tools and digital savvy.  They focus their energy and engage their friends when the experience is social and worthwhile.  

Extending to a younger audience will unlock a wave of positive change.  What is possible? The spirit of this generation is contagious; college students embraced myActions and spread it across friends, clubs and campus with simple everyday actions.  It is time to scale and empower this entire new generation to lead the way.

TODAY College Students                              IMAGINE If every child...                

75 campuses                                                    was inspired to take one action.

100,000+ individual actions                         In just 1 day, if every child...

_________________________________________________________________________

  Technology

Meaningful Experiences | We design platforms with an understanding of the influences and desired experiences to inspire each age group.  The preferences and priorities between elementary, middle and high school are significantly different, yet each can be activated to achieve a shared positive outcome.  This entire generation demands authenticity from friends, products and organizations.  myActions amplifies real action and impact while allowing the students to shape the virtual community culture.  We have developed proven technology and an engagement methodology specific for youth audiences to inspire, connect and activate green and good behaviors. 

Social Matters | Kids and teens are willing to try new things and they prioritize anything social.  However "it" must be engaging and worthwhile to continue to earn their sought-after time and attention.  We incorporate gamification, social motivations and a personal connection to a cause into our design to engage every new member. Our technology lets all users participate comfortably within their personal style: a curious individual eager to explore,  a friend who showcases their most interesting achievements to gain recognition and inspire others, and leaders who can demonstrate success and motivate friends, clubs, classrooms and their school.

COPPA Protecting Our Youth | Children under the age of 13 are as passionate about causes and conservation as older kids and are as eager to share their progress and be change makers.  We have developed a COPPA compliant system which protects the identify of kids through the use of avatars and simulated environments so they can share actions, see their impact and receive safe encouragement from the community.  

RIFD Bracelets & Tablets K-12 | Introducing inexpensive RFID bracelets removes the barrier of privilege (smartphones) which is typically required to participate in a new technical innovation.  They also address the restriction of students using phones while at school.  Placing specially programmed tablets in strategic locations across the school allows for a simple swipe of a bracelet without disrupting the focus at school.  The bracelet also provides each student with a visible expression of their involvement inside and outside of school. 

Multi-Input Devices | Teens think nothing of their rapid navigation across a myriad of apps, programs and devices every day.  Text, check-ins and mobile are all natural and highly engaging social contexts for middle school and high school students.  Elementary aged children are curious, creative and eager to contribute energy, ideas and effort on any device.   Our current design has established many flexible entry points to meet any child at any stage.  

_________________________________________________________________________

 Press

_________________________________________________________________________

 Perks


  Sources of Inspiration


Thane Maynard and the Cincinnati Zoo

Thane, also known as the "90 second naturalist" as heard on NPR, and the Cincinnati Zoo have been an inspiration to our entire family for over two decades.  Their support of conservation, young people and education were instrumental in the creation of myActions.

Dr. Jane Goodall

Over 7 years ago, Michael's sister, Elizabeth, was one of a group of young "Roots and Shoots" members selected to present to Dr. Goodall in Chicago.  Jane's words were very inspring as well as her book co-written with Thane Maynard entitled "Hope for Animals and Their World"

Robert and Carolyn Buchanan and Polar Bears International

A presentation at the Cincinnati Zoo by a representative from Polar Bears International was the spark that led to myActions.  Robert and Carolyn were the inspirational leaders of PBI and their belief in the power of young people has been a guiding principle from our beginning.  They have become dear friends and great partners.

Dhani Jones 

Shortly after launching the very first version of myActions in our community, we reached out to Dhani because of his leadership in founding BowTie Cause and his involvement with "Players for the Planet."  We have continued working with him and his team ever since.  He continues to inspire us with his tireless community efforts and his generosity to our project.  

Tom Lovejoy

We heard Tom speak shortly after  launching our first version.  His words convinced us that positively empowering people with what they could do was far more effective than just talking about how bad the problem is.  He has been generous with his time and advice for almost 4 years.

Stana Katic

Elizabeth, Michael's sister, is a big fan of Firefly which starred Nathan Fillion.  After Firefly, Nathan became a co-star on "Castle" so naturally she watched and followed that show.  Nathan's co-stars from "Castle", Stana Katic and Seamus Dever, were featured in a youtube video called the "Alternative Travel Project" (see our Gallery).  Elizabeth showed it to us and in addition to inspiring us to continue, it led us to meet Dr. Jim Haw at USC.

Dr. Jim Haw

Jim has been an inspiration and supporter since we met him 3 and a half years ago.  We have been inspired by his personal story and his commitment to making a difference by building an innovative, powerful Environmental Studies department at USC.  Working with his students, we refined our platform and validated the power of college students in this effort.

Unnamed College Student

We were moved and inspired by an unnamed young man from a college in the northwest.  As a user of our college platform, he shared publicly that as a boy, 12 years old, he was aware of the financial difficulties his family was experiencing. He felt powerless to help and wished he had myActions back then because using it he could see how much he could help his family by turning off the lights and TV, and using less water.  He is one of the reasons are compelled to provide a solution for all students, regardless of age or family income.

story:
The Long Story

Hey! I'm Mattias, a 210 cm (6'11") tall guy from Sweden that is tired of buying too short clothing.

People taller than 190 cm (6’3”) have a problem finding a standard t-shirt with OK width and good length. Furthermore a lot of people - regardless of height - like their t-shirts and sweaters to be longer than average and still with a great fit.
It's almost impossible to find.

So Long Sven was born to solve these problems. I have already been to India visiting fabric markets, looking for manufacturers, label makers, zipper suppliers and more. Now, it's time to make it all happen.

The Collection

The first collection of extra long clothing will consist of 2 types of t-shirts, a tank top (or singlet), a sweatshirt and a hoodie. It's pretty standard stuff, but the unique thing is the length and the fit!

For example:
The average size M is 73 cm long.
So Long Sven size M is 81 cm long. And that's not even the longest model. Winning!

SLS #01 - Basic T-shirt
Basic t-shirt with smooth neckline and slightly tapered to get that nice fit.
Size Chest Waist Length
S 100 96 78
M 108 104 81
L 116 112 84
XL 128 124 88

SLS #02 - Oversized T-shirt
A more stylized t-shirt with deeper neckline, oversized silhouette and longer back piece. Very stylish and VERY long!
Size Chest Waist Length front Length back
S 104 104 80 87
M 112 112 83 90
L 120 120 86 93
XL 132 132 89 96

SLS #03 - Tank Top
Clean and crisp tanktop. Nice deep neckline and finish around the neck and arms.
Size Chest Length
S 96 78
M 104 81
L 112 84
XL 124 89

SLS #04 - Sweatshirt
Classic sweatshirt, a bit tapered for perfect fit.
Size Chest Waist Length Sleeve Length
S 112 104 77 70
M 120 112 80 71
L 128 120 83 72
XL 140 132 86 73

SLS #05 - Hoodie
Comfortable hoodie with nice length (of course) and big cozy hood.
Size Chest Waist Length Sleeve Length
S 112 104 77 70
M 120 112 80 71
L 128 120 83 72
XL 140 132 86 73


All measurements in cm.



The Girlfriend Kit

Another unique thing is the Girlfriend Kit. This free kit gives a lady the means to transform a So Long Sven t-shirt or tank top to a dress in seconds.

Why I Need Your Help

My goal is to raise $2000. That money will help me to:
  1. Create a big enough order to get production prices on high quality material - and make sure nothing goes to waste.
  2. Freedom to choose a factory that complies with the highest demands in regards to good work environment.
  3. Handle worldwide distribution effectively.

What You Get

For supporting this project I will offer you some cool perks. A place in my heart, your name on the So Long Sven wall of sponsors, laundry bags and of course the chance to call dibs on any product before anyone else. Yeah!


Ask Your Tall Friend - He'll Love It!

So far I've received great feedback from my tall friends, girlfriends of tall friends, random tall dudes and standard height dudes. I am certain this project will help a lot of fellow tall guys, boardriders, fashionistas and long lovers out there.

Other Ways You Can Support

There are many ways to support this project. Besides contributing, you can tell your friends (especially the tall ones) about So Long Sven.

Also, please follow solongsven on Instagram to get the latest updates.
Got suggestions? Email me at mattias@solongsven.com

In The Future

I am already planning for the future. Shirts, jackets and socks are some examples of stuff that tall guys have trouble finding.

I'm well aware of all the tall ladies out there. Don't worry - I'm thinking about you too!

Read more at www.solongsven.com
story_txt:
The Long Story


	Hey! I'm Mattias, a 210 cm (6'11") tall guy from Sweden that is tired of buying too short clothing.

	
	People taller than 190 cm (6’3”) have a problem finding a standard t-shirt with OK width and good length. Furthermore a lot of people - regardless of height - like their t-shirts and sweaters to be longer than average and still with a great fit.
	
	It's almost impossible to find.


	So Long Sven was born to solve these problems. I have already been to India visiting fabric markets, looking for manufacturers, label makers, zipper suppliers and more. Now, it's time to make it all happen.


The Collection

		The first collection of extra long clothing will consist of 2 types of t-shirts, a tank top (or singlet), a sweatshirt and a hoodie. It's pretty standard stuff, but the unique thing is the length and the fit!	
		
			For example:
			The average size M is 73 cm long. 
			So Long Sven size M is 81 cm long. And that's not even the longest model. Winning!

Basic t-shirt with smooth neckline and slightly tapered to get that nice fit.

story:
Short Summary

Abigail's Wardrobe is a bespoke dressmaking design service, that focuses on giving women the confidence to wiggle.

Hi I'm Abigail, I started Abigail's Wardrobe when I was 16 from my bedroom at my mums, over the years it has developed from an ebay shop selling vintage to my own made to measure clothing from a small studio in Folkestone. I set out wanting to make affordable clothing for women that actually fitted, I was tired of shop brought clothes that didn't accomadate my bust and found other friends had the same problem.

My business has grown but to a point where I can no longer keep part funding it with my job and keep paying for the roof over my head (I recommend if you ever want to start a business if you can stay at mum or dads for as long as possible!).

 Driven by an ethos for sustainable clothing & old fashioned make do and mend ethics- I love using reclaimed fabrics, organic textiles and reused buttons.

The Impact

£800, although It may not seem like a lot it would make such a difference to my little independent business. I started Abigail's Wardrobe with no money, and have since reused any profit and my second job wages most of the time, into trying to make Abigail's Wardrobe into this future vision!

With your help you can help me achieve my vision of lots of smiley happy women in gorgeous fitting clothes that in turn can enhance their confidence.

How your contributions will be used:

£500 dedicated to equipment that we need to progress.

£200 will be spent on the website, making Abigail's wardrobe more accessable through a proper online ordering system.

£100 will be spent on a new project that involves hiring a freelance position.


Please don't forget to share this even if you can't help with a contribuition x

story:
Short Summary

Passive Resistance is a socially-conscious brand that utilizes fashion trends as a form of empowerment.

  • My name is Elyse, I'm from Charlotte, North Carolina, and graduated from Boston College this past May. Motivated, driven, and always learning.
  • As a recent graduate, a black person, a woman, and an anti-Trump citizen it's easy to feel apathetic + powerless.  I'm action oriented so I paired my passion for style with my desire for justice and  and created the brand: Passive Resistance.
  • Passive Resistance has the ability to become a brand for the ages. It's a brand with purpose, and now, more than ever, people want to quantitatively understand the positive return that their purchases conceive.  Help me create a brand of the future! Your contribution will help me keep up with the demand that PR gear evokes, and you'll officially become part of the PR team. Peep the perks for specifics ;)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for 2,500 to cover the costs of initial product production, shipment, and packaging. The product is developed, all we need is the financial backing to cover the costs of demand!
  • Perks? You got it. 
    • $5: Heartfelt Note: compliments on compliments, ego boosters (we all need 'em)
    • $10-20: cookies + candy, handwritten note
    • $20-50: cookies +candy, handwritten note, social media shout-out (personal or business)
    • $50-100: Passive Resistance branded phone wallet, cookies + candy, social media shout-out, handwritten note
    • $100-200: Passive Resistance branded phone wallet, cookies + candy, social media shout-out, handwritten note, gift card for a dinner at a swanky restaurant 
    • >$500: Passive Resistance branded phone wallet, cookies + candy, social media shout-out, handwritten note, gift card for a dinner at a swanky restaurant, spa day
  • If my entire goal is not raised funds will be spent on shipment, product development, and social media reach.

The Impact

Is the safety pin thing, actually a thing? Yes, it's a thing, and together we can make it a movement.

Check these cool articles out:

http://www.snopes.com/2016/11/14/safety-pin-sol...

https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/14/fashion/safe...

http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/safety-pins...

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow, follow, follow on Instagram!
  • Like, share, and follow on Facebook!

story:
La campaña en ESPAÑOL


INTRODUCING HÖST

Höst Studios was founded in 2014 by Swedish designer Marie Simcikova, based in the inspiring city of Barcelona. 

Our goal is to create innovative yet timeless fashion that can be used for every day wear. We want our clothes to be practical and comfortable, whilst making the girl who is wearing them feel unique and authentic.

Our most important mantra at Höst Studios is that "All you Need is Less” and therefor we don't aim to be part of the "fast fashion" industry, instead Höst intends to maintain a sustainable approach wherever possible and truly be a "slow fashion" brand.

Another of our goals is to create minimalist designs, creating a strong look and making it easy to mix garments to create individual styles.


RAINY DAYS

For this autumn 2015, we want you to experience the rain as something fun, whether it’s splashing in the puddles outside or from the comfort of your home. 



To achieve this we have used some of the finest and innovative materials such as a ultra soft bamboo jersey knit to wear at home complimented by a translucent frosted fabric for the raincoats.


By playing around with these fabrics and combining them in different ways we have created a fun and innovative collection that will make you experience the Rain as something exciting and fun.


INSPIRATION

The rainy days collection stays true to its name and the rain has a strong presence in our designs – recognizable in the collections pattern shapes, color variations and prints.

QUALITY & MATERIALS

We have taken pride in making sure that the fabrics we chose for our designs are of a high standard of quality and durability. 

The materials are innovative, soft to touch and a pleasure to wear.




ADDING TO SUSTAINABILITY

We have sourced our materials from smaller suppliers, supporting communities that have sustainability in mind.

For this season, our materials come from two smaller suppliers that have these values in mind.

Our bamboo knit is certified by OEKOTEK 100 as being free from harmful chemicals and our plastic is made out of polyurethane.

By doing this, and working with a small production line we take great pride in what is Höst’s strong identity.



WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE USED FOR

1. Fulfill fabric orders

2. Production of a small collection in Barcelona

3. Trimmings, collection photography and Talent


IF WE EXCEED OUR GOAL

All funds that exceed our goal wil be re-invested in further expansion of Höst.

We will use these to Expand Marketing reach and fund our next collection.


IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL

If we don’t reach our goal, we will reduce our estimated production size so that we can fulfill our pre-orders and still offer a smaller stock this autumn.

_______________________________

OUR SPECIAL PERKS


The Parca


Our Rain Parka is a stylish way to keep dry and its translucent color means that it goes with anything. Wear it to an elegant dinner or on a casual Sunday stroll. It’s made out of a light, frosted polyurethane plastic with ribbed cuffs and neckline.



 The Rain Flow Dress


The Rain Flow dress was inspired by the elegance of rainfall and these materials imitate the same effect when worn. It's made with a bamboo and cotton jersey and is available in a creamy white, or with a beautiful hand painted raindrop print.



 The Baseball jacket



Our Baseball raincoat is made out of a soft, translucent polyurethane plastic with ribbed cuffs and neckline. The jacket is a pleasure to slip on over a tee on those rainy days to help keep you dry.



 The Rain Flow Tee


A soft and loosely fitted tee, in a gorgeous salmon color or with in off white with our handpainted rain print, flattering to all and easy to throw on with a pair of jeans or joggers. The beautiful black detailing on the shoulders gives the piece a classy touch when needed.



 The Rain Drop Shorts



Our Rain Drop shorts are made out of a high quality polyurethane plastic, the shorts come in a soft raindrop shape which is dramatic and elegant. 



 The Rainy Skies Sweatshirt


The Rainy Skies sweat is perfect to slip on when you need some extra warmth on those rainy autumn evenings. The sweatshirt is made out of an English fleece jersey, it’s complimenting geometric shapes and colors are strong but soft to look at.

_______________________________

PRODUCTION PLAN

·  March - May: The campaign launches so spread the word! 

 The more people that know the better our chances to fund our vision.

·  May: Campaign ends and the real work starts. 

 We'll make any final design tweaks and give the thumbs up to our manufactures. Our spot is already reserved in line so we won’t have to wait too long.

·  June - August: Reward fulfillment and delivery.  

We'll be updating you on a consistent basis and sending out the perks as they come.  We can’t wait to put a smile on your face.


SCHEDULING

Scheduling small production-runs is always tricky business.  Depending upon the season and the quantity of production, access and scheduling with a manufacturer can get complicated.  We're targeting June 2015 to start the manufacturing and with any luck and success we'll be able to keep this on time. We’ve already scheduled our spot in line to minimize as much risk as possible.

We plan to ship out all pre-orders during the month of August and will keep all our backers up to date on the production process through our website once campaign is finalized.


SUPPLY

We've have some of the materials from our suppliers but will need to order more for production.  Depending on the success of the campaign and the amount of material that we need to order, there may be a slight delay in the schedule to procure all of the necessary materials.  Normally our suppliers have plenty so we don't foresee this risk as being too high. 


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS


How do I choose my color option and sizing?

After the campaign, we will reach out and send you to our ordering process on our website where you can pick your  size and material/color options. 

What if my garment doesn't fit?

We want to make sure that you're 100% satisfied with your Höst garment and offer exchange and refund policies.

When will I be mentioned on the website?

Once our campaign ends will create a special Thank You page on our website where all our backers will be featured.

When will I get my Early-bird special?

We have scheduled to have the production ready by the month of august and will keep all our backers up to date on the production process through our website and email once campaign is finalized.


PLEASE NOTE

Duty/Tax charges: If you live outside of the European Union, you will be responsible for any applicable duty or Tax charges associated with importing our goods. Please check with your local customs/tax offices. 

Customs: Anything we send to you should not be an issue for customs and should clear easily but these services can vary from country to country. Some countries are known for being very slow with customs so please be patient. We will do our best to help you with any customs issues should they arise. 

Delivery time: In manufacturing there is always a risk that suppliers do not fulfill orders on time. While we are confident of our supply chain and the time allowances for hold ups, sometimes issues can be out of our control. Should any problems arise we will let you know and do our absolute best to make sure we can supply rewards by the estimated date or even before.

Shipping costs: Please ad 15:- to your order if the destination is outside of Spain. This is a flat rate applied to all international purchases unless otherwise stated. 


Would you like to support us by helping out with your talent, join the Höst team and share our vision?

 We are looking to make this small community bigger and would love to hear what you can bring to the table. 

Send us an email and let's continue the conversation there.

If you have any questions or doubts, please drop us a line at

info@host-studios.com

Thank you for your visit and support!

-Höst

story:
B25 by Dtrk Needs Your Support to Launch Feminine Edgy 2013 Ready-to-wear Line for Continued Charitable Fashion Shows and NYC Fashion Week in September!

Hello my name is Bradley Scott, I am owner and designer at B25 by Dtrk. I create unique one-of-a-kind garments that can be worn day into night. With my love of simplicity, asymmetrical design and leather detail; incorporated into the most easy wearing, well constructed garments. I don't consider myself as a trendsetter, but rather a designer that creates unique designs year round.  YES! I have a dream and a strategy in mind that will not fade. I am here to stay!

I am not just a designer whom just shows his collection quickly just to get a reaction. I am an exclusive designer who shows collections at charitable Fashion shows that will make a difference in others lives. In the last year I have committed myself in raising charitable funds with my collection. This includes, Sickle Cell and Cancer Foundations. I'd love to continue to benefit wonderful foundations with the construction of my new line, but I've attempted to fund this new collection myself from materials, pattern-making and final sample, but it has translated into higher costs requiring me to seek additional funding. For this reason, I am seeking your generous spirit and light to assist me with these achievable tasks to show at NYC fashion week in September and charitable fashion shows! You will be helping with the production of the line and backing B25 on the journey into the future.

https://www.facebook.com/B25.Designs

B25(Elizabethan Cipher, Brad)

Dtrk(Deitterick)

About Bradley Scott Deitterick (B25 by Dtrk)

Born in a rural town called Catawissa, PA. A New York-based Fashion Designer. He achieved designing fashion apparel after a vision he acquired from the loss of his father, George, taken by Colon Cancer in 2004. In 2010 he decided to go out on his own and launch his RTW Women's brand, B25 by Dtrk. The line consists of cutting-edge, effortless blended of textures, minimalist and tailored with a precise attention to detail.

Having graduated from the Art Institute of Fort Lauderdale in fashion design in '09, Bradley decided to make his way again to NYC to strengthen his technique and acquire a deep knowledge of the women's RTW fashion market and its dynamic. He encountered his aesthetic succeeding his research of the market and studying to master his tailoring skills. The B25 by Dtrk collection is a true reflection of the background of its designer.

He draws inspiration for his lines from everything and everywhere: architecture, NYC, and industrial elements from home state of Pennsylvania. His work is an examination of innovative construction and imparts a feminine spirit with an edgy emphasis.

International Fashionista.com Launch Party, B25 by Dtrk presents his Collection

What is needed to complete B25 collection

I do everything myself from the beginning of production to the final sample; Patternmaking, Fabric sourcing, Sketching, ect.

  • Purchase fabric; leather, silk, rayon, etc.
  • Sample Making
  • Acquire findings; Buttons, zippers, etc.
  • Notions; needles, thread, etc.
  • Photoshoot for look book
  • Road to NYC Fashion week

What B25 is giving to his Fans

  • A humble thank you for the gratitude of my backers
  • A shout-out on Websites; Website, FB, etc.
  • An Invite to my show, must be 21 and over(Travel expenses not included)
  • B25 support cancer wristband
  • HTC Eye Shadow, your choose of 1 color
  • HTC Felt tip eye liner, your choose of 1 color
  • #1 best seller Heavenly Touch Cosmetics lip gloss, your choose of 1 color
  • Skype Interviews or meet in person in (Travel expenses not included)

story_txt:
B25 by Dtrk Needs Your Support to Launch Feminine Edgy 2013 Ready-to-wear Line for Continued Charitable Fashion Shows and NYC Fashion Week in September!
Hello my name is Bradley Scott, I am owner and designer at B25 by Dtrk. I create unique one-of-a-kind garments that can be worn day into night. With my love of simplicity, asymmetrical design and leather detail; incorporated into the most easy wearing, well constructed garments. I don't consider myself as a trendsetter, but rather a designer that creates unique designs year round.  YES! I have a dream and a strategy in mind that will not fade. I am here to stay!
I am not just a designer whom just shows his collection quickly just to get a reaction. I am an exclusive designer who shows collections at charitable Fashion shows that will make a difference in others lives. In the last year I have committed myself in raising charitable funds with my collection. This includes, Sickle Cell and Cancer Foundations. I'd love to continue to benefit wonderful foundations with the construction of my new line, but I've attempted to fund this new collection myself from materials, pattern-making and final sample, but it has translated into higher costs requiring me to seek additional funding. For this reason, I am seeking your generous spirit and light to assist me with these achievable tasks to show at NYC fashion week in September and charitable fashion shows! You will be helping with the production of the line and backing B25 on the journey into the future. 
https://www.facebook.com/B25.Designs
