story:
The HDDWatch. The geek watch

Some reviews :
 - WatchItAllAbout  - JournalDuGeek   - W3SH  - PhaseDeLune  - The Watch Observer - Watchonista
 
La vidéo de présentation en Français :

Hi IndieGoGo,

Let me introduce the HDDWatch, the watch made from a 1 inch Hard Drive.


The Genesis of this project

In September 2013, while reading my favorite French watch forum, I stumbled upon this picture :

This was originally a joke, but it stroke me. This was a GENIUS idea ! This small Hard-Disk-Drive (HDD) was exactly the right size for a watch.

It took me about 4 seconds to decide to try to turn this joke into a reality.

I already had some experience with designing and producing watches (see below), so I knew I could do it.

So, the journey started. I first had to find and buy the small HDD. Turned out that the Microdrive is simply perfect for this. Perfect size, and as it was almost killed by the Memory cards, the price was also perfect.

Then, on to designing the case. Using Corel Draw and SolidWorks, I built the case around the size and shape of the HDD plate.

The band would be aligned to the axis of the disk. This was for both practical and esthetical reasons.

I then proceeded to making this watch in a 3D software :


More than one year after, the result is :



So, what's this watch ?

Most important thing : This is NOT a smart watch. While it is made from a Hard-Disk Drive, it is nothing more than a watch. You won't be able to use it as a storage. Unless you put a Post-it note on the watch's glass.

So, if the HDDwatches is not a smart watch, what is it ?

Well, it is simply a watch with a fun design that (as far as I Googled it) doesn't exist anywhere else. There are some clocks made out from 2" or 3" HDD, but never a wristwatch.

The watch comes with a Band that has a PCB printing on it. The hands have the shape of the reading arm of the HDD.

And the watch is stored into an Antistatic sheet of plastic, and then into a card box.

The watch comes into 2 flavors, for those who wear their watch on their Left or Right wrist. Price is the same for both.

I wanted to keep the design as close to the original MicroDrive HDD, so I chose to put the name of the watch on the back.

The size of the watch is 47 x 37 x 8 mm (excluding crown & lugs).

The watch is available for Right or Left wrist. You can also choose for a classical black leather strap.


And there are 280 numbered watches (from 21/300 to 300/300. I keep the first 20 for my familly, friends and dog).

Why do I need money ?

I already have the Microdrives HDD, the straps, the movements, the boxes and the tools to build the watches.

What I need now is to have the watch case produced. Minimum quantity required by the factory to start the machines rolling is 500.

3,500 Euros will allow me to get to this minimum order quantity.


    Why "Made in France" ?

    While the cases, hands, bands and boxes are made in Shenzhen, China, I wanted to build the watches myself. Not because it would be cheaper (on the contrary), but because I want to put a little part of my soul into each watch. Don't worry, I've got a large amount of soul, so I shouldn't run short of it.

    So, the disassembly of the Microdrives, and the assembly of the HDDwatches are made by myself in Paris.  In case of a large amount of order, I'll probably ask for some helping hands, but still in Paris.


    Why I need your help

    The HDDWatches are almost done.  I already bought :

    • 500 MicroDrives
    • 500 Miyota GL20 quartz movements
    • 1000 sets of Hands (Hour + Minute)
    • 1000 Bands
    • 500 boxes
    • The mold for the watch case
    • The first 20 watch cases
    • All the tools to assemble the watches
    I've already build the first 10 watches, to be sure that I can do it.


    So, what's missing are the watch cases. I need to buy at least 500 pieces before the factory in China can start production.
    The case is made out of Stainless Steel (front, back, crown).
    So, 3,500 Euros is between 30 and 40 buyers. This low amount allows me to be confident that the project will be a success.

      Strech Goal 22,000 €

      By popular demand, here are the strech goals for the 22,000 € mark.

      Some people told me that, as the disk was without any hour marks, time-reading was difficult if you are not used to empty dials.

      So, I'm pleased to add this strech goal.  The dials will be engraved for each hour.

      You'll be able to choose between the little circles or the rectangles :

      It might be possible to offer other options for the engraving of the dial.

      Add 35 € for the engraving.

      Please note that this option is NOT possible for the watches that were already sent. (Unless you are OK to pay for the shipping back & forth. In this case, please contact me directly)




      Who am I ?

      I'm Jean Jérôme, from Paris. I love watches, and I love designing original watches.

      I already designed and produced 3 watch projects :

      The Origami Watch Company   

      (time on picture is 11:35)


      The Prague Jewish Clock

      This watch is the replica of a Jewish Clock that is located in Prague, Czech Republlic. The movement turns backwards, like the original clock.


      The Handless Minute Repeater (not for sale)

      Using a Minute Repeater pocket watch, I had the movement transplanted into a wristwatch. And as the time can be tell by activating the repeater, I had the hands removed.


      What's next ?

      If this projects succeeds, the next steps are to have a "Portrait" version of this watch :

      (this is a 3D-printed prototype without the dial).

      Another option is to use a mechanical movement : the ETA/Peseux 7001.

      This movement is the only one thin enough to fit in my watch.


      Campaign timeline

      • September 2013 : I discover the picture with the Microdrive on the wrist
      • October : Received the first lot of Microdricvee and designed the watch case and strap.
      • December : Found the company that will make the parts (case, strap, hands, movement)
      • June 2014 : Received the first set of pre-production pieces. Build up the first watches, check that everything is working fine.
      • October : Received the watch bands, hands, movements.
      • November : Ready for the IndieGoGo campaign
      • December : first watches start shipping (early December)
      • October 2015 : The HDDwatch with a mechanical movement (?)


      How can you help ?

      You may not fancy my watch, but you may know someone who would ? Please share the information. Let him/her know about this IndieGoGo campaign.

      You know a geek who likes watches ? Can you think of a better gift than the HDDwatch ?

      Spread the word, share this campaign to your network (and real-life) friends

      I also need your help to tell me how to improve this watch.  Tell me what you'd like to have.  Tell me what you like, what you don't like, and what you'd like to have changed.  I'll see if it's possible.


      Thank you so much for your interest in my watches. I'm sure you'll enjoy having it on your wrist.

You'll be able to choose between the little circles or the rectangles :


It might be possible to offer other options for the engraving of the dial.Add 35 € for the engraving.
Please note that this option is NOT possible for the watches that were already sent. (Unless you are OK to pay for the shipping back & forth. In this case, please contact me directly)

October : Received the watch bands, hands, movements.
November : Ready for the IndieGoGo campaign
December : first watches start shipping (early December)
October 2015 : The HDDwatch with a mechanical movement (?)


How can you help ?
You may not fancy my watch, but you may know someone who would ? Please share the information. Let him/her know about this IndieGoGo campaign.
You know a geek who likes watches ? Can you think of a better gift than the HDDwatch ?
Spread the word, share this campaign to your network (and real-life) friends
I also need your help to tell me how to improve this watch.  Tell me what you'd like to have.  Tell me what you like, what you don't like, and what you'd like to have changed.  I'll see if it's possible.

story:
Dear Indiegogos,


Thank you for visiting my campaign!



My Name is Nicole, I am 28 Years old and I am a young german fashion Designer.

I am studying fashion Design in Leipzig and will receive my qualification in August this year. 

__________________________________________________________________________

The cost of fashion for low-cost clothes

High on style, low on price. That´s what young people looking for.
But we all know the problems of degrading working conditions in garment and textile industry.

__________________________________________________________________________

I want to make a clothing line that is affordable, but of high quality, fashion you can wear longer than just one season.

And I want to start with a small collection in autumn. 

So I would appreciate it if you would help me and support me!


Please share!


First of all I need financial support for diverse fabrics, yarns and rolls of paper (to create my sewing pattern).
Second, I want to produce flyers and postcards for advertising.
Next step will be the own onlineshop, but first things first ;)

More informations coming soon :)

_______________________________________________________________________

Here little impressions (sorry for bad picture quality).




I Thank You!


Sincerely Yours, Nicole.

story:
INTRODUCING SheNative!

SheNative is a socially driven handbag & accessories company dedicated to empowering Indigenous women, positively impacting the way they are represented in the media, and changing how they are perceived by the rest of the world.

Devon Fiddler, Founder & Chief Changemaker of SheNative is an Indigenous woman of the Waterhen Lake First Nation in Saskatchewan, Canada. She founded SheNative with a mission to inspire Native Women and girls to see themselves differently. 

“I grew up a shy, timid Native girl, not having the best childhood experience with so much external negativity due to who I was, right down to the colour of my skin. I've since realized that I didn't have to be who I was expected to be, and I could be whoever I wanted! So, I did it!”

Devon recognized a common problem based on her own personal experiences and those of her friends, family and other Native women around her. She recognized the need for change, and started looking for a way to help other woman and girls, to tell them that it's okay to be amazing and pursue their passions. And so, SheNative was born. Devon recognized that changing the way Native women perceive themselves will start a chain reaction of empowerment, encouraging these women to provoke a positive change in public perceptions.

Why are we Crowdfunding?

Devon has been busy building SheNative from the ground up for over 2 years. She's written and refined business plans, raised funds through business competitions, designed and produced the first run of handbags, and so much more. Now, SheNative needs to bring the production of our handbags back home to Saskatoon! By doing this, we are able to hire a small production team of Indigenous women, creating meaningful employment opportunities for them. Once we are able to nail down the production process, we can then focus on the true goal: utilizing our success as a platform to spread the message and kick start this cause.

Goals

Our dream goal is to reach $100,000! This is what we need to bring the production team on and keep them gainfully employed. We are however, realistic. So, we've broken down our goals for the campaign to show what we can do if we reach certain goals:


Perks

So, you're probably wondering how you can contribute. Check out the perks below! Our goal is not just to raise money. It's also to get the word out about SheNative. If you pre-order any of our products, you are helping SheNative happen!


Note: Prices listed below do not include shipping and taxes.


Foldover Clutch: Also known as "The Confidence Clutch," this bag will be  a valued item within your wardrobe. Easy to carry, soft and comfortable on the hands. This bag is flexible enough the reflect your personality and style whether its a busy day at work or a night out on the town. This bag is big enough to carry a tablet, yet folds down small enough to accompany you anywhere you travel.

Each bag is made using a combination of traditional buffalo and deer skin leathers, as well as the more modern cow leather. They are adorned with a unique feather charm and SheNative clasp that are meant to surround you with happiness and good fortune!


Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.


Bucket Bag: This traditional bag, inspired by our Cree family heritage, speaks to a sense of playfulness! It is a bag for the casual, modern city dweller, and a vessel that experiences adventure with you!

Each bag is made using a combination of traditional buffalo and deer skin leathers, as well as the more modern cow leather. They are adorned with a unique feather charm and SheNative clasp that are meant to surround you with happiness and good fortune!

Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.

SheNative Standard Logo Tee: 100% White Cotton T-shirt to represent SheNative. This is has a slim fit, we recommend ordering a size up. We have sizes S-XXL.

Note: Early bird Logo Tees have sold out! We will be selling them at Indiegogo pricing in a couple of days, so keep your eyes out!

Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.

SheNative Compassion Tee: 100% Rung Spun Cotton Black T-shirt, that reads, "A River of compassion washes over my anger & replaces it with love". Slim Fit - we recommend ordering a size up. We have sizes S-XXL.


Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.


Feather Warrior Tee (Unisex): Beautiful Feather Fine Jersey Unisex T-shirt. Read #Warrior in the back of the T-shirt. This is our one and only item that includes men in on our mission. We know that there are some men out there willing to play a supportive role in empowering Indigenous women, and so the Feather Warrior is for all of those men! We have sizes S - XXL.


Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.


She Did Tee: Beautiful grey Bamboo T-shirt that reads, "She believed She Could, so She Did". Very soft and fine item. We have sizes XS - XXL.


Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.

SheNative Canvas Tote: We wanted to include a more casual item for carry books, or everyday items, so we've included a casual canvas tote. It's made of a heavy, high quality material with three print colours: Pink, Grey and Black. We hope to love it as much as we do!


Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.


The Impact

We're creating a Social Movement to change HerStory! 

As a new company just getting started, we are still exploring how we can further impact her life and HerStory in a positive way. We want to ensure that we are doing what we can rather than simply throwing money at a problem. 

We are we doing right now to support Indigenous Women?

  • Working with Indigenous Artisans, Designers and Businesses to supply, create or produce our goods (specifically targeting Indigenous women)
  • Putting aside 10% of profits to positively impact the lives of these amazing women
What do we plan on doing in the future?
  • The sky is the limit for us, as we know we can do SO much. Once we get off the ground, we plan on partnering with, or creating our own, social impact program. This program will be meaningful with tangible, long-term results including; Employment opportunities, a social movement impacting public perceptions, and a worldwide, universally inclusive culture based around the SheNative cause. 

The Start-up Journey

We've been working on this company for over 2 years, business planning, entering competitions, applying for funding, refining the business model, training, researching, designing and re-designing, running prototypes and samples. 

Through May and June, we crowd funded over $10,000 on a local Saskatoon Crowdfunding Platfor, for the research & development of our handbag samples. In addition to that, we've also raised over $80,000 in start-up capital through business loans, grants, and business planning competitions. 

What we've raised so far, is only enough to get us our first set of inventory, and our basic needs to start a healthy company. 

We found a Toronto based manufacturer to help get us started with our first production run. We do however, want to bring production to Saskatoon, so that we have the ability to create a REAL IMPACT on the lives of Indigenous women starting at home. Hence, our reason for Crowdfunding! 

Another big business decision for us was to offer an array of items such as T-shirts, Canvas Tote bags, earrings and other accessories! We want every person to have a way to get involved, regardless of whether or not you want/need or can afford a hand bag. Every penny counts!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate all the support! If you cannot contribute, we understand, and appreciate you taking the time to check us out anyway. Some other ways you could help:

  • Help us get the word out!
  • Like our Facebook page & invite a few friends: https://www.facebook.com/shenative
  • Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Write us at devon@shenative.com, and give us new Ideas of how we can further impact the lives of Indigenous Women! 

We thank you for all the support!
story_txt:
INTRODUCING SheNative!

SheNative is a socially driven handbag & accessories company
dedicated to empowering Indigenous women, positively impacting the way they are
represented in the media, and changing how they are perceived by the rest of
the world.





Devon Fiddler, Founder & Chief Changemaker of SheNative is an
Indigenous woman of the Waterhen Lake First Nation in Saskatchewan,
Canada. She founded SheNative with a mission to inspire Native Women and girls to
see themselves differently. 



“I grew up a shy, timid Native girl, not having the best childhood experience with so much external negativity due to who I was, right down to the colour of my skin. I've since realized that I didn't have to be who I was expected to be, and I could be whoever I wanted! So, I did it!”
Devon recognized a common problem based on her own personal experiences and those of her friends, family and other Native women around her. She recognized the need for change, and started looking for a way to help other woman and girls, to tell them that it's okay to be amazing and pursue their passions. And so, SheNative was born. Devon recognized that changing the way Native women perceive themselves will start a chain reaction of empowerment, encouraging these women to provoke a positive change in public perceptions.
Why are we Crowdfunding?
Devon has been busy building SheNative from the ground up for over 2 years. She's written and refined business plans, raised funds through business competitions, designed and produced the first run of handbags, and so much more. Now, SheNative needs to bring the production of our handbags back home to Saskatoon! By doing this, we are able to hire a small production team of Indigenous women, creating meaningful employment opportunities for them. Once we are able to nail down the production process, we can then focus on the true goal: utilizing our success as a platform to spread the message and kick start this cause.
Goals Our dream goal is to reach $100,000! This is what we need to bring the production team on and keep them gainfully employed. We are however, realistic. So, we've broken down our goals for the campaign to show what we can do if we reach certain goals:



Perks
So, you're probably wondering how you can contribute. Check out the perks below! Our goal is not just to raise money. It's also to get the word out about SheNative. If you pre-order any of our products, you are helping SheNative happen!
Note: Prices listed below do not include shipping and taxes.





Foldover Clutch: Also known as "The Confidence Clutch," this bag will be  a valued item within your wardrobe. Easy to carry, soft and comfortable on the hands. This bag is flexible enough the reflect your personality and style whether its a busy day at work or a night out on the town. This bag is big enough to carry a tablet, yet folds down small enough to accompany you anywhere you travel.

Each bag is made using a combination of traditional buffalo and deer skin leathers, as well as the more modern cow leather. They are adorned with a unique feather charm and SheNative clasp that are meant to surround you with happiness and good fortune!

Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.





Bucket Bag: This traditional bag, inspired by our Cree family heritage, speaks to a sense of playfulness! It is a bag for the casual, modern city dweller, and a vessel that experiences adventure with you!
Each bag is made using a combination of traditional buffalo and deer skin leathers, as well as the more modern cow leather. They are adorned with a unique feather charm and SheNative clasp that are meant to surround you with happiness and good fortune!


Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.







SheNative Standard Logo Tee: 100% White Cotton T-shirt to represent SheNative. This is has a slim fit, we recommend ordering a size up. We have sizes S-XXL.

Note: Early bird Logo Tees have sold out! We will be selling them at Indiegogo pricing in a couple of days, so keep your eyes out!

Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.

Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.

Note: Prices listed do not include shipping and taxes.

Help us get the word out!

story:
I started this in Febuary 2012 as a small hobby to keep my mind busy while trying to grieve for my Dad who I lost suddenly in September 2011. He had always told me to go for my dreams and to stop worrying what anybody else thought and when I lost him it gave me the kick uop the bum I needed. 

Almost a year from when I started this up I am almost at 2,500 fans on the Facebook page and almost at my 500th sale!! I cannot beleive how much support I have had this past year and it is so comforting to know people really love the stuff I make ^.^ 

So this year I have decided to take my business further with a few new ranges including a wonderful Gothic dark brass Victorian Mourning range, Gothic storage and home Decor and pieces based on the wonderful Edgar Allen poe! 

Being a one woman business and being off work for the past 5 months due to depression and a break down from stress and upset over losing my Dad and coming up with the money for my normal supplies is hard enough let alone supplies for whole new ranges so this is where you come in! 

If you cannot donate please don't worry but if you could share this page with your friends to try and help me reach my target that would be fantastic and I cannot explain how grateful I am to anyone that helps out in any way! I am offering small perks for donating on the sidebar as well ^.^ 

Thank you all SO much for your support in helping my dream grown and help me to make my Dad proud of the little business woman he brought into the world! <3

story:
Hello! My name is Natalie, creator of the Juneberry Bags. Welcome to my Juneberry Bags, Part II campaign!
 
Here's the story: I just completed a successful campaign on that other crowdfunding site (I won't mention any names), and I am endlessly grateful for all the support I receieved! Due to additional requests and needs that are detailed below, I've launched Part II here on Indiegogo. 
 
First, while I was able to raise enough money to order my first batch of Juneberry Bags, there are other integral aspects of the business I still need to raise money for: 
 
-Creating a functional web site where people can purchase the bags
 
-Marketing my product beyond these fantastic crowdfunding sites
 
-Starting the designs for the next five Juneberry Bags covers!
 
Second, several people have asked me where they can buy a Juneberry Bag now that the other campaign is over. Since I can't take orders through my web site yet, this is a way people can still pre-order the bag for less than what it will cost at retail price. It's a great deal!

So what makes this bag special? Take a look and see…

Ever since I can remember, I’ve loved having options. I adore things that are multi-purpose, unique and versatile. Take, for example, a purse: Sometimes you want to carry the bag on your shoulder; sometimes you want to carry it on your back. Sometimes you want a bag with subdued colors, other times you want to match your purse to a pair of rockin’ green pants! So why can’t you have all these things in one bag? 

You can. 

Born from my personal need for variety, the Juneberry Bag is probably the most versatile bag you’ll ever own. The Juneberry Bag allows you to easily zip on and off new patterns, from one original cover to the next, creating an infinite number of looks (including personalized covers—see below for details). The covers are all uniquely designed by me, and many of them are nature-inspired.

You can also change the bag's functionality, converting the Juneberry Bag easily from a shoulder bag to a drawstring backpack or to a messenger bag, giving you the opportunity to choose whatever satisfies your preference or matches your activities that day. And it does all this without compromising style. 

The Juneberry Bags in a Nutshell: 

-Easily zip on and off new covers, from one unique pattern to the next. Right now, choose from my five debut patterns. In the future, choose from a large variety of fun patterns, colors, and personalities to match any outfit or mood, all originally designed by me. 

-Or, send me your original design or photograph that I will make into a cover. Right now that process is more expensive, but my exciting goal is to offer that option more affordably one day.

-Convert the bag easily from a shoulder bag to a drawstring bag, enabling you to wear it on your back as a backpack. 

-Or, convert the purse to a messenger bag, wearing it stylishly on your hip. 

-The purse has snaps to close the bag, one inside pocket with a zipper and one without.

 

The fundraising: 

So. Here’s where you come in. As I mentioned above, your pledges will help me pay for the next very necessary steps in this big adventure: Finishing a full web site where people can check out the bags and order them, being able to market my product beyond these super-awesome crowdfunding sites, and allowing me the ability to start designing the next five covers for the Juneberry Bags. And what do you get? The bags for a great low price!! :)

And all of your support also allows me to get closer to creating a way that people can personalize their covers for a reasonable price. That’s right—you send me your picture, drawing, or design, and I make it into a cover for you. Unique, simple, and creative.

So, thanks for reading! I hope you like my purse philosophy, for it’s one of fun, comfort, and versatility! Thank you so much for your support!

Wear it as a shoulder bag...

...a drawstring backpack...

...or a messenger bag

story:
My name is Alyssa Davis and I am the designer (and one woman circus) behind Skiler Love! I launched my first collection, Bohemian Luxe, in September during BFW. Although I’ve faced some exhilarating challenges in the past few months, this is my most ambitious project to date (eliminate fear of being on camera, check).

To this point, I have been completely self funded, working 45+ hours a week at a desk job and spending almost every ounce of free time designing, creating, planning, and collaborating. A product of the DIY generation, I do everything from designing the products to hand making the jewelry, building my website & online boutique, managing all of the social media platforms, reaching out to other creative individuals to work with, setting up photoshoots and events, and anything else you can possibly think of to build Skiler Love as a brand. But I absolutely love it.

Thank you so much in advance for your support, you have my everlasting gratitude!

Skiler Love is an edgy jewelry line that gives women the chance to wear unique and fun accessories that makes their outfit pop! All of the items I design are handmade by - me - in my home studio in Boston. I tend to think more about quality over quantity and believe it’s important to know that you’re buying locally made jewelry that is never mass produced overseas. I also offer custom sizing and jewelry repair at no extra cost to those who purchase Skiler Love products, as well as eco-friendly packaging materials.

Styleweek Northeast is a week long event held in Providence, RI. It gives emerging and established designers the chance to showcase their designs to the public. I applied in the Fall and was recently chosen to be a part of the Accessories Showcase at Styleweek Northeast and the Go Red Challenge (or Red on the Runway), a benefit that pairs a Styleweek Runway designer up with a cancer survivor to model their designs and raise money for a great cause. It all will be held from January 27 – February 2 2013.

Being part of Styleweek means that I will have the chance to show my designs and products to different people in the fashion industry – including stylists, future customers, and buyers -  who may decide to put Skiler Love in local boutique around the Northeast (my main goal for the upcoming year). The online boutique was a great addition this year, but I really would like customers to have the chance to see the jewelry and try it on in person. It's also a great opportunity to get feedback to make our products even better!

A Breakdown of What the Funding Will Go Towards:

$800 Participation fee for Styleweek Northeast

$500 Marketing materials (business cards, lookbooks, banners)

$500 Jewelry supplies

$400 to cover a portion of travel expenses for my intern & I to attend all five days in Providence

$320 Indiegogo & credit card processing fees

$500 Estimated shipping costs to ship rewards

If over $5000 is pledged, I'll create a 6 episode series covering the first year of Skiler Love. That means you'll have access to behind the scenes footage from photoshoots and events, interviews with photographers, models, and designers  we collaborate with and a chance to witness the entire design process. Watch Skiler Love grow and develop into a new brand (a new video every 2 months until January 2014). If we fund over $5000, everyone who pledges $28+ will get a free copy of all 6 episodes emailed to them!  

Any extra profits raised will go towards jewelry supplies and vendor fees so that Skiler Love and come to an event near you!

You can also visit Skiler Love’s Facebook page and blog for loads of photos, information, and a daily update on what’s goings on. Also see the online boutique to learn more about the clothing styles offered in our rewards.

Want to support the project but is not interested in any of the rewards? Contact me and we can tailor something specifically for you!

 

 

 

Add the specific amount to any package to get limited quantity products (while supplies last)! 

Also a special to thanks to the many creative individuals I had the pleasure of collaborating and working with since the launch! You guys seriously rock!

story:
Celebrate the elegance & culture of African women and women around the globe!

 

An African Jewelry Tradition

  • I started Fulaba to bring authentic Fulani jewelry, handcrafted with precious metals and tell the story to a global market.
  • Africa has a rich jewelry tradition from countless ethnic groups representing nobility and royalty so we are expanding our collections for the world to know and revere these beautiful designs and its stories.

  • By backing this campaign you are uplifting women and people of the African diaspora while also helping to develop the finished jewelry industry in West Africa...so often we see just raw materials exported out of Africa causing the value to escape and be captured elsewhere.

Our Why

 

5% of Campaign Proceeds Will Be Donated to:

WAFRICA Guinea is dedicated to providing tools for a quality education
and advocacy for the human rights of women and girls.
 

Press

Alicia Keys Rocks Fulaba's Gold Dipped Fulani Earrings

 

 

Team

  • A results-driven strategic marketing professional and entrepreneur.
  • Over 12 years experience building brand engagement, growth and sales in B2B & B2C across industries such as tech, advertising, media, entertainment, consumer goods and e-commerce. 
  • Haby has the global business acumen and latest marketing insights to deliver.
  • Co-Author of the Women of the African Diaspora photo book

  • She holds a Bachelor’s of Music from New York University. Music Business Major. Cum Laude Honors.

 

  • Co-Author of the Women of the African Diaspora photo book
  • Diaraye has over 7 years experience in the arts and creative industry.
  • She is a lead organizer for the Centre des Cultures d’Afrique in Paris managing their annual conference bringing the arts (fashion, film, music, etc.) of the African diaspora to France.

 

Women of the African Diaspora Photo Book

Women of the African Diaspora Photo Book | Fulaba Jewelry from Haby Barry on Vimeo.

Nil Woloseavodé is one of the 10 incredible women featured in the Women of the African Diaspora photo book. Music in video is "Ife Me (My Luv)" by Sistah Iminah, another woman featured in this photo book.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are risks with importing products from West Africa as there may be some delays in production and delays with shipping. There is also the potential for customs duties depending on your country of residence.

  • We will do our best to communicate with you in advance with respect to any possible delays.
  • We will notify you if there is a potential of custom duty payments required to receive your order. 

 

Offer Support

If you like what you see, and want to do more, please reach out to become a Campaign Ambassador! We need passionate people like you to help spread the word.

  • Please email us at info@fulaba.com for more info
  • You are also welcome to use Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Celebrate the elegance & culture of African women and women around the globe!

 
An African Jewelry Tradition


I started Fulaba to bring authentic Fulani jewelry, handcrafted with precious metals and tell the story to a global market.
Africa has a rich jewelry tradition from countless ethnic groups representing nobility and royalty so we are expanding our collections for the world to know and revere these beautiful designs and its stories.


By backing this campaign you are uplifting women and people of the African diaspora while also helping to develop the finished jewelry industry in West Africa...so often we see just raw materials exported out of Africa causing the value to escape and be captured elsewhere.

Our Why


 
5% of Campaign Proceeds Will Be Donated to:

WAFRICA Guinea is dedicated to providing tools for a quality education
and advocacy for the human rights of women and girls.
 
Press


Alicia Keys Rocks Fulaba's Gold Dipped Fulani Earrings 
 
Team



A results-driven strategic marketing professional and entrepreneur.
Over 12 years experience building brand engagement, growth and sales in B2B & B2C across industries such as tech, advertising, media, entertainment, consumer goods and e-commerce. 
Haby has the global business acumen and latest marketing insights to deliver.
Co-Author of the Women of the African Diaspora photo book
She holds a Bachelor’s of Music from New York University. Music Business Major. Cum Laude Honors.
 
Co-Author of the Women of the African Diaspora photo book
Diaraye has over 7 years experience in the arts and creative industry.
She is a lead organizer for the Centre des Cultures d’Afrique in Paris managing their annual conference bringing the arts (fashion, film, music, etc.) of the African diaspora to France.
 Women of the African Diaspora Photo BookWomen of the African Diaspora Photo Book | Fulaba Jewelry from Haby Barry on Vimeo.Nil Woloseavodé is one of the 10 incredible women featured in the Women of the African Diaspora photo book. Music in video is "Ife Me (My Luv)" by Sistah Iminah, another woman featured in this photo book. 
Risks & Challenges
There are risks with importing products from West Africa as there may be some delays in production and delays with shipping. There is also the potential for customs duties depending on your country of residence.

We will do our best to communicate with you in advance with respect to any possible delays.
We will notify you if there is a potential of custom duty payments required to receive your order. 


 
Offer Support
If you like what you see, and want to do more, please reach out to become a Campaign Ambassador! We need passionate people like you to help spread the word.

Please email us at info@fulaba.com for more info
You are also welcome to use Indiegogo share tools!

story:
stranded.life will be a shop that produces and sells hand-made, screen printed, high-quality clothing such as t-shirts and sweatshirts, all featuring original artwork at a fair price. I am raising funds to buy the screen printing hardware and initial stock.

The designs for sale will have all sorts of themes, and we’ll also make tshirts for soc.ialis.me (a generalist, leftists & others Mastodon instance part of the Fediverse of decentralized social media platforms).
EDIT ; Stranded.Life will principally abord multiples undergrounds scenes, but will still have various designs unrelated.

Every produced piece will be numbered, and each order will come with some free stickers as a gift!

As well, I will:

  • document all the process of screen-printing and my experimentation about it via video and pics tutorials, in the mind of DIY. I will obviously offer my help and answering about anything related for making it completely understandable to beginners.
  • propose my services to small organizations, initiatives and others web-sites if they want :)

 

About Me

I’m known as @Famine on the wider internet, but not a lot of people know who I am. So, there goes!

I’m a 20-year-old punk who has hung around DIY, underground culture and political circles since I was a young teenager. I have two principal passions: dogs' behaviour & health, and drawing. I’m dealing with huge anxiety issues and more, which prevent me from holding a regular job (or a normal social life). My anxiety problems prevents me from doing simple tasks like buying things in small stores or answering emails or calls. The only way I can have a job is working alone, helped by my SO for the obligatory social interaction. Not easy to find! I also have two dogs, a cat, and a developer (warning, the dev is not fully trained and mostly a wild beast). I’m also a co-admin of soc.ialis.me, whose artwork I created. You can see some of my artwork on my DeviantArt account.

This project gives me the opportunity to work (doing something I like, what could be better!), and for a cause important to me.

 

Funding breakdown

It was not easy to found a quality screen-printing kit under €1k, so we settled on a semi-professional setup designed for monochrome, for a total of €518 incluing ink (RGB), curing agent, etc. In short, everything that is needed to starting screen printing t-shirts.

EDIT (being updated): I completed with personal founds for a better screen printing press who allows me to do quadricolors, still DIY of course ;) (printingplans.com)

Now, this fundraiser is to allow me to afford an A3 printer to print my transparent offset film, essential for the screen printing process. Buying inked film from a shop is very expensive, and will influence the price of the T-shirts, and it's a thing I want to avoid.

Why wasn't it a problem before? I previously wanted to print the design on shirts at an A4 format, so I could do that myself with our sweet, old printer. But I realized that A3 should look better, and would allow me to do more detailed artwork, even if it will use more ink and cost more.

Frequently Asked Questions

- All the designs presented here will be available ?

They are as we could say, "non contractual". As I don't have the screen printing hardware yet, they are not on real t-shirts! The designs can be subject to light modifications. I will however do my best for having the design as faithful as the original. (See also the question below about monochrome).

- So you will did ONLY monochrome ?

Don’t worry, no! I'll build my own printing carousel (to print the different colors). Until it's done, I will paint the color manually, with a good old brush. I’m very familiar with macro painting and detailed work. 

- What about the T-shirt/ink quality ?

It’s important for us to not participate in activities that don’t meet our ethics and convictions. Making DIY T-shirt allows us to control where our materials originate, and — by the way — the worker conditions and ecological impacts involved. We have opted to use Fruit of the Loom, whose products are certified by the WRAP and OEKO-TEX oversight bodies.

The ink we have chosen, TEXPRO is non-toxic, according to the OEKO-TEX 100 standard, and vegan.

- What are the shipping cost ?

We are based in Southern France. The most economical shipping we have found is La Poste.

For example, for a single t-shirt and some stickers, shipping will cost:

  • Europe and Switzerland: 5,40€
  • Worldwide: 6,40€
  • France : 3,40€

 

Other questions? Feel free to ask me anything at:

  • On the fediverse at @famine@soc.ialis.me
  • By e-mail at famine@stranded.life (please put a [indiegogo campaign] tag in the subject line — you know, I have some issues with reading mail :p)
  • And for the olders, on IRC at irc.random.sh:+6697 #random

 

soc.ialis.me flyer by @jd@soc.ialis.me

thanks to everyone who helped us in proofreading this campaign (@cute_weeds@witches.town, @b9AcE@soc.ialis.me, Pazon, @damfly@soc.ialis.me and lanodan. Maybe I forgotted some, sorry about that :)))

And for the olders, on IRC at irc.random.sh:+6697 #random
 soc.ialis.me flyer by @jd@soc.ialis.methanks to everyone who helped us in proofreading this campaign (@cute_weeds@witches.town, @b9AcE@soc.ialis.me, Pazon, @damfly@soc.ialis.me and lanodan. Maybe I forgotted some, sorry about that :)))

story:
Why "The Airy Glengarry"?

I wear a kilt uniform frequently as a competitive bagpiper. Living on the east coast of the United States and competing in the region's Highland Games and Celtic Festivals, I have worn the kilt uniform inclusive of a jacket and a glengarry - the equivalent of  encasing myself in wool - in the height of summer, with the humidity so high one can see the moisture in the air, and often with no shade in sight. This has not only been uncomfortable, but has compromised my performance - all you pipers out there know that perspiration dripping down your face can cause you to lose your seal on the blowpipe. For this reason, I stopped wearing the glengarry for a time, but many events insist upon it, and frankly, I feel it's more respectful and the uniform looks complete when I wear it.

Even the British Regiments eschewed wool doublets and wool glengarries when stationed in the tropics, wearing cotton doublets and pith helmets instead.  Sensible! Kilts and jackets are now available in lighter material than was traditional... I recently thought, why not the glengarry too? And so The Airy Glengarry was conceived.  "Old World Style... New World Comfort(TM)"

Pre-orders made production possible

I had a prototype made - the one you see all over this site.  I then launched a 10-day  crowdfunding campaign, which was very successful, and thanks to those who took a chance on this product, production of The Airy Glengarry is funded!  I know you won't be disappointed when your Airy Glengarry reaches you.

Folks can now order an Airy Glengarry from stock - simple visit The Airy Glengarry Facebook page and the FAQ section at the top gives instructions for paying via Paypal, or sending a check.  There is also an eBay listing for single glengarries if you desire the protection of eBay as well as Paypal. If you are interested in a Band Discount, message me through The Airy Glengarry Facebook page - I'm eager to work with you. Gift Certificates are available through this very page!

Right now The Airy Glengarry is only available to folks in the United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, and the United Kingdom.  Stay tuned via this page and/or "like" The Airy Glengarry Facebook page to receive updates regarding production, shipping dates, and promotions.  Thank you for your support.

Customer Reviews of The Airy Glengarry

"Mine arrived this week. Perfect for Virginia's hot summers!" -Jim Roberts, Norfolk, Virginia (January 25, 2017)

"Received mine today...well constructed... Can't wait to ditch the ghastly wool glengarry on those murderously humid summer days in New York..Goodbye stinky hat... Hello cool head!" - Al Gonzales, Highland Mills, New York (January 25, 2017)

"Got it in the mail today! It looks really good. Nice and light also. Haven't had a chance to try it while piping but I'm sure that will come. Added a feather Decoration that I got off of eBay for $4. Looks pretty spiffy. Cheers, and congratulations on a job well done." -David Parkhurst., Eugene, Oregon (January 25, 2017)

"Hi, Laura, the medium arrived just after we spoke and it's perfect both in size and comfort. As soon as Chuck gets the cap badge I'll be ready to go. Thanks, this is a great deal!" -Rick Winch, Brick Township, New Jersey (January 25, 2017)

"Thanks for this cool product. Literally and figuratively cool."- K. Adler, Batesville, Arkansas (January 24, 2017)

"I received the Glen today. You did a beautiful job." - Marco C., Merritt Island, Florida (January 24, 2017)

"Received mine yesterday - nice job!" - S. Allioux, Goshen, New York (January 24, 2017)

"It's really cool! I had envisioned it to be a bit stiffer on the sides, but it looks great! It's super light weight and comfy for sure. Well done! Fits great too. Looking forward to ma head breathin'!" - K. Wisehart, Norwood, Massachussetts. (January 24, 2017) (Note from Laura: a prototype was indeed made with stiffer mesh, but it was too see-through and looked porous, while the finer mesh fabric we ended up with still breathes, but looks solid from any vantage point except very, very close.)

"The Airy Glengarry arrived today and is a definite hit. The fit is good and it looks good. Thank you for all it took to make this nice product." - V. McCain, Fort Worth, Texas(January 24, 2017)

story:
Bringing Full Technological Functionality and Connectivity to Your Wrist

 

The world is getting closer together with each technological step forward we take. Smart phones fuse cellular technology together with the Internet to bring us into a world that is never unplugged. Staying connected is now a vital part of business, play and the overall human social experience.

Unfortunately, that it's that human element that still makes me prone to human mistakes — I'm constantly misplacing or forgetting my phone at the worst times, leaving me unplugged and at a disadvantage. Subconsciously, I suppose it's because my phone such a required element in society that I don't want to carry it sometimes.

But that's just not an option, so I started thinking about ways I could still stay connected without having to duct-tape the phone to my arm or strap on an unfashionable pair of Google glasses. Thinking about my problem, I looked down to check the time and the proverbial light bulb went on above my head—my watch was holding all the answers. Making a multifunction watch seemed like the right thing to do, so I sat down and invented the Q Watch (of course, it wasn't that simple—but for sake of brevity).

The Q Watch has Everything You Need to Stay Connected

Now while multifunction watches are nothing new—didn't we all have a calculator watch back in the day—there has never been anything so comprehensively designed as the Q Watch. This is the ultimate phone watch that will serve your every need. Further, the ultra-thin, lightweight, sleek design makes this watch aesthetically fashionable for just about any style—think Tony Stark cool.

The Q Watch can be your backup cellphone, your emergency contact device or your all-around, reliable main source of connectedness. It's that comprehensive. Plus, the Q Watch comes with a rechargeable battery. Bluetooth capable, a hi-def touchscreen, a video and still camera—this is the only multifunction watch that is actually deserving of that title.

Why this Watch NEEDS to be Made

Take a look at all the features I was able to pack into the working prototype of the Q Watch:

  • Network Support: GSM850/900/1800/1900MHz, GPRS
  • SIM: single SIM single standby
  • Watch Screen: 1.54' 260K colors high definition touch screen, 240 x 240px
  • Ringtone: 64 chords, support mp3, midi ringtones
  • Multimedia Support: 3GP, AVI, MP3, MP4, video recorder, voice recorder, FM radio
  • Camera: 1.3MP CMOS sensor, 640 x 480px
  • Support TF extension up to 8GB maximally
  • Support WAP, Bluetooth, MMS, SMS, GPRS etc.
  • Build-in calendar, To Do List, Alarm Clock, World Time, Stopwatch, E-book Reader, Calculator
  • Support JAVA2.0
  • Rechargeable battery.
  • Standby Time: about 100 hours

There is Nothing like the Q Watch Currently on the Market

The Q Watch just plain makes sense. It's amazing that there is nothing like it currently available, especially with the need to keep in touch driving everyday business transactions that make the world go round. This is a must have for anyone who needs to stay connected while on the go without being encumbered. There is just nothing out there that has all of these features and looks this great!

The Q Watch boasts so much!

  • Stylish
  • Ultra-Light
  • Touchscreen
  • Bluetooth
  • Multifunction Watch
  • Emergency Phone
  • Rechargeable Battery
  • Digital Camera
  • Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Fashionable Design
  • Convenient to Talk On
  • Hands-Free Answering
  • Comfortable to Wear
  • Ability to Take Pictures and Record Videos With Ease
  • Quad-Band Frequency Watch Phone for Worldwide Use

The Q Watch is perfect for those who might be a little forgetful or a little clumsy. Never drop your phone again, never lose your phone again, never forget your phone again—never again! From progressive businessmen to the busy college student—everyone needs a Q Watch...but not everyone can have one.

 

Why We Need Your Help

The Q Watch can only be made available to the public with your help. We've done all the designing and technical problem solving, working all of the bugs out. The prototype is on our wrists and if I do say, it's pretty darn cool. Now we just need to raise the money up to bring it to you!

We're looking to raise $10,000 for manufacturing and fulfillment. As a reward and thank you for helping us take the next logical step forward in connection technology, you'll get the early bird discount on the Q Watch. You'll be able to own the Q Watch before it's on the market. We have to warn you though, be prepared for a lot of questions like, “What the heck is that?” and “Where can I get one?”

On behalf of the Q Watch family, I'd just like to say thank you so much for taking the time to read and consider helping bring this project to life. It's been a passionate journey thus far and we hope that you'll help us take that final step and be a part of something amazingly cool, special and great—the Q Watch!

story:
We have provided a PDF version of our iBook while the actual book works its way through the iBookstore approval process. Click the image and Save it.

Some of the features including the photo gallery does not function in this version. You can email us at: cmatts@iwareit.com and we will send you a copy that can be viewed on your iPad.

  •  

Project Goals

This project is posted to help raise money to make the steel molds to produce the patent pending Corsair iPad stand. As you can see, there are many moving parts and each one needs its own mold.  Although some of them may be grouped in what is called a family or gang mold, the larger parts can not.

Exploded Parts View of Corsair iPad Case

No other accessory accepts multiple devices and allows their users to securely position their device in virtually any desired position, virtually anywhere. These features are not only useful for most of us normal iPad users, but are invaluable for professions that use tablets for their everyday jobs.

iWARE hands free accessories are very convenient for most of the disabled community who have a need for a secure iPad holder. With our wall mount cleat, you can use the Corsair in virtually any location. Even in places that have no surface that can directly engage with the C-Clamp.

The uses of this modular system are limitless. New uses for the Corsair are being discovered all the time. Here are some ways the original Caddie is being used:

  • Cooks and chefs working with recipes
  • Professions that use tablets for their everyday jobs
  • Musicians using tablets for sheet music
  • Photographers have used the Caddie for their art galleries
  • A few universities have purchased of the original iWARE Caddie: a major university in New York purchased 10 for their medical school in Neurology Department.
  • A Fine Arts university bought several for the music department.
  • A language school offers their program on the iPad and students use the Caddie in the classroom.


With the addition of modular accessories, even more opportunities exist.

Corsair is a modular accessory system that replaces several stand-alone iPad accessories. The video posted above illustrates the Corsair in action and I have also created a free iBook that further details this fantastic product.

It is important to me that this product be manufactured in America. I have sourced materials, merchants and a few mold makers that will work with me to produce this product. Supporting this project, creates jobs here in the USA.

I hope you get as excited about this iPad stand as I have been from the very beginning. There is no other iPad accessory that allows you to choose how you wish to use it, at any given time. From a hands free stand to a desktop stand to a portable carrying case.  Here is a list of the major features of the Corsair.

  •     Multi-Device Case
  •     Screen Protection
  •     Hand Tote
  •     Desktop Stand in landscape or portrait
  •     Hands Free Gooseneck Stand
  •     Cup Holder and Coin Tray
  •     Wheelchair Attachment
  •     Kindle Attachment
  •     Quick Release Connector
  •     Oh, and it looks good too. (Please see photo gallery in the iBook)


One important attachment is a wheelchair attachment which was requested by many parents of disabled children.


Wheelchair Attachment with Corsair iPad Case



The Wheelchair Attachment can be used anywhere


The engineering is complete and I have been working with the final prototype for two months. It has been field tested by everyday people in the real world. My goal was to ensure that the Corsair performed as advertised. Mission accomplished!

Grinding out the details

We are ready to move forward with the manufacture of this great device. We plan to produce The Corsair in Southern California with local talent and suppliers.


Corsair Hand Tote helps prevents hand fatigue

PERKS:



Here are some incentives that hopefully you will find of interest and value. You can see more photos in the iBook: for this project. Follow the link to the iBookstore.

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about this fundraising campaign and iWare's Corsair! We're really excited about seeing this product become a reality, and you're the ones who'll help us get there, so thank you.

Please reach out if you have any questions or suggestions: cmatts@iwareit.com

Thanks,

We have provided a PDF version of our iBook while the actual book works its way through the iBookstore approval process. Click the image and Save it.
Some of the features including the photo gallery does not function in this version. You can email us at: cmatts@iwareit.com and we will send you a copy that can be viewed on your iPad.


 

Project Goals
This project is posted to help raise money to make the steel molds to produce the patent pending Corsair iPad stand. As you can see, there are many moving parts and each one needs its own mold.  Although some of them may be grouped in what is called a family or gang mold, the larger parts can not.Exploded Parts View of Corsair iPad CaseNo other accessory accepts multiple devices and allows their users to securely position their device in virtually any desired position, virtually anywhere. story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Kerry Bufton, owner and one lady band of Atomica Designs.

I've been sewing clothing, self taught for a few years. I've recently started working with latex material to create clothing from.

I have loads of designs I would like to make, but sadly lack the funds to get in latex to try designs out on and get them modelled for my website. I would also take a class or two to get some professional training in latex creations and learn new technique

 

What We Need & What You Get

With the £500 funding I would be able to take my designs from a flat pattern into a wearable garment. Some of these designs are offered as perks (once it's been made to standard) so you can be one of the first to own a brand new design.

I would also be able to get the clothing modelled on real people instead of dress forms so it looks far more neat and professional. Even if I didn't reach the full amount of funding, every little bit will help and go towards expanding my business.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, I full understand! I would be so grateful though if you could spread the word to your friends who would be interested in latex clothing.

story:
The welfare of animals is important to us. It is our aim to provide the world of makeup-lovers and cosmetic-lovers with luxury animal-friendly, palm-free rich-pigment makeup; with no support at all to any unnecessary animal testing, ever.

The worldwide industry of makeup and cosmetics, for many companies, are unfriendly towards the lives of animals; their unnecessary and brutal tests of cosmetics on animals is something I strive to successfully participate in putting to a stop. I think it's important to say "it's not okay" to those companies in question, which can be done by supporting the very small percentage of companies that are willing to take priority of compassion. If our campaign is successfully funded, we will only source vegan, palm-free and 100% cruelty-free ingredients for our products; and promise to never test on animals or fund the act in any way.
If you have a passion for good makeup, but you don't support animal-testing, you will know how disappointing it is to find a lipstick or an eyeshadow in the perfect colour only to learn that the company behind it has partaken in animal-testing or has funded it. 

Our initial products will be as follows, until we can raise enough to spread out into all areas of cosmetics eventually:
Rich-pigment lipsticks
Liquid lipsticks
Lipglosses
Mineral foundation
Mineral eyeshadows
Blushers and bronzers
Setting powder
Makeup brushes

We have calculated that £1500 is the amount required as a seed to start creating and supplying these cosmetics. Eventually, we will grow our business to provide many further 100% cruelty-free cosmetics such as skincare and haircare.



Animal Testing in the EU:
The use of animals to test new cosmetics products or their ingredients is banned in the UK and all other member states of the European Union. Since March 2013, it has also been illegal to sell new cosmetics products within the EU which have been, or which contain ingredients, newly tested on animals. However, many international companies continue to be involved with animal testing elsewhere in the world, and bypass the EU Cosmetics Testing Ban by creating new products using animal-tested past-formulated ingredients; and also does not include the products already being sold and stock-maintained on shelves! 



What to do?
The best way to create a clear message that animal testing on cosmetics should be left an unnecessary act in the past is to boycott the companies which still support the funding of animal-testing. Eventually, (and it cannot come soon enough!) all cosmetic companies will genuinely be leading ethical & animal-friendly businesses; now that's beautiful!

story:
Great news - all this anti-Craig clothing is going to a great cause!

All money after covering costs for shirts, shipping, Indiegogo fees, and transaction fees will be given to the Rwandan Orphans Project (http://www.rwandanorphansproject.org).

That's right - I don't want to make any money on this campaign - everything left over after costs is going to be given to charity to support Rwandan orphans!

Just look at the "Craig Beveridge is a bad person" picture to remember why you need these shirts!

Now buy some bad ass stuff:

Sweet tanks

Sweet tees

Sweet posters

Sweet antagonistic lunches with Craig


Just look at him.


Here's a simple flowchart I made to show you how this works


This could be you..


Here are the various styles and colors available for shirts


For those of you wondering how much of your money is going towards charity, below is a current estimate of the total costs that are included in your purchase.  The total amount, minus these costs will be donated to the Rwandan Orphans Project.
Based on this estimate - over 25% of your $22 shirt purchase will be sent to the Rwandan Orphans Project.

story:
As seen in

Turning Plastic Bottles Into Bags

Our bags are the perfect pick if you’re looking for the right blend of style and function.

1. Recycled Plastic Bottles - Our Earth bags are the world's first impactful and transparent bags: made out of 100% recycled plastic bottles. 

2. Repurposed Billboards - The Hamilton Perkins Collection Earth bags are lined with repurposed billboard vinyl. Each bag's lining is different, each bag is unique. 

3. Design, transparency, and impact - Hamilton Perkins Collection bags reduce waste levels, cut carbon emissions in the environment, and conserve water.


Building a better bag

We had trouble finding a backpack that could meet our basic needs in a practical and socially responsible way. Most bags are one-dimensional and don’t give the traveler the option to choose the version of their bag that could make their life easier when traveling.

The Hamilton Perkins Collection Earth bag is an all-in-one bag that converts into a backpack or duffle bag. The Earth bag features a 3-way zippered compartment that allows easy access to laptops, books, and travel documents. The Earth bag affords the traveler convenience, allowing more time to make friends, and to look good while doing good.

With every bag sold starting at $95, Hamilton Perkins Collection and its customers reduce waste levels, cut carbon emissions, conserve water - and create jobs.

Design

Design and function are two driving forces behind our product line. Our approach to design has been customer-centric from day one. We take pride in coming to the industry from the customer’s point of view first and taking it upon ourselves to be the change we were seeking. We prototype and ideate to find what works for the traveler and what doesn’t.

We get excited about making something that doesn’t exist and seeing it bring change and make a difference. It’s about people for us and when they trust us to design the bag that they carry we don’t take the opportunity lightly. Our level of care sets us apart in a market where there are so many options to choose from.

Our Story 

Hamilton Perkins Collection was born out of a simple necessity: the need for affordable designer bags that look good, perform well, and make a difference.

Similar to many travelers in the world we had trouble finding a socially conscious bag that met our basic needs in a practical and responsible way. We researched the industry and found that most options were average quality. The majority of the bag makers maintain low prices with high levels of secrecy around how they achieve it. Other bags are excellent quality and cost way too much for the price. What is available to the modern traveler looking to find purpose in every journey?

We founded Hamilton Perkins Collection to be an alternative for travelers on the go.

We broke down the traditional walls of the retail industry and invited customers to share their comments and thoughts with us. We interviewed 1,000 travelers to start new authentic relationships and they told us how we could best serve their needs when re-engineering a classic travel bag.

Most brands look at philanthropy and giving as an afterthought but we see it as an essential part of running a business today. 

In collaboration with our workshops and suppliers, we committed to supporting fair wages and delivering value to less developed nations by sourcing raw materials that divert plastic bottles, save water, add revenue, create jobs in parts of the world that need it the most. We track our progress and submit to rigorous third party review to ensure accuracy and accountability.  

Billions of plastic bottles are thrown away each year. The average person throws away as much as 180 pounds of plastic in 365 days. It takes 500-1,000 years for plastic to degrade. We address these issues by partnering with organizations like Thread, to turn trash into fashion with every bag we sell.

Who says style can't have purpose? From bottles to bags!

Risks & Challenges

We set a goal to crowd fund a bag that delivered value and made a positive impact on the world. We researched the manufacturing options and implications of our raw materials and found that the world’s backyard would be plentiful with all that we needed to promote our project and ultimately offer a fairly priced item.

We have consulted with experienced mentors, business coaches, and experts in the social innovation arena for advice. We feel confident to take action and make strides towards our vision of being a responsible social enterprise that delivers for our backers and stakeholders. We intend to keep you informed of our progress throughout this project.

We even became a Certified B Corporation in the process. We now join forces with a community of more than 1,700 companies in the world with one unifying goal of redefining success in business.

Keep up with our progress on Snapchat (Username: hamiltonperkins) for behind the scenes news and updates. Feel free to reach us by email at info@hamiltonperkins.com if you have any questions.

CONNECT WITH US

Instagram.com/hamiltonperkins 

Twitter.com/hamiltonperkins

Facebook.com/hamiltonperkins

Pinterest.com/hamiltonperkins 

Snapchat: hamiltonperkins

story:
LASHES NEEDED A BETTER MASCARA

We were on a never-ending search for a mascara that ACTUALLY lengthened and volumized, instead of just "claiming" to. We also wanted a mascara that was safe to wear and wouldn't harm our eyes and didn't streak or clump...all without breaking the bank. We wanted a mascara that provided a confidence boost that, with each swipe, helped us conquer anything that came our way, but we never found one.

 

So, we decided to create one!

 

Just like a chocolate, vanilla swirl ice cream cone, the Lash Next Door consists of 2 formulas - 1 that lengthens and 1 that volumizes. It's formulated without TEA, DEA, Parabens, Sulfates, and Phthalates and is made with clean ingredients, so it's safe for your eyes! To top it off, you can apply layer on top of layer without clumps, wear it all day, and easily wash it off. Lash Next Door comes in 1 color: Blackout - a black shade perfect for all lashes!

WHY CROWD FUNDING?

With the love and support of our followers, we have been able to create fun and entertaining content on Youtube for over 9 years! However, cosmetics is a new category for us, and we need YOUR feedback and help to bring our next project to life.

 

FAQs

 

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF YOUR MASCARA?

Lash Next Door is:

  • Volumizing
  • Lengthening
  • Nourishing
  • Conditioning
  • Easy to Remove

 

IS THE MASCARA FRAGRANCE-FREE?

Yes, our mascara is free from Artificial Fragrances. 

 

DOES YOUR MASCARA CONTAIN HARMFUL CHEMICALS?

Our mascara is formulated without:

  • Triethanolamine (TEA)
  • Diethanolamine (DEA)
  • Parabens
  • Sulfates
  • Phthalates
  • Petrolatum
  • Mineral Oil

 

WHAT'S TEA and DEA? WHY IS IT BAD FOR YOU?

The bestselling mascaras on the market contain Triethanolamine (TEA) and Diethanolamine (DEA), which act as an emulsifier to hold the formula together, amongst other things.  TEA and DEA is a reactionary by-product of ethylene oxide and ammonia, which are both highly toxic.  DEA can react with other chemicals to create a carcinogen called nitrosodiethanolamine (NDEA).  TEA is dangerous in large doses or with long-term use and linked to cancer and respiratory toxicity.  We didn't want to expose our followers to these toxic substances.  Protecting our followers is our number one goal, and we're thrilled to be able to say that our formula is TEA- and DEA-free.

 

HOW MANY USES CAN I GET OUT OF YOUR MASCARA?

Lash Next Door mascara should last 3-5 months if applied daily, although the rate of usage will vary based on how much you apply per application and how often you use the product. 

 

WHAT IS THE SHELF LIFE OF YOUR MASCARA?

Our mascara is stable for three years unopened from the date of purchase, and six months after opening.

 

IS YOUR MASCARA VEGAN?

Our mascara does not contain any animal products or animal-derived ingredients aside from beeswax, which was sustainably sourced and responsibly harvested.

 

IS YOUR MASCARA CRUELTY-FREE?

Brooklyn & Bailey is a cruelty-free company meaning we do not test our ingredients or finished products on animals at any stage of product development.  We are entirely against animal testing and we require the same from our lab partners.  We are in the process of becoming PETA and Leaping Bunny certified.

  • Final product tested on animals: NO
  • Third-party testing on animals: NO
  • Ingredients tested on animals: NO, the ingredients used are not currently tested on animals.  However, all cosmetic raw materials including water were tested on animals in the past.
  • Animal testing required by law: NO
  • Sold in China: NO.
  • Certifications: PETA- and Leaping Bunny- application in process.

 

IS YOUR MASCARA SAFE TO USE AROUND THE EYES?

Yes, our mascara is safe to use around the eyes and has undergone in-vitro eye irritation tests.  However, we advise against getting product directly into the eyes; this should be avoided.

 

WHAT IS YOUR COMMITMENT TO PRODUCT SAFETY?

We are committed to selling only safe products.  Our mascara was screened and tested for safety.  We conducted standard safety and microbial tests to ensure that our product is safe for humans.  These are safe and noninvasive human skin-patch tests, not tested on animals.

  • Eye Irritation by Irritection In vitro*
  • Repeat Insult Patch Test (RIPT)
  • Preservative Effectiveness Test USP [51]
  • Microbial Examination USP [61]
  • Lead & Mercury
  • Stability
  • Compatibility

 

IS YOUR PACKAGING RECYCLABLE?

Yes, our bottles are made of polyethylene terephthalate (PET) which is recyclable.

 

SHIPPING INFORMATION

 

WHERE ELSE CAN I PURCHASE THIS MASCARA?

At the moment, our mascara is only available for preorder through Indiegogo. 

 

IF I PREORDER THE MASCARA NOW, WILL I HAVE IT IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS 2017?

No, as our mascara is scheduled to be in production over the holidays.  It will be ready to ship in Spring 2018.

 

ARE YOU AVAILABLE IN OTHER COUNTRIES?

At the moment, the mascara is available only in the U.S.  We are in the process of registering our mascara with other countries and working on being compliant in US, CA, EU, among other countries for 2018.

 

RETURN & EXCHANGE POLICY

 

WHAT IS YOUR RETURN POLICY?

We want you to love your mascara.  If you are not completely satisfied with your purchase for any reason, please email us at admin@cutegirlshairstyles.com within 30 days of receipt and we will provide a return authorization and mailing information.  All returns will be refunded to the payment method that was used to process the order.  We appreciate your understanding that original shipping and handling charges are non-refundable.
